loans.name: Huệ

texts.en:
Huệ operates a fishing business.

Huệ is 26 years old, married, and has 2 children.

Huệ lives with 2 dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Huệ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Huệ has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Huệ has been involved in this business for 5 years.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a clean water system and a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

In the future, Huệ hopes for her business to do well, to build a new house, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan operates a fishing business.

Loan is 51 years old and she is married and has 4 children.
She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents

This is Loan's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Loan has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Loan faces in her life is not having a clean water system and a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profits, Loan hopes for her business to do well, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Vân

texts.en:
Vân operates a food stall and a business selling fish sauce.

Vân is 34 years old and she is married and has 2 children.
Vân supports 2 dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Vân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Vân has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Vân has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a clean water system and a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profits, Vân hopes to build a new house, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: 02040309 Thành Xuân _ Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Thanh has a manufacturing business making mesh nets. She is requesting a loan to purchase material to make nets for fishing.

Thanh is 40 years old and she is married and has 3 children..
She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 02040309 thành Xuân _Hoằng Trường solidarity group. 
Thanh lives with 3 dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2008, Thanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thanh has successfully repaid 7 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Thanh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Thanh hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase material to make nets for fishing.

loans.name: Thuận

texts.en:
Thuận operates a fishing business. Thuận has been involved in this business for 5 years.

Thuận is 30 years old and she is married with 2 children.
Thuận supports 2 dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Thuận joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thuận has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a clean water system and hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

In the future, Thuận hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain a successful business, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 50 years old and lives in Manga, Tangub City Misamis Occidental. She is married with eight children. Mercedita sells dried fish for a living and she has been doing this for one year. She has requested a loan to purchase additional goods for her business. 

Mercedita has been a member of PMPC for five months. In the future, Mercedita hopes to expand her business and she plans to have a sari sari store.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods for her business

loans.name: Thương

texts.en:
Thương operates a fishing business. Thương has been involved in this business for 7 years.

Thương is 34 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents.

In 2012, Thương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thương has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Thương faces in her life is not having a clean water cistern and hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profits, Thương hopes to remodel her house, to maintain a successful business, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Akouwavi

texts.fr:
Akouwavi, mariée et mère de 2 enfants vit dans le quartier  Bè.  Elle est âgée de 35 ans.  En 1999, elle commence la vente de cure dents et 2013 elle ajoute à cette activité la vente ambulante de Friperie. Etant une femme dynamique à son activité, elle s’approvisionne 2 fois par semaine et déploie 8 heures de travail par jour. Elle s’approvisionne au marché d’Hédzranawoé et quelques rares fois au marché d’Akodessewa.
 Pour augmenter ses revenus, elle sollicite un crédit pour pouvoir acheter 30 tas d’habits pour enfants, 26 tas d’habits pour femmes et une tige de cure dents.
texts.en: Akouwavi is a married mother of two and lives in the Bè district. She is 35 years old. In 1999, she started selling toothpicks. In 2013, she include with this business secondhand clothing. Since she is an energetic woman in her work, she gets her supplies twice a week and works 8 hours a day. Her supplies come from the Hédzranawoé market and rarely from the Akodessewa market. To increase her revenues, she is requesting a loan to be able to purchase 30 loads of children's clothing and 26 loads of women's clothing, and a [stalk] of toothpicks.

loans.use: to purchase 56 loads of secondhand clothing

loans.name: Familia Responsable (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Familia Responsable, está formado por 7 socias y 1 socio quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia Victoria del Portete en Cuenca, esta parroquia se encuentra localizada al sur de la Capital Azuaya, lleva su nombre en honor a la batalla ocurrida en sus campos, precisamente en las faldas del Portete, el 27 de Febrero de 1829. Su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y muchos salen diariamente a la ciudad a laborar en diferentes actividades. Las socias son personas amables y gentiles, se dedican a laborar en diferentes actividades las que les permiten solventar los gastos de sus hogares, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Fabiola, se encuentra realizando su segundo crédito a lado de sus amigas del grupo de crédito Familia Responsable, su grupo le gusta porque todos son familia y esta forma de créditos les ayuda hacer más unida y tener una mejor relación de amistad y compañerismo.
La Señora Fabiola tiene 20 años de edad, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido un hijo de 2 años, si esposo labora como jornalero, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de su padre y comparten los gastos.
Doña Fabiola pasa en casa al cuidado de su pequeño hijo, pero para ayudarle a su esposo a  solventar los gastos del hogar se dedica a la cría de gallinas y cuyes, también cultiva y lo que cosecha es para su casa y para la venta. 
El dinero de su crédito es para comprar gallinas, cuyes y semillas para sus cultivos. Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The loan group Familia Responsable (Responsible Family) was formed by 7 women and 1 man who live in the neighborhoods of the Victoria del Portete parish in Cuence. This parish is located in the south of the capital Azuaya. It was named in honor of the battle that occurred in its fields, exactly on the outskirts of Portete, on the 27th of February, 1829. Its people raise animals and work in agriculture, and many leave daily for the city to work in different activities. The members of the loan group are friendly and gracious people. They work in different businesses that allow them to pay the household expenses. They maintain the culture and traditions of their towns.

One of the members of this group is Señora Fabiola. She is taking out her second loan along with her friends from the loan group Familia Responsable. She likes her group because everyone is like family, and this form of credit helps them to become more united and to have a better relationship of friendship and camaraderie. 

Señora Fabiola is 20 years old. She is married and has a son who is 2 years old. Her husband works as a day laborer. They don't have their own house, so they live in her father's house and share the expenses.

Doña Fabiola stays at home to care for her little son, but to help her husband pay the household expenses, she raises chickens and guinea pigs. She also farms, and what she harvests is for their home and to sell.

The money from her loan is to buy chickens, guinea pigs, and seeds for her plantings. Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy chickens, guinea pigs, and seeds.

loans.name: Ayabavi

texts.fr:
Ayabavi vit dans le quartier de Bè-Kpota avec son mari et ses 5 enfants. Pour aider son mari à résoudre les besoins financiers de leur  famille, Ayabavi  débute  en 2005 la vente d’huile rouge  et  2012 ajoute à cette activité le commerce de Poissons frits. Elle s’approvisionne 2 fois par mois au port de pêche de Lomé et exerce 9heures de travail par jour. Elle fait une vente ambulante.
Pour augmenter ses revenus et répondre aux besoins des clients, elle sollicite un crédit pour 7 paniers de poissons moyens, 11 paniers de petits poissons et 10litres d’huile.
texts.en: Ayabavi lives in the Bè-Kpota district with her husband and her five children. To help out her husband in resolving family finances, she started selling red oil [palm nut oil] in 2005, and she included with this business fried fish in 2012. She gets her supplies twice a month at the fishing port of Lomé and works 9 hours a day. She sells door to door. To increase her revenues and respond to customer needs, she is requesting a loan for 7 baskets of medium-sized fish, 11 baskets of small fish, and 20 liters of oil.

loans.use: to purchase 7 baskets of fish

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim operates a fishing business. She is 36 years old and married with three children. Kim lives with three dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Kim joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Kim has successfully repaid one loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Kim faces in her life is not having a clean water system and hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Kim hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Thắng

texts.en:
Thắng is 41 years old, and she is married with two children. Thắng lives with two dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Thắng operates a fishing business. Thắng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. This is her first loan with Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. With her business profit, Thắng hopes to build a new house, for her business to do well and for her children to find a good job.

The main hardship that Thắng faces in her life is not having a clean water system and a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli is a 37 year old married woman and a mother of two children from Guindulman, Bohol. She has beens engaged in water purifying and refilling business for more than 12 years now. This is the source of her income.

Arceli is asking for a loan to buy more water gallons and water filters for the business. With this, she will be able to cater to more customers thus augmenting her sales and income.  Moreover, Arceli hopes of improving her business and making it a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more water gallons and water filters

loans.name: Lý

texts.en:
Lý operates a fishing business. Lý has been involved in this business for 7 years.

Lý is 28 years old and she is married with 2 children. Lý lives with 2 dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Lý joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Lý has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main harship that Lý faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase a tank and water filter.

In the future, Lý hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a tank and water filter.

loans.name: Huyền

texts.en:
Huyền has a manufacturing business making mesh nets. Huyền has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Huyền is 39 years old and she is married with 3 children. Huyền lives with 3 dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Huyền's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

The main hardship that Huyền faces in her life is not having a water tank and a water filter.She is requesting a loan to purchase a water filter and pipeline.

In the future, Huyền hopes to remodel her house, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase a water filter and pipeline

loans.name: 05-04-02 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Bình operates a food stall/restaurant selling eels. She is requesting a loan to purchase eels to cook soup to sell. Bình has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Bình is 60 years old and she is married with 4 children. She lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Bình is the group leader of the 05.04.42 Điện Biên solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. Bình joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in 2010 to improve her business. Bình has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Bình faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profits, Bình hopes to buy land of her own, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase eels to cook soup to sell

loans.name: 03.07.06 -Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Lệ is 41 years old and she is married with 2 children. Lệ lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Lệ works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Lệ has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Lệ faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Lệ is the group leader of the 03.07.06 - Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. This is Lệ's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her business profits, Lệ hopes for her children to find good jobs, to travel for vacation within the country, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Tâm

texts.en:
Tình is 36 years old and she is married with 3 children. She has a manufacturing business making mesh nets. Tình has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Tình lives with 3 dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Tình's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

The main harship that Tình faces in her life is not having a water tank and water filter. She is requesting a loan to buy a water tank and clean water filter. With her business profits, Tình hopes to remodel her house, to maintain a successful business, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and clean water filter.

loans.name: Thau

texts.en:
Thau has a retail business selling electronics supplies. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Thau is 58 years old and she is married with no children. She supports no dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thau's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

The main hardship that Thau faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine.She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks, and toilet equipment to repair her latrine/toilet.

With her business profits, Thau hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to repair a latrine/toilet.

loans.name: Đài

texts.en:
Đài operates a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Đài is 40 years old and she is married with 3 children. Đài lives with 3 dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Đài's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

The main hardship that Đài faces in her life is not having a clean water system and hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profits, Đài hopes for her business to do well, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is a 35-year-old woman from the town of Guindulman, Bohol. She is married with two children aged 11 and two years old respectively. She  engages in buying and selling scrap materials like iron, cans and empty bottles. Her business started quite a few years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy a weighing scale and more scrap materials to increase her income and to be able to provide her family with a proper diet and good living conditions.

In the future, Beverly hopes to expand her business and increase business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy a weighing scale and more scrap materials.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 23 years old and single. Her ambition in life is become successful and financially stable in the future. To achieve her goals, she aims to improve her small bakeshop by offering more kinds of bread recipes to her customers. Due to insufficient capital, she is seeking for a loan of PHP25,000.00 to buy flour, sugar, cheese, milk, yeast and other ingredients needed in the bakeshop. Through hard work and strong determination, she believes that she will be able to make her business grow and be more profitable.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cheese, milk, yeast and other ingredients needed in the bakeshop

location.town: Brgy. Malasin Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a 45-year-old woman from the town of Cortes, Bohol. She is married with 3 children ages 24, 20 and 16 years old respectively. Her husband worked as a welder to support their family. She engages in selling various items ranging from household wares, ready to wear items like shirts, pants and ladies accessories. 

Aside from that she also runs a motorcycle shop, to augment her income. Her business started quite a few years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy materials for her shop like acetylene, oxygen, tie wire and various dry good stocks, to provide her customers with the best service she can offer.   

In the future, Yolanda hopes to expand her business and increase the business’ profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy materials for her shop like acetylene, oxygen, tie wire and various  dry good stocks

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a 30-year-old woman from the town of Guindulman, Bohol. She is married with 5 children .The oldest child is 11 while the youngest is 6 months old. Her husband worked as a construction worker to support their family. She is into buying and selling frozen goods like ham, sausage, chicken and pork meat. This is her main source of livelihood. Her business started one year ago. She is asking for a loan to buy more frozen goods like meat, ham and eggs to increase her sales and to meet the family's daily needs. 

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and increase business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy more frozen goods like meat, ham and eggs

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is from Larena - Cangmangki, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor, Philippines. She is 44 years old as well as married with six children who are in school and of adult age.

In 2013, Candelaria applied for membership with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). Hearing about all the benefits, she never hesitated to become a member. She maintains her good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner. Recently, Candelaria asked for financial assistance of 11,000 PHP to purchase additional feeds and piglets. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income and to assist in the expansion of her business. She has found assistance to their financial needs through PMPC, and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and piglets.

loans.name: Sophoeurt's Group

texts.en: Aged 39 year-old, Sophoeurt is a mother of five children. She lives in a rural area of the Battambang Province. Sophoeurt has been in rice farming for 17 years and it has returned her about 48,000KHR per day to meet the family's need. This is not the first loan for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has managed her three past loans, which she has fully repaid back and these enable her to improved her lifestyle properly. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for smoothing land fees and fertilizer. She believes that she can develop her family’s lifestyle better than before.

loans.use: to pay for smoothing land fees and fertilizer

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia  is 68 years old, married a resident of San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City, Philippines. She earns a living through the income of selling livestock. 

She is a member of PMPC for 5 years and enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying a loan to purchase more bags of rice to sell.

Lilia deeply wishes to maintain a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of rice to sell

location.town: Oroquieta-San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City Misamis

loans.name: Roy

texts.en:
Roy lives in Larena - Cangmangki, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor, Philippines. He is single. In 2013, he applied for membership with Paglaum MPC. Hearing about all the benefits of being a member, he didn't hesitate to become one. He maintains himself as a credible member in good standing, and he always repays his loans in a timely manner.

Recently, he asked for a loan of 12,000 PHP for additional capital for hog raising. He has built new concrete pig cages in his hog raising and hopes to buy piglets and feeds. With this project, he hopes to raise more income and be of assistance in the expansion of his business. Roy has found comfort in his financial needs through Paglaum MPC of which he is very thankful with all of his heart.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets and feeds.

loans.name: Noeurm's Group

texts.en:
Noeurm is a married mother, blessed with two kids who are still under her responsibility. Noeurm is 60 years old. She lives in Battambang province. To make a living, she grows rice and works as a paid worker. She has engaged with this business for 40 years and she can earn 21,600 KHR in return. 

She is in her fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she is a team leader of four. As the leader, Noeurm will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, pesticides and to pay a fee to level her land. She has high hopes to upgrade her standard of living better than it’s current condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and to pay a fee to level her land

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 56 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez,  Misamis Occidental. She is single with one child who is now an adult and working as a seaman. 
Josie is a managing partner with her daughter in-law in their bakery business. The business earns approximately PHP 15,000 each month from the sale of bread, cakes, cookies and other products. She is also receiving a monthly allotment from her son of not less than PHP 5,000. She has requested a loan to be used to purchase an additional 10 sacks of flour, 5 sacks of sugar, 1 sack of salt, 1 tub of vegetable lard, 1 container of oil and other ingredients. 

Josie has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Josie hopes to expand the business.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar, oil, lard and other items

loans.name: Roeut's Group

texts.en:
Roeut is a farmer who grows rice in one area of Battambang province. She is a mother of three dependent kids, all of whom are in school. Her only source of income for 14 years has been rice farming and it has earned her 23,300 KHR per day to support the family.

Now, she is looking for a loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she is a leader of three. She is a second-cycle client. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes her living condition will be better.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and the fee for preparing the land

loans.name: Mesaid

texts.en:
Mesaid is married, and has one school going child. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past one year, she has operated a poultry selling business. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenges are high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the loan,she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feeds. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feeds

loans.name: Cochapamba  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Cochapamba está formado por 9 mujeres y 1 hombre quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, lugar que tiene hermosos paisajes para disfrutar de la calidez de la naturaleza, su gente es amable y gentil como las socias quienes trabajan diariamente para mejorar la economía de sus hogares para darles un mejor porvenir para sus familias, se dedican a los trabajos del campo como la agricultura o cría de animales, al comercio y muchos laboran en la ciudad ejerciendo diferentes puestos de trabajo.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Tania, está realizando su segundo crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito Cochapamba, le gusta su grupo de cerdito porque sus amigas le aconsejan y le guían en su vida. 
La Señora. Tania tiene 22 años de edad, es madre soltera de una niña de 3 años, vive en casa de sus padres y comparte los gastos del hogar.
Doña Tania pasa en casa al cuidado de su hija pero para salir adelante se dedica a las tareas del campo como es la crianza de pollos, cerdos y cuyes a los que los vende en la ciudad, también se dedica a la agricultura. 
El dinero de su crédito va a invertir para la compra pollos, cuyes, alimento para animales y semillas. Su meta es de tener un puesto propio en el mercado para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The loan group Cochapamba is composed of 9 women and 1 man who live in the area around the Valle parish in Cuenca, a place that has beautiful scenery for enjoying nature's warmth. Its people are friendly and polite, like the members who work every day to improve their households' financial situations in order to give a better future to their families. They do fieldwork, such as agriculture or raising animals, and work in business. Many work in the city in different jobs.

One of the members of this group is Tania. She is taking out her second loan alongside her friends and partners from the loan group Cochapamba. She enjoys her loan group because her friends give her advice and guide her in her life.

Tania is 22 years old. She is a single mother of a 3-year-old daughter. She lives in her parents' house and shares the household expenses.

Tania spends her time at home caring for her daughter, but when she goes out, she does farm work like raising chickens, pigs, and guinea pigs, which she sells in the city. She also works in agriculture.

She is going to invest the money from her loan in the purchase of chickens, guinea pigs, animal feed, and seeds. Her goal is to have her own stall in the market to sell her products.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, guinea pigs, animal feed and seeds.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

Halima thanks Kiva lenders for supporting her financially in her tailoring business.

She is asking for a loan to buy materials,thread for her business. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to buy materials,thread for her business.

loans.name: Jose Israel

texts.es: Israel, es un hombre de 43 años de edad, vive en Maldonado, parroquia de Tulcán, es muy responsable, tiene 10 hijos de los cuales tiene 5 hombres y 5 mujeres, de 24, 19, 16, 14, 12, 10, 8, 6, 5, 1 años de edad, los dos mayores le ayudan en los cultivos de naranjilla, los demás asisten a la escuela y colegio, vive con su esposa y con sus hijos. El es jornalero y se decida al cultivo de naranjilla. El necesita el préstamo para comprar fungicidas para el cuidado de los cultivos. Su sueño es poder terminar de educar a sus hijos y que siempre haya clientes de las naranjillas que el produce.
texts.en:
Israel is a 43-year-old man who lives in Maldonado, a parish of Tulcán. He is very responsible and has 10 children (5 sons and 5 daughters who are ages 24, 19, 16, 14, 12, 10, 8, 6, 5, and 1). The two oldest children help with cultivating naranjillas while the others attend school. Israel lives with his wife and children. He is a day laborer, but he also grows naranjilla.

Israel needs this loan so that he can buy fungicides for maintaining his crops. His dreams include seeing his children finish their education and always having customers who buy the naranjillas that he produces.

loans.use: to buy fungicides for his naranjilla crop.

loans.name: Bienvenida

texts.en:
Bienvenida is a married woman and a mother of three children from Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in a food vending business for more than three years now. She cooks and sells home cooked snack goods like fried banana to the people in her place. Her husband works as a carpenter.
Bienvenida is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like banana, flour, sugar, cooking oil, milk, meat and others. With this she will be able to cook and sell more thus augmenting her sales and income.  In the future, Bienvenida hopes of making her business a success thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like banana, flour, sugar, cooking oil, milk, meat and others

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her sister’s tuition fee in order to study nursing

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Meet Henry a farmer who hails from Kisii area of South Nyanza Kenya. He lives with his wife and 3 children all of school going age. He has been farming for 10 years with his primary source of income being eggs, tea, and a retail business.The major challenge that he faces is the diseases affecting his crops and livestock.
Henry chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because he wanted to begin dairy farming. During the training session, he learnt how to develop a savings culture. This dairy loan will provide milk for his family's consumption and also for selling and this will increase his income and thus improving their living standards.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: San Rafael Group

texts.es:
Las 17 integrantes de este comité cuentan con actividades variadas, por medio de las cuales ayudan a sus familias y les dan todo lo que necesitan para una vida digna y sin privaciones.
La señora Gladys es presidenta del comité, ella es separada y tiene tres hijos, por quienes lucha para poder darles todo para una vida digna. Ella se encuentra sola trabajado por el bien de su familia, y por medio de su oficio de peluquera está saliendo adelante. Su sueño es poder tener un salón de belleza grande y poder seguir ayudando a su familia por medio de su trabajo. Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de tintes, ruleros, tijeras, shampoo, y demás productos para poder seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The seventeen members of this committee have a variety of occupations through which they help their families. They give them everything they need for a dignified life lacking nothing.

Señora Gladys is the president of the committee. She is separated and has three children for whom she struggles to provide everything needed for a dignified life. She is the sole worker for the good of her family. She is getting ahead in her profession as a hairstylist. Her dream is to be able to have a

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of hair dyes, rollers, scissors, shampoo, and other products so that she can continue to provide her clients with the good service that she always has.

loans.use: to buy hair dyes, rollers, scissors, shampoo, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 60 little chickens and 300 kilograms of corn to feed pigs and chickens

loans.name: Koemsan's Group

texts.en: A villager from the Battambang province, Koemsan is a 33-year-old married mother of two kids who are still too young for schooling. To feed the family, Koemsan does rice farming and has worked as a hairdresser for additional income for ages. She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the last five loans and successfully paid them back. They had a positive impact on her family. Now, she is teamed up with a group of two. She is leading her group to ask for loan. As the leader, she will use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland. She hopes to collect a crop yield that is better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland.

loans.name: Dúo Mision Santa Group

texts.es:
DUO MISION SANTA
Doña María Emiliana es originaria de la aldea Xetzac Tecpan, tiene 35 años de edad bajo su responsabilidad están sus 3 hijos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboración de cortes típicos con telares y venta de cortes.
Gracias al apoyo de su esposo y al apoyo de  toda su familia ella sigue trabajando con su negocio, con el crédito que ella recibió  lo invirtió en compra de hilos para sus telares. 
El sueño de ella es ampliar mas su negocio sacar diferentes estilos de cortes ya que así obtendrá  mejores ganancias y así mandar a sus hijos a la escuela  para un futuro mejor,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la venta.
texts.en:
“Mision Santa” Group

Doña María Emiliana is originally from the neighborhood of Xetzac Tecpan. She is 35 years old and is responsible for three young children. María Emiliana produces traditional skirts with the use of a loom and sells her products.

Thanks to the support of her husband and her entire family, she is able to continue working at her business. The loan she is receiving will be invested in the purchase of thread for her looms.

María Emiliana’s dream is to expand her business so that she can produce different styles of skirts. This will help her to generate more income so that she can send children to school in order for them to have a better future. She is requesting this loan so that she can buy raw materials for the products that she sells.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making the traditional woven skirts that she sells.

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es: Miguel, es un hombre de 39 años de edad, vive en Maldonado, parroquia de Tulcán, es casado, tiene 7 hijos, 6 niños y una niña, sus niños tienen 15, 13, 12, 9, 8, y 3 años de edad y su niña 6 años, que asisten a la escuela.  Es alegre, trabajador y responsable. Desde hace un año atrás se dedica a la crianza de pollos, anteriormente solo se dedicaba al cultivo de naranjilla, ahora realiza estas dos actividades. El necesita el préstamo para comprar balanceados para la crianza de sus pollos. Su sueño es poder seguir con este negocio que le ha estado yendo muy bien, además que quiere darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 39-year-old man who lives in Maldonado, a parish of Tulcán. He is married and has seven children, six sons and one daughter. His sons are ages 15, 13, 12, 9, 8, and 3, while his daughter is 6 years old. All of them attend school. Miguel is cheerful, hardworking, and responsible.

A year ago, he began raising chickens. Before that he only grew naranjillas, but now he engages in both business activities. Miguel needs a loan so that he can buy balanced feed for raising his chickens. His dream is to continue with this business since it is doing very well. In addition, he wants to provide a good education for his children.

loans.use: to buy balanced poultry feed.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is single, 43 years old and living in Tangub City, Philippines. 

Nora is a farmer and grows coconuts to earn a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She has requested a loan to buy farm inputs.
 
Nora has been a member of PMPC for five months. In the future, Nora hopes to build a house of her own and have enough savings for her retirement.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Unión Trabajo Y Dasarrollo  (Rocafuerte) Group

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Unión Trabajo y Desarrollo se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Rocafuerte, lugar  conocido por la gran variedad de dulces que se preparan en este lugar y que son reconocidos  a nivel nacional por su delicioso sabor.
Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse hace tiempo atrás  y formar este Grupo De Crédito que les ha servido  de mucho ya que con los créditos han mejorado  sus pequeños negocios y su vida. Ellos se dedican a diversas actividades tales como agricultura, comercio en general, servicios, entre otras actividades.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Carolina, tiene 31 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 9  y 3 años, el mayor estudian en escuela. El marido es operador de máquina.
Doña Carolina en con la finalidad de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto darles lo mejor a sus hijos desde hace dos años atrás con lo que tenia y con ayuda de los créditos surtió una pequeña tienda de víveres en la casa que vive, ella antes tenía un restaurante pero lo tuvo que cerrar ya que no tenía muchas ventas razón por lo que decidió instalar su tienda con la cual a pesar que no es mucho el tiempo que lleva con ella le deja muy buenas ganancias las cuales le sirven para sacar adelante a sus hijos que son lo más importantes para ella. 
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para surtir su tienda. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan  los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un local propio para su tienda.
La foto pequeña es de una socia que no estuvo presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Grupo Crédito Unión Trabajo y Desarrollo meets every fifteen days at the Rocafuerte canton, a place known for its greta variety of sweets that are prepared in the area. They are renowned nationally for their delicious flavor.

This is a group made up of people that decided to join together a long time ago and start the Grupo De Crédito. It has been very helpful to them because the loans have improved their small businesses and their lives. They make their livings in different occupations such as agriculture, general retail, services, and other businesses.

One of the members of this group is Señora Carolina. She is 31 years old and is in a civil union in which she has had two children who are 9 and 3 years old. The oldest goes to school. Her spouse is a machine operator.

Two years ago, doña Carolina started a basic goods store in the house where she lives with what she had and the help of the loans. She did this with the goal of earning her own income, and with that income, giving the best to her children. Before this she had a restaurant but she had to close it because she did not have many sales. That is why she decided to start her store. While she has not had it very long, it has made her a good profit which have helped to get her children ahead and they are the most important to her.

This loan is to buy basic goods to stock her store. She has been a part of the Grupo De Crédito since it's beginning and she likes it because of the help that the loans give her. Her dream is to have her own storefront for her store.

The thumbnail photo is of one of the members that was not present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy basic goods.

loans.name: Bang's Group

texts.en: Originally from the Srey Snom district of Siem Riep province and 41 years old, she is also a mother of two school kids. To cover her family's cost of living, she has been growing rice as the main source of income for 23 years. This business has returned 23,300 KHR per day to her. She and her co-borrower have never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. As a leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor costs for her rice farmland. She hopes to gain a good crop yield that is better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for labor costs

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Sagrado Corazón De Jesús  (Montecristi) Group

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Sagrado Corazón De Jesús, este es un grupo formado por diez mujeres y dos hombres que tiempo atrás se decidieron a formar este grupo y acceder a los créditos que brinda la institución para mejorar sus negocios y su calidad de vida.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Nelly, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene  5 hijos mayores de edad pero el menor de ellos  aun viven con ella. Su esposo es trabaja en una fábrica de pescado en Manta.
Doña Nelly es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta trabajar y con su esfuerzo ayudarle a  su marido a salir adelante, ella  se dedica a la cría de aves de corral, tiene una pequeña granja de pollos que en temporadas compra de cien a doscientos pollos los cuales los cría durante dos a tres meses que es el tiempo para que ya estén listos para la venta,  cuando ya están listos los pollos los pela y los entrega a algunas tiendas de la localidad y también vende por libras por su casa. Trabaja de tres a cuatro horas al día en la alimentación y cuidado de sus animalitos y gracias a esto ella puede ganar algo en beneficio de su hogar si salir de su casa.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas para que tengan un mejor desarrollo. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan. Sus sueños son tener buena salud.
texts.en:
In the lowlands of Montecristi, a city known for the diversity of its traditional products (for example, the straw Panama hats known inside and outside of the country), the members of the loan group Sagrado Corazón De Jesús (Holy Heart of Jesus) meet every 15 days. This is a group composed of ten women and two men, who some time ago decided to form this group and gain access to the loans that the organization offers in order to improve their businesses and their quality of life.

One of the members of this group is Nelly. She is 52 years old and is married. From this marriage she has 5 grown children, but the youngest of them still lives with her. Her husband works in a fish factory in Manta.

Nelly is a persevering woman who likes to work and use her efforts to help her husband to get ahead. She works raising poultry. She has a small chicken farm; at times she buys from 100 to 200 chickens, which she raises over two to three months. This is the amount of time that it takes for them to be ready to sell. When they are ready, she plucks them and delivers them to some local stores. She also sells them by the pound from her house.

She works from three to four hours per day feeding and caring for her animals, and thanks to this, she is able to earn something to benefit her household without leaving her home. She is going to use this new loan to buy chickens, feed, and medicine so that they have better growth. She has been with the loan group from the beginning, and she enjoys it because of the help that it offers her. Her wish is to have good health.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, along with food and medicine for them.

loans.name: New York Group

texts.en:
Olivia is the featured borrower of New York group, she got along with her other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been best friends since they came to work as housekeepers in Lebanon, after they left their families and hometown to provide them with the necessary living needs.
Olivia is a 40-year-old divorced mother of one child, whom she is sacrificing her whole life to provide him with the necessary living needs and best education ever to make sure he is going to benefit from a better brighter future. 
Olivia is acquired loan will be invested in paying for her son's education needs in her hometown Philippine. She is very anxious about this loan and very happy at the same time that Al Majmoua is supporting them since they are considered as foreigners in Lebanon.
She is the first from the right, as for the other members Dara is the first from the right, and Arlene is the lady at the center of the picture.

loans.use: To pay for her son's education needs in her hometown Philippine

loans.name: Friendship 2 Group

texts.en:
Janet is the featured borrower of Friendship 2 group, she got along with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been dear friends since they left their hometown Philippine and came to work as housekeepers in Lebanon.
Janet is the second lady from the right with a black jacket, she is a 52-year-old married mother of three children, who works as a housekeeper to support her family in Philippine in their living.
Janet is a hard worker who puts so much effort on developing her family's living and replying to their needs, her acquired loan will be invested in paying for her children Secondary school costs in Philippine.
As for the other group members, Meriam is the first from the left with pink jacket,  Jovice the first from the right, and  Marlyn is the second from the left.

loans.use: To pay for her children Secondary school costs in Philippine

loans.name: Karen Yiseth

texts.es:
Las fortalezas son la responsabilidad, la honestidad, el respeto, la honradez, madurez para responsabilizarse en lo que se compromete; la debilidad el mal genio, sabe que tiene capacidad de entendimiento y conocimiento para poder desarrollar las metas propuestas 
Quiere realizar los estudios  para cumplir los sueños, metas e ideales donde también podrá contribuir a la sociedad con la educación de los pequeños de cero a seis años para que en un futuro los niños sean personas de bien, cree que un ser humano desde el vientre percibe todo lo que se encuentra a el alrededor por eso considera que a partir de allí se deben realizar estimulaciones  donde los pequeños se sientan en un ambiente de amor, paz y tranquilidad; y piensa que los menores tienen derecho a la educación   desde edades más tempranas.
texts.en:
The strengths of this student are responsibility, truthfulness, respect, honor, and having the maturity to take responsibility for her commitments. Her weakness is having a quick temper. She knows that she has the capacity for understanding and knowledge, which will enable her to progress toward the goals she has set for herself.

She wants to complete her studies so that she can fulfill her dreams, goals, and ideals. In addition, she wants to contribute to society by educating young children between the ages of 0 and 6 so that they can become good people in the future. She believes that human beings, from the time they are in the womb, are able to perceive all of their surroundings. For this reason, she believes that young children should receive stimulation so that they can experience an environment of love, peace, and tranquility. She also believes that children are entitled to an education at a very early age.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To cover her son's school fees

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a 59-year-old woman from the town of Guindulman, Bohol. She is married with 4 children. Her youngest child is 17 while the rest are adults. Her husband worked as a farmer to support their family. She engages in a food vending business. She sells home-made meals to customers in their community. Her business started almost 4 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy rice, vegetables, fish and condiments, to continue her daily source of living.
In the future, Leonora  hopes to expand her business to make it a success and to continue the schooling of her youngest child.

loans.use: to buy rice, vegetables, fish and condiments

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a fish vendor from Guindulman, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of two grown children. Edna has been engaged in a fish vending business for more than 3 years now. This is the source of her livelihood.
Edna is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell. With this, she will be able to improve her stocks thus allowing her to sell more. In the future, Edna hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a fish vendor from Guindulman, Bohol. She is a married woman and has been in the fish vending business for more than 20 years now. 
Elena is asking for a loan to buy more fish, buckets and a new weighing scale. With this, she will be able to sell more fish thus augmenting her sales and income. In the future, Elena hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more fish, buckets and a new weighing scale

loans.name: Taime

texts.en: Taime is 42 years old, married to a farmer and they live harmoniously in a peaceful village. Due to financial hardships, she and her husband work hand-in-hand to improve their farming business. They aim to expand their vegetable plantation in order to increase their production. Having inadequate capital, Taime wants to borrow PHP 20,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides needed in vegetable production. Being patient and industrious, they believe that someday they will improve their farming business as well as their status of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides needed in vegetable production

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Being a responsible father, Virgilio aims to improve his family's standard of living  and give them a better future. 
He is 60 years old and has three adult-age children. To have an additional source of income, he engages in a hog-raising business within the local community. He planned to acquire more pigs to raise but he has not enough capital. For this reason, he is asking for a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy hog feeds, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. Through this loan, he believes that he will improve the business and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy hog feeds, vitamins and additional piglets to raise

location.town: Brgy. Bitnong, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Ma. Chona

texts.en:
Ma. Chona is a 55-year-old married woman from Guindulman, Bohol. She operates an internet service in her community. This is the source of her income.
Ma. Chona is asking for a loan to pay for the repair of the computers. With this, she will be able to have customers in her store thus augmenting her income. In the future, Ma. Chona hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of the computers

loans.name: Carlito

texts.en:
Carlito is a 44-year-old married man from the town of Guindulman, Bohol, and he is the father of a 9 year old daughter. He operates a videoke service to customers in their community. His business started a few years ago. He is asking for a loan to buy electronic materials, plywood and other materials, to make sure that the videoke machine is in good condition, to last longer and so he can purchase food and have good living conditions.

In the future, Carlito hopes to expand his business and increase business profitability for the welfare of his child.

loans.use: to buy electronic materials,  plywood and other materials

loans.name: Al Huda Group

texts.en:
Amal is the featured borrower of Al Huda group, she got along with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends, and they are working hard to develop their socioeconomic situations in a well managed way.
Amal is the pregnant lady at the center of the picture, she is a 24-year-old married lady expecting a beautiful baby soon, who has been working from her house as hair dresser and makeup artist since two years ago. She used to work as a tutor, but she discovered her special talents in this domain and she is working hard on developing them easily.
Because of her low income at the meantime, and the increasing living needs, Amal is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to be ready to pay necessary hospital and expected baby's needs.
She is very anxious to hold her baby in her arms and is looking forward to develop her business to provide her beautiful family a better living.
As for the other group members, Fatima is the first from the left, and  Samira is the first from the right.

loans.use: To pay necessary hospital and expected baby's needs

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Meet Justine, a farmer from  the Kisii area of South Nyanza, Kenya who lives with his wife and 1 child. He loves farming and has been doing it for 4 years with his primary income sources being from milk, eggs, and a retail business. He stated what he loves most about farming is washing his animals to prevent east coast fever, while his biggest challenge is buying animal feeds.
Justine chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because it gives loans for dairy farming at a reasonable interest rate. During the training, he learnt how to do business commercially. He said that this loan will enable him to purchase a dairy cow for milk production to sell to provide for his family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
This is Margie, 23, resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. Single, she is living with her parents and she’s helping them financially. She is working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Margie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php20,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Margie dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes to give her children a good life and education.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en: Marisa engages in a hog-raising business to help her husband in gaining income. She aims to improve her business and increase her income to give her family a better future. To improve the business, Marisa is seeking for a loan of PHP 28,000 to buy hog feeds, vitamins, vaccines and additional piglets to raise. Through this financial assistance, she believes that someday she will improve the business and also their status of living.

loans.use: to buy hog feeds, vitamins, vaccines and additional piglets to raise

location.town: Brgy. Munguia,Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Luvizminda

texts.en:
Luvizminda is a 51-year-old woman from the town of Guindulman, Bohol. She is married with 3 children aged 21,18 and 14. She is a fish vendor. She sells various fish in the nearby market in their community. Her business started a few years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy additional fish, shrimp and crab, to increase her sales, to provide her children with proper food.


In the future, she would like to expand her fish vending business as well as to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional fish, shrimp and crab

loans.name: Ljubinka

texts.en:
Ljubinka is 58 years old and living in a minority community with only her husband. They both receive pensions and are very happy to have each other as they do not have any children. They live in a house which is very old and they didn't have any chance to do the renovation.
Now, Ljubinka is requesting a loan for the first time order to purchase materials to façade their house and pay for the labor on it. This loan will help him a lot because without it, they would not be able to get the work completed. Her goal is to improve the living conditions for her and her husband and they are very thankful for the support from the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials to façade house and pay for the labor

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more products for her direct selling business and she was also able to help her parents. Her income from business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She works hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP for her to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Linda hopes to be more successful in business and dreams to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 35 years old from Nyandarua and is married. They have four children who are aged between 17 years and seven years old.

Esther has a clothing business that she has been running for the past two years. She has applied for her first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable her buy more clothes to add to her stock.

She hopes to improve her business and family's living standards in the near future.

loans.use: To buy clothes to add to her stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase spare parts and replace them in his car by himself

loans.name: Mernalyn

texts.en: Mernalyn is a 44-year-old married woman and the mother of six children. She is trying hard to provide their needs, including food, health, clothing, and education. She is in the agriculture business of growing and selling coconut with the support of her husband who purchases additional coconut from their neighbor for her to sell in bulks in the market. Through this, she earns a good amount of income to support household expenditures. In order to improve her sales , she has requested a loan to buy additional coconut to resell. In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of the family.

loans.use: to buy additional coconut to resell

loans.name: Jasper

texts.en: Jasper, a young entrepreneur in a village located in Oroquieta City in Misamis Occidental runs a piggery to make a living. He has been doing this business for more than four years. Jasper earns well from this that he had saved a portion of his income for her future needs. Recently, he took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy feeds and piglets. In the future, he wants to improve the general living situation of his family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and piglets

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida is a 50-year-old married woman who is trying hard to provide her family needs.  She is in the agriculture business of growing and selling pigs with the support of her husband who works abroad. Through this, she earns well to support household expenditures. In order to improve her farm , she has requested a loan to buy piglets.  In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of the family.

loans.use: to buy piglets

loans.name: Goldyboe

texts.en: Goldyboe is a 22-year-old university student here in Oroquieta City. He is studying Bachelor of Science in Business Administration. He used to help his parents to earn the living of the entire family. He exclaims that once he receives the loan and join GDMPC, he promises to work very hard and make himself and everybody proud, especially my mother. He will also help other students in the future and contribute to the growth of the community. Recently, he took another loan to pay the tuition fee for second  semester.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee for second  semester.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
La Señorita Liz hoy tiene 24 años, es una joven muy trabajadora que lucha por su hijo, ya que quiere darle todo lo que ella no pudo tener. es artesana y comenta que por medio de ese oficio puede luchar por un mejor futuro para su hijo.
Comenta que por medio de su préstamo anterior ha comprado telas e hilos para hacer sus artesanías, con lo cual pudo cumplir con pedidos que tenia. Ella pide este nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo de nuevo en telas e hilos para poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Liz is now 24 years old. She is a very hardworking young woman who fights for her son, as she wants to give him everything she couldn´t have. She is an artisan and says that by means of this job she can fight for a better future for her son. She says that with her previous loan she bought fabric and thread to make her work, and so she was able to fill the orders she had.

She is requesting this new loan to invest it again in fabric and thread so she can continue working.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is a very dedicated daughter who wants to become successful in the future. She studied BS  Business Administration in a university. Her father is a farmer  while her mother as a flower vendor.  Her part time job as service crew at Jollibee helps her in her studies but to pay for the school tuition fees for the second semester is quite expensive aside from her school expenses. She need financial assistance to make it possible. With her GDMPC education loan, she will be able to pay for the school tuition fees and hopefully in the future, she would find a better job according to her desire.

loans.use: to pay for the school tuition fees for the second semester

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a hardworking 21 year old lady. She was  studying in a university taking up Bachelor of Science in Business Administration. 

Marites had seven siblings and she is someone who is very dedicated to her studies and love of family. Her father earns a living from his farm and her mother is businesswoman. She had a part time at Jollibee as service crew.

She is requesting this loan to pay the school tuition fees. Her goal is to fine better career and encourage his siblings to continue studying to earn better income for their own.In the future, she wants to become successful.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fees for the second semester

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Cayetano está en su ciclo número 4 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde son 22 las señoras que se ayudan para poder cubrir las necesidades de cada una.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Blacida quien través del esfuerzo y la dedicación ha podido ir mejorando su bienestar económico dentro de la familia, es una mujer luchadora que pone todo de su parte para salir adelante y generar nuevos ingresos dentro de la familia. Cuenta que ella es macatera (vendedora ambulante) y tiene todo tipo de productos que sale a vender de forma ambulante, es una persona muy sacrificada y luchadora. 
La Sra. Blacida solicita de este préstamo para la compra de ropas, zapatos y otros para su posterior venta dentro y fuera de la ciudad, con eso ella va mejorando su bienestar económico dentro del hogar.
texts.en:
The San Cayetano group is in their fourth loan cycle with the women's committee program. They are 22 women who help each other to provide for their individual needs.

One of them is Blacida, who has been able to continue improving her economic well-being in her family through her hard work and dedication. She is a fighter who gives it her all to get ahead and generate income in her family. She says that she is a travelling seller and that she has all kinds of products that she sells from place to place. She is a very self-sacrificing person and a fighter. 

Blacida requests this loan to buy clothes, shoes, and other items for later sale in the city and outside it. With this she will continue to improve the economic well-being in her home.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, and other items to sell

loans.name: Jorgelina

texts.es:
Jorgelina tiene dos hijos, es dueña de una de una casa de decoraciones y servicios para fiestas, ya hace más de 10 años que se dedica a ese trabajo, y su esposo es albañil contratista, trabaja en la Ciudad de Posada Argentina.
Jorgelina es una mujer muy trabajadora que con mucho sacrificio está saliendo adelante, y comenta que pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas para poder usarlo en la decoración de eventos, lo cual es su fuerte.
texts.en:
Jorgelina has 2 chilldren and she is the owner of a shop offering decorations and party services. She has made a living in this way for more than 10 years and her husband is a hired bricklayer, he works in the city of Posada, Argentina.

Jorgelina is a very hard working woman who has sacrificed a lot in order to get ahead. She mentions that she is requesting this loan to be able to invest in buying fabric to use as decoration in events, which is her speciality.

loans.use: to buy fabric to use as decoration.

loans.name: Sagrado Corazon Group

texts.es:
Sagrado Corazón  está en su 3er ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3 de las 17 señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, luchando por mejorar las condicione de vida de la familia de cada una de ellas.
Una de ellas es Rosa quien es una excelente cocinera, y lo demuestra ya que hace comidas y luego ella misma sale a vender de forma ambulante. Es una mujer muy luchadora que con esfuerzo  y dedicación pone su mejor esfuerzo para sacar adelante a su familia.
Ella se define a sí misma como una mujer que lucha por su familia, para poder darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para hacer sus comidas, como ser carne, condimentos, verduras, hortalizas y demás.
texts.en:
Sagrado Corazón is in its third loan cycle in the Women's Committee program, where all members are committed to working and helping each other get ahead. They are taking part in the "Poverty Stoplight" program, where 3 of the 17 women are currently living below the poverty line. They are struggling to improve each of their families' living conditions.

One of these members is Rosa, who is an excellent cook, and she gives evidence of this as she makes dishes which she herself goes out to sell as a street vendor. She is a woman who shows great effort and dedication as she fights to get her family ahead.

She describes herself as a woman who fights for her family to be able to give them everything that she herself never had. She is requesting this loan to be able to buy food supplies to make her dishes, such as meat, seasoning, vegetables, greens and other items.

loans.use: to buy meat, seasoning, vegetables, greens and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: begin the construction and outfitting of a storage building

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a coffee machine and stock for her business (cakes, cheese sticks, biscuits, etc)

loans.name: Mary Angellie

texts.en:
Mary Angellie, 21 years old, lives with her parents . Her earns a living from his transportation business. She is a student at the university taking up Bachelor of Science in Elementary Education.  

She is requesting a loan to pay her graduation expenses .After graduation from the university, it will be great help for the family. She will take the board exam to find a better career in the future.

loans.use: to pay for the graduation expenses

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Renacer, donde cada una vio una oportunidad de poder renacer por medio del trabajo en conjunto de todas ellas. Además están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para que cada una pueda mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de ellas es Romina, quien se dedica a ser manicurista, ella es una persona muy buena en lo que hace, ya que se ha hecho de muy buena clientela que siempre queda muy contenta con su trabajo. Su sueño es poder tener su propio salón y seguir creciendo, ya que es por medio de su trabajo que ella ayuda a sus seres queridos.
Romina pide este préstamo para la compra de esmaltes, limas, alicates, tijeras y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando y luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida. En la foto hay mas personas, ya que el grupo tiene 16 integrantes, pero solo 14 de ellas retiran este préstamo.
texts.en:
This group is called "Renacer" (Reborn) as each member has had the possibility to be reborn through a joint effort of all of them. Furthermore, they are taking part in the "Poverty Stoplight" program so that each of them can improve their living conditions.

One of the members is Romina, who makes a living as a manicurist. She is very good at what she does and this is shown by her numerous clientèle who are always satisfied with her work.

Her dream is to be able to have her own saloon and to continue growing, as through her work she can help her loved ones.

Romina is requesting this loan in order to buy nail varnish, files, clippers, scissors and other supplies. This way she can continue working and struggling to improve her living conditions. In the photo they are more people, as the group consists of 16 members, although only 14 are requesting this loan.

loans.use: to buy nail varnish, files, clippers, scissors and other supplies.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
“Mujeres Unidas” está en el 3º ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde una de ellas es la señora Nilda, quien se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma hace y que luego sale a vender.
Ella es muy luchadora y con mucho esfuerzo está saliendo adelante, por medio de la venta de comida que hace, es que da a su familia todo lo que necesitan para una vida digna.
Hoy ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en fideos, carne, leche, panificados, arroz, aceite, harina, etc., y demás productos para poder seguir con su trabajo, haciendo las comidas para la venta.
Ella agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo, que le permitirá poder mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
"Mujeres Unidas" is in its third loan cycle of the Women's Committee Program. One of its members is Nilda, who makes a living selling food which she makes herself and then goes out to sell.

She is a hard working woman who is making a great effort to get ahead by means of selling the food she makes, as through this she gives her family everything they need to have a dignified life.

Today she is requesting a loan to invest in buying noodles, meat, milk, bread products, rice, oil, flour, etc. and other products in order to continue her work making food to sell.

She is grateful for this opportunity she is receiving, as it will allow her to improve her life.

loans.use: to buy noodles, meat, milk, bread products, rice, oil, flour, etc. and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more repair parts for his maintenance store.

loans.name: Olgha

texts.en: Olgha is 40 years old married woman, from Telavi district. She lives with her daughter, who is a student and has no own income. Olgha is temporarily unemployed also and the family has income from transfers only. However it is insignificant for covering all daily expenses and she has great desire to start her own activity. Olgha requested a money for purchasing sewing machines and start working at private orders. Her request was approved with the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, that enables people to start or re-start businesses. She will make different kind of clothing and other home-needed products and generate her own income. With the help of this new activity Olgha will be able tackle financial difficulties and make better style of life for her daughter. She will be grateful for the help and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To purchase sewing machines

loans.name: Manuel Francisco

texts.es: Manuel, casado  con dos hijos mayores, trabajaba en una empresa reconocida hasta hace 10 años, en vista de su edad y la problemática para emplearse decidió trabajar de forma independiente; consiguió un carro adecuado para distribuir tintos y variedad de mecatos de manera ambulante para ganarse la vida. Manuel sueña con tener un negocio más amplio y mejorar sus ingresos, por ello, con el crédito solicitado comprará un carro nuevo porque el que utiliza está muy desgastado y surtido de mecato para ofrecerle a su clientela quien ya lo reconoce en el sitio donde se ubica diariamente, esto le traerá a él y a su familia mayor estabilidad económica y mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel is married and has two adult children. He worked in a well known business until 10 years ago when, due to his age and problems to find employment, he decided to work independently. He got a trolley to distribute coffee and a variety of snacks as a street vendor in order to earn a living.

Manuel dreams of extending his business and improving his income. For this reason, with this loan he will buy a new trolley, as the one he has is extremely run down, and a range of snacks to offer to his customers, who all know him where he sets his trolley every day. This will bring him and his family greater financial stability and will improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a new trolley and a range of snacks.

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en:
Meet Isaiah, a farmer living in Kisii area of South Nyanza in Kenya. This is primarily a sugarcane growing area. Isaiah is married and has one child of school going age. He loves farming and has been doing it for seven years. His primary sources of income come from milk, eggs, crops and a retail business. His biggest challenges in farming are crop diseases.

Isaiah chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because it gives loans to dairy farmers for building their farms and also because it provides these loans at a low interest rate. During the training, he learnt how to manage his loan. This loan will used to buy a dairy cow which will provide milk for both family consumption and for sale. He will use his income to meet his family's needs.

loans.use: purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: Safia is 51 years old married lady and is running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan for PKR 50,000 which she will use to buy stock of rice, sugar, grains and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Safia wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar, grains and flour.

loans.name: Sana

texts.en: Sana is 26 years old married woman and a mother of two. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She is doing it for the past four years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life.
