To help her continue operations of her business, she requested for a loan of PKR 40,000/- to buy a stock of threads in different colors with the packs of zippers and buttons to meet up with the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors with the packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en: Najma is 48 year old married woman. She has been doing business selling vegetables for the past three years. She is very enthusiastic person and manages to earn reasonable amount of money to support her family. She is a loving mother of five children and is responsible for their food, health and education. For the improvement of her business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase sacks of potatoes, onions and gingers. It will help her to inflate her sales. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, onions and gingers.

loans.name: Nerio

texts.en: Nerio is fifty-five years old. He is raising his family in a rural community. He aims to become financially stable in order to give his family a better future. To have an additional source of income, he runs a small variety store within their community, which his wife manages. To completely sustain their daily necessities, Nerio plans to improve their store to increase their income. Since they have inadequate capital, he is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy more stocks of grocery items, soft drinks and rice to resell. He is hoping that his loan request will be granted so they can improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of grocery items, soft drinks and rice to resell

location.town: Brgy. Malasin Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a fifty-four-year-old married woman and the mother of seven children. She is from Guindulman, Bohol in the Philippines. For several years, she has been engaged in a hog-raising business. This is the source of her income.

Elizabeth is asking for a loan to buy feed and additional piglets to raise. With this, she will be able to improve her hog raising business and, in turn, augment her income and profit. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Kathrina

texts.en:
Kathrina is a 32-year-old woman from the town of Guindulman, Bohol. She is married with 3 children aged 8, 7 and 3. 

Her husband works as a draftsman to support their family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various commodities like chips, bread, noodles, beverages, sugar and canned goods, and she started her business less than one year ago. She is asking for a loan to buy more stocks for the store in order to attract more customers.

In the future, Kathrina hopes to expand her business and increase profitability to provide for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy  more stocks for the store

loans.name: Jeniza

texts.en:
Jeniza is 25 years old and lives with her family. She is studying Bachelor of Science in Business Administration at the university . She chose this career path because of the wide variety of opportunities it can open up for her in the future.  In addition, she is also working as an administrative intern at a well-known business in her town and she a working student. 

With the support from this loan, Jeniza plans to  cover the cost school project and graduation fees.  She is grateful for this opportunity and the support she has received, and she plans to put her studies to good use by getting a job to support her family.

loans.use: to  cover the cost school project and graduation fees

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en: Shamshad, age 41, is a married woman.  She deals in business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is 50 years old, married woman and the mother of six children; one of her son is shown in the photo, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Naseem has applied for a loan of PKR 50,000, for her son. He wants to buy new tires with some auto spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Naseem is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires with some auto spare parts.

loans.name: Pathany

texts.en: Pathany is a 39-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (also shown in the photo) at the corner of her house. She has 02 years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts in years. She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Sultana

texts.en: Sultana, age 27, is a married woman and the mother of three children. She has been providing services of flour grinding in her community. She very well knows the techniques of grinding. By the time she has become famous for providing fine quality flour and earns enough to support the needs of her family members. In order to purchase a new grinding machine she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 40,000. It would help her to cater more customers time after time which ultimately help in generating more cash. She wishes to spend the part of profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a new grinding machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products for her grocery store to resell

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.en: Suhrob is an industrious man. He is twenty-two years old. Suhrob is a student of the third course Military Academy of Tajikistan. He studies well. He likes all the subjects he studies in the Academy. Suhrob wants to be a good officer. He is not married and lives with his parents. His parents are not able to pay for his tuition, so he is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to cover this. He awaits your support.

loans.use: pay for tuition

loans.name: Tareq

texts.en:
Tareq is a 22 years old single man from Qabatiya, a small village near Jenin city. he lives with his parents in the family house. His father is a worker with a low and unstable income. Tareq opened a small store for selling shoes. It is a good business and earns a good income. Tareq helps his family in paying part of their expenses. 
Tareq Took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of shoes for his store to resell. by taking this loan, Tareq will be able to increase his sales and also his income. 
Tareq appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new collection of shoes for his store to resell.

loans.name: Ulezi Group

texts.en:
RACHEL, who is in her early 30s is single with two children, a boy and a girl who are still at school. She has been running a charcoal business for one years now.  She works from 06am to 06pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be RACHEL's 6ty loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy sacks of charcoal and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She is doing great with the loan.  She used the profit to buy a plot of land, paid school fees and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal to meet her customer's demand.  She dreams of building her own house.

RACHEL will share this loan with her loan group "Ulezi" which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to meet  her customer's demand.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Samina, a 31-year-old married woman, runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, sewing and then selling it to the people of her locality.  She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. For the improvement of her business, Samina has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread and ribbons in various colors. These purchases will allow her to fulfill the demands of her customers on time. With a good credit history, this will be Samina's third loan. She dreams of providing better standard of living to her six children.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread and ribbons in various colors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For purchasing a dairy cow.

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen is a repeat client to the institution and she is securing a loan of UGX 5,000,000. The 36-year-old woman is single but has 4 children. She comes from the Rukungiri district in the town.

She deals in the sale of second hand clothes as her main source of income. She also does agriculture as her second source of income. From these businesses, she has been able to look after her family and also pay school fees for her children.

She appreciates KIVA and UGAFODE for the financial support rendered to her, and is hopeful that her business will expand.

loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Sadeeqan

texts.en: Sadeeqan is 44 years old married lady and is running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan for PKR 40,000 which she will use to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital. With good credit history, she is in her 5th loan cycle.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Alexis

texts.en:
Alexis is turing into a very promising business man.  With his last Kiva loan, Alexis successfully secured a large automotive client, allowing him to open a shop. His plan was to hire two graduates from a local automotive vocational school as apprentices, which he still plans to do once they graduate in June.  The loan from Kiva was Alexis' only hope to get his business in a position to grow, and with the loan he has been able to do so with very early success.  Thank you.

Given the professionalism and expediency that Alexis was able to deliver supplies to his automotive client, Alexis has been approached by an automotive vocational training school to provide construction materials as they expand their school.  This school is a project of Rwanda's Workforce Development Authority and funded by the World Bank.  As a main supplier, this would give Alexis a prime opportunity to be recognized by much larger and more influential companies.  The success of this would really set him on a path for massive expansion.

Alexis has been given a temporary order to supply the first round of construction supplies for the school.  Once he has proven that he has the capacity to complete such large orders, they will grant him the full 12-month contract.

Alexis needs a short-term loan of $25,000 so that he can meet his first order on time.  We know he can do it.  Alexis continually impresses us with his professionalism and strategic planning.  And, AEC has been with him along the way so that he can reach his dreams.

loans.use: To supply construction materials for a vocational training program.

loans.name: Peace

texts.en:
Peace is a 45-year-old lady with 7 children, four of whom attend school.  She operates a piggery project which is her main source of income. She is a widow and is responsible for all the financial needs of her family. 

She has been taking loans from UGAFODE for her project and other family financial needs. She is taking this loan to complete her house since her project alone cannot meet all her financial requirements. 

Peace thanks UGAFODE for their financial support which has enabled her to educate her children and make other family developments.

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en: Rehana, a 40-year-old married woman, runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, sewing and then selling it to the people of her locality.  She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. For the improvement of her business, Rehana has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy a new sewing machine, greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors. These purchases will allow her to fulfill the demands of her customers on time. She is in her 7th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is a 37-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts in years. She is a mother of seven children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en: Sughran  is 57 years old and works from home as a tailor. She is proud to be contributing to her household income. When Sughran was not earning her family was going through sever financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Her husband was the sole bread winner of the family, Sughran felt it obligatory to change her family’s living standards and started working from home. Her hard work helped her establish a good clientele but she is having difficulty in fulfilling large orders. For this reason, she has requested for PKR 40,000. She intends to use this loan amount to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces in various colors. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Tanzanite Group

texts.en:
Felista, who is aged in her early thirties, is married and has got four children of whom three are in school. She has had a mamalishe business for five years now. Felista opens her mamalishe business from 06:30am to 10:00pm per working day and is able to make a good profit per month. 

This is Felista's fifth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans all of which paid back successfully to buy food items to maintain her food stocks. Felista earned a profit which she used to pay part of school fees, household expenses and bought home fridge, TV and build a house. She is really happier with Kiva lenders support. She believe that one day she will be able to open a big shop and attain a successfully life. She will use this loan to replenish her food store with items like some kilos of rice, sugar, maize flour and some litters of cooking oil.

Felista will share this loan with his loan group "Tanzanite" which totals six months. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish her food store with items like some kilos of rice,sugar, maize flour and some litters of cooking oil.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is a 49-year-old fisherman from Guindulman, Bohol. He has been in the fishing business for several years now. This is the source of his income.
Noel is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and others. With this, he will be able to improve his catch thus giving him more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Noel hopes of making his business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and others.

loans.name: Imarika Group

texts.en:
Albert is aged early thirties and is a father of one son who is in school. He is married and for ten years now he has been managing a shop selling cellular phones accessories. He also repair and sell phones. Albert start working from 08am to 10pm per working day and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is his sixth loan request which he will use to buy new phones and accessories for his shop. With his previous loans all of which paid back successfully, Albert used to buy cellular phones for his shop to grow. He dreams that one day he will be able to buy his own shop stocks from China. He received an extra income which he used to repair his house and covered school fees and home food expenses. 

Albert will share this loan with his loan group " IMARIKA" which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new phones and accessories for his shop.

loans.name: Gilberta

texts.en: Gilberta is a married woman from Guindulman, Bohol. She has been in the fish vending business for more than 15 years now. This is the source of her income.  Gilberta is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell and buckets for storage.  In the future, Gilberta hopes of making her fish vending business a success.

loans.use: buy more fish to sell and buckets for storage.

loans.name: Ma. Milagrosa

texts.en:
Ma. Milagrosa is a married woman and a mother of three children from Guindulman, Bohol. She operates a rice milling machine. This is the source of her income.

Ma. Milagrosa is asking for a loan to pay for the repair of the rice milling machine. In the future, she hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of the rice milling machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For purchasing a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel is a hardworking 18 year old lady. She was  studying in a university taking up BS Business Administration. 

Anabel had two siblings and she is someone who is very dedicated to her studies . Her father worked as a farmer. She helps them lessen their expenses by studying as a working student.

She is requesting this loan to cover the costs for school projects and graduation fees. Her goal is to fine better career to earn better income .In the future, she wants to become successful.

loans.use: to cover the costs for school projects and graduation fees

loans.name: Nyasha

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 31-year-old Nyasha from Gokwe. He is married with two children. He also cares for one other dependent. Nyasha runs a retail business selling groceries and clothing. The business has been in operation for 6 years. He says the main challenges are a lack of access to cheap finance and business depends on the cotton-selling season. Nyasha has requested a loan of $750 to buy stocks for his grocery shop. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to greatly improve his family's welfare. In the future Nyasha plans to open more grocery and clothing shops which will be strategically located within Gokwe and beyond.

loans.use: to buy stocks for his grocery shop.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov, aged 41, lives in a rural village in the Borseth district and has four children. She and her husband are rice farmers. She has been in this business for 23 years, earning about US$5 each day after daily expenses. 

Pov is the first-cycled client with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to pay for her son’s University course. She hopes that her son will get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s University.

loans.name: Ada

texts.es:
Ada, es una joven microempresaria, vive en la ciudad de Villa Elisa, en la casa de sus padres, tiene 25 años de edad es soltera, sus padres también son clientes de la fundación, y poseen cuenta que tienen un autoservice en su casa.
Ada ya  ha terminado sus estudios terciarios y se recibió en la carrera de Idóneo en Farmacia. Estuvo trabajando un tiempo en una cadena de Farmacias muy conocida en la ciudad.
Más adelante quiso independizarse y crear su propia Microempresa, y abrió un local de venta de Artículos de librería, ropas, mercerías y bazar en general, además se dedica a realizar comidas rápidas como hamburguesas, lomitos, y  panchos  para eventos infantiles, cumpleaños, para lo cual cuenta con su propio  equipo de trabajo.
El préstamo solicitado fue para ampliar su Stock de productos,  específicamente en los artículos de librería porque ya iniciaron las clases y cuenta con una demanda de pedidos.
Piensa en un futuro poder seguir trabajando  de esa manera ir ampliando su Microempresa.
texts.en: Ada is a young microentrepreneur who lives in the town of Villa Elisa at her parents' house. She is 25 years old and single. Her parents, also clients of the lending institution, operate a small supermarket at their house. Ada graduated as a pharmacist's assistant from a post-secondary education course. She worked at a famous pharmacy chain in the city for a while, but then chose to become her own boss and have her own business, so she opened a small shop where she sells stationery items, clothes, haberdashery, and other useful items. She also has a small catering service, fulyl equipped, and makes fast-food such as hamburgers, pulled pork, and hot dogs for children's parties and birthdays. She asks for a loan in order to replenish her stock, especially stationery items, since the school season started and she has lots of customer orders waiting. Her plans for the future include expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy stationery items to sell.

loans.name: Uhuru Group

texts.en:
DORA, who is in her mid 30s is single with three children who are still going to school. She has been a food vendor for three years now. She works from 05am to 10pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be DORA's 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy more stock of food and sold to more people.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She is happy with the loan. She used the profit to pay school fees and household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy maize flour, beans, baking flour, cooking oil, sugar and  charcoal for cooking. She dreams of buying a plot. 

Dora will share this loan with her loan group "UHURU" which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, beans, baking flour, cooking oil, sugar and  charcoal for cooking.

loans.name: Nosotras Podemos Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama “Nosotras Podemos”, ya que todas ellas tienen la firme convicción de que ellas pueden mejorar sus vidas y las de su familia por medio de su trabajo en conjunto.
Una de las señoras Laura, quien es una persona muy trabajadora, comenta que es empleada, pero que también se dedica a la venta de carbón, como un medio de poder ayudar a sus seres queridos con su trabajo. Comenta que le va muy bien ya que la venta de carbón  va cada vez mejor, ya que es más económico, y la gente lo prefiere.
Laura pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de carbón, ya que así podrá seguir trabajando y luchando por mejorar sus ingresos, y dar a su familia lo que ella no pudo tener.
texts.en: This group is called 'Nosotras Podemos' (meaning 'We can') because all of the members share the strong conviction that they can improve their lives and those of their families by working together. One of them is Laura. She is very hard-working and says that she works as an employee but also sells charcoal so as to earn more money to help her loved ones. Business is booming, she adds, because charcoal is cheap and thus a favoured method for heating. Laura asks for a loan in order to buy more charcoal to sell. Her goal is to keep working and fighting to increase her income and thus give her family the opportunities she never had.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Tubadilike Group

texts.en:
Marco who is in his late thirties, is single and has got two children who are in school. For five years now, Marco has been managing a business of m-pesa, sell bricks and iron-scraps. He opens his business from 08:00am to 09:30pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This is his fifth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Marco used the previous loans which paid successfully to buy bricks making materials and bought iron-scraps which resold.  Marco managed to earn an extra income which he used to cover school fees and home food expenses. He will use this loan to buy business stock of bricks making materials and iron-scraps. He dreams that one day he will be able to open his own company.

Marco will share this loan with his loan group" TUBADILIKE" which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy business stock of bricks making materials and iron-scraps

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is studying Bachelor of Science in Information Technology   at the university in Oroquieta City. Her father earns from employment as a welder while her mother has a buying and selling business. 

This semester, Edna needs to pay for additional miscellaneous expenses and books. She borrowed from the GDMPC  and she is thankful that her needs were settled. In the future, she wants to be successful in her career and able to help her family.

loans.use: to pay for additional miscellaneous expenses and books

loans.name: Tupendane B Group

texts.en:
FATUMA, who is in her early 30s is single with one child who is at school. She has been running a business of selling fruits and vegetables for three years now.  She works from 10am to 6.30pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be FATUMA's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to buy fruits and vegetables and has paid back her loan successfully.  She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for supporting their group with the loan which has made them smile. She used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to increase on the fast moving items like water melon, mangoes,tomatoes and onions. She dreams of owning a big retail shop.

Fatuma will share this loan with her loan group "Tupendane B" with three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on the fast moving items like water melon, mangoes,tomatoes and onions. cocoa nuts and

loans.name: Mistubishi Group

texts.en:
CHARLES who is in his late twenties is single with one child who is still small.  He has been running a small general store for two years now.  He works from 07am to 06pm daily and able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be CHARLES's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to buy small items which are fast moving items like juice, sodas, biscuits, sweets, g.nuts, baobab seeds mixed with sugar,cigarettes,half cakes and water.  He has paid back his loan successfully.  He used the profit for household expenses.  He will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in his small shop.  He dreams of building his own house.

CHARLES will share this loan with his loan group "MISTUBISHI" with two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in his small shop.

loans.name: Ángela Janet

texts.es: Ángela es una mujer soltera y tiene un hijo mayor de edad, trabajaba inicialmente con un negocio de lavadoras en la zona  rural, en vista de lo poco rentable que se puso el negocio, optó por iniciar con un negocio en informática donde presta el servicio de internet, play station, y más, de esta forma genera los recursos para brindar sustento a su familia. Ángela sueña con ampliar su negocio y en el futuro poder adquirir una casa propia. Actualmente utilizará el préstamo comprando un computador, un televisor, una vitrina, un play station, para ofrecer mayor cobertura para sus clientes y vecinos quienes utilizan con mucha frecuencia los servicios que ella presta en su negocio, así sus ingresos mejorarán de forma extraordinaria y podrá cumplir con sus obligaciones, mejorar su nivel y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ángela is a single mother and has an adult son. She originally worked for a washing machine business in the rural area, but seeing how little profit the business was making, she decided to start up an information business where she provides a service of internet access, play station and more. By doing this she earns an income to support her family.

Angela's dream is to expand her business and to have a house of her own in the future.

Currently she will use the loan to buy a computer, a television, a play station and a display cabinet, to provide better access for her customers and neighbours who often use the services she provides in her business. This will give her additional income and she will be able to meet her obligations and improve her standard and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a computer, a television, a play station and a display cabinet.

loans.name: Nkosana

texts.en: Greetings from Bulawayo, the second largest city in Zimbabwe. Nkosana is forty years old, married and a father of two. The children are both attending school. Nkosana operates a retail shop selling leather products that he makes himself. He also does repair jobs on leather products. He manufactures handbags, shoes, belts and sandals. Nkosana's biggest challenge is not being able to meet the demand for his products. He has requested a $600 loan to buy leather. Part of the income generated by the loan will be reinvested into the business. The rest will be used to meet his family's day-to-day needs. He plans to open a factory and be one of the major leather product suppliers in the city.

loans.use: buy leather to make and repair handbags, shoes, belts and sandals

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy dried vegetables, beans, and groundnuts for sale

loans.name: Virgen Del Pilar Group

texts.es:
El comité Virgen del Pilar se conformó en el año 2008, y con mucho esfuerzo se encuentran en el ciclo 11, donde trabajan en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa. Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta, a la vez se ayudan mutuamente.
Una historia es la de la Sra. Flavia, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas y todo tipo de artículos de mercería, ella comenta que mediante este negocio la economía de la familia mejoró mucho y pudo mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
La Sra. Flavia pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de ropas variadas para la venta, lo que le permitirá seguir con su trabajo de la manera que viene, pero luchando por ir mejorando. 
En la foto del grupo aparecen más personas, ya que el grupo tiene 14 integrantes, pero solo 10 retiran préstamo en esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
The Virgen del Pilar communal bank was set up in 2008 and after a lot of hard work they are now in their 11th loan cycle, where they work jointly and support each other within the programme. Apart from each member's own independent work, they also carry out activities jointly and provide mutual support. 

One case history is that of Flavia. She sells clothing and all sorts of haberdashery. She says that through this business her family's financial situation has improved a lot and she has been able to make improvements to her home. 

Flavia is asking for this loan to buy assorted clothing to sell, which will enable her to carry on with her work as she has until now, while striving to keep improving. 

In the photo there are extra people, since there are 14 members in the group, but only 10 of them are taking out a loan on this occasion.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Arusha Group

texts.en:
HUSNA who is in her mid 20s is married with one child who is still at school. She has been running two projects, fruits and vegetables business and selling fabrics door to door for one year now.  She works from 07am to 06pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be HUSNA's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to restock the out of stock items in the fruits and vegetable and increased stock of the fabrics.  She is doing very well with the loan.  She appreciates Kiva for supporting their group. She used the profit to pay school fees and covered house hold expenses.  Husna will use this loan to buy fruits,vegetables and fabrics to resell. She dreams of owning a food vendor business.

Husna will share this loan with her loan group "Arusha" which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fruits,vegetables and fabrics to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products for his accessory stall to resell

loans.name: Pilika Group

texts.en:
OCTAVINA who is in her early 40s is married with three children who are still going to school. She has been running two projects, selling cold drinks and stationary selling.  She has been in her projects since 2012. She works from 6.30am to 10pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will  be OCTAVINA's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy more drinks and increased on the stationary stock and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She is doing great! She really appreciates Kiva for supporting their group.  She used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to restock the missing items in the drinks stock  and  to increase on the stationary stock.  She dreams of building her own house.

OCTAVINA will share this loan with her loan group "Pilika"" which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the missing items in the drinks stock  and  to increase on the stationary  stock.

loans.name: Amkeni Group-Msm

texts.en:
Samweli, who is a father of three children, is early 30s. His children,three boys, are schooling. For seven years now, Samweli makes his family living by running a fish business. He live close to the lake where is easier for him to order his fish stock. He start selling his business stock from 08am to 03pm daily and is able to make a good profit per month. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is Samweli's fourth loan request which he will use to buy stock of fresh water fishes to resell. With the previous loans all of which paid back successfully, bought fish stocks to grow her capital. Samweli normally buy extra sack away from normal size at the time of receiving loan. This help him to make more sales and grow his extra income for his both business and family surviving. He dreams to have another business of wholesale shop. Samweli received and extra income which he used to build a business premise and covered school fees and household expenses. 

Samweli will share this loan with his loan group" AMKENI GROUP-MSM " which totals five members. The member of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stock of fresh water fishes to resell.

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es: María, con dos hijos menores de edad, ha sido una mujer emprendedora y dedicada a su labor, lo cual le ha permitido brindarle el estudio a sus hijos hasta el presente, tiene una tienda  en la que trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 8 pm, María sueña con tener una mejor adecuación de la tienda,  ampliarla y comprar surtido para tener un buen stock de gran variedad, con el préstamo adecuará la tienda y surtirá al por mayor (mecato, gaseosas, lácteos, etc), así continuará brindando un buen servicio y surtido variado para satisfacer los gustos de su clientela, con lo que sus ingresos irán en aumento y disfrutará con su familia de un bienestar y confort sin mayores problemas.
texts.en: María has two young children and is a hard-working entrepreneur. She has been able to send her children to school thanks to her shop, where she works every day from 8 am to 8 pm. Her dream is to improve her shop and its displays, and to buy more merchandise, so as to have a greater variety of products on offer. She will do all this with the loan, including buying merchandise wholesale, such as pastries, fizzy drinks, and dairy products. Her aim is to keep providing a good service and to meet varied demand, so as to keep her customers happy. She hopes for an increase in income that will help her family live in comfort and without any major problems.

loans.use: to improve her shop and buy merchandise wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy all the materials for improving the business (paint, cement, plaster, sand etc.) as well as supplies such as various fruits, sugar, disposable cups etc.

loans.name: Primero De Noviembre Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Primero de Noviembre está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 9 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
La Sra. Reinalda, es integrante de este grupo,  es empleada doméstica por medio día y en las tardes se dedica a la venta de comestibles, es así que ayuda a su familia a darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Reinalda es una mujer muy dedicada, que pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para hacer comidas, ya que así podrá seguir luchando y mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: The group named 'Primero de Noviembre' (means 'First of November') is in its first loan cycle with the lending institution and belongs to the Women's Committe programme. All of the members work together and help each other to improve their lot in life. The institution gives the members of every new group it works with a questionnaire designed to determine their level of poverty in order to help them get out of said poverty. It emerged from the questionnaires given to this group that 9 of its members live under the poverty line. Reinalda works mornings as a domestic employee and sells food to go in the afternoon. This is how she makes sure her family has everything she could not have. Reinalda is hard-working and asks for this loan in order to buy ingredients to prepare food to sell. Her goal is to keep fighting and to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Kuña Guapa está en su ciclo número 4 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de sus seres queridos.
Liz integra este grupo, y ella comenta que se dedica a la venta de ajos, y aunque es un trabajo muy humilde, es la forma en la que ayuda a su familia. Es muy sacrificada y con gran afán está trabajando para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
La Sra. Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de ajos, envoltorios, bolsas, etc., con lo cual podrá seguir con sus ventas y mejorando sus condiciones de vida  la de su familia.
texts.en: The group 'Kuña Guapa' is in its fourth loan cycle within the Women's Committee program. They replied to a questionnaire about poverty so as to improve their standard of living and that of their loved ones. Liz is a member of the group and says that she sells garlic for a living. Although she speaks of it as a very humble job, she is happy that it enables her to help her family. She would do everything for her family and spares no effort to work hard and improve their standard of living. She asks for a loan in order to buy garlic, wrapping paper, bags, and other items, in order to keep on with her sales and improve her standard of living and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy garlic, wrapping paper, bags, and other items.

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
El señor Ignacio tiene 27 años, es soltero, es macatero (vendedor ambulante), se dedica a la compra y venta de todo tipo de electrodomésticos y muebles para el hogar como ser, planchas, juegos de sillones, licuadoras, cafeteras eléctricas, hornos, conservadoras, etc. Sus ventas lo realiza al contado y a crédito, tiene clientela conformada por comerciantes, docentes y empleados.
Ignacio es una persona muy trabajadora que lucha por sus seres queridos para que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de necesidades. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de planchas, juegos de sillones, licuadoras, etc., que le permitirá seguir con sus ventas, y luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Ignacio is 27 and single. He is a travelling salesman, which means he buys and sells all kind of electronics and furniture for the home, such as planks, assorted armchairs, blenders, coffee-machines, ovens, freezers, etc. He sells both cash and on credit. His customer base is made up of merchants, teachers, and employees. He works hard and fights for his loved ones, so that they want for nothing. He asks for this loan in order to buy planks, assorted armchairs, blenders, etc. in order to keep on with his business and thus improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy planks, assorted armchairs, blenders, etc.

loans.name: Marcia

texts.es:
La señora Marcia es de la ciudad de San Pedro,  tiene dos negocios una despensa que esta situada en su propia casa y una mercería en el centro de la ciudad en el mercado, también es funcionaria pública.
Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora, que como se ha podido ver lucha por su familia, para poder darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener, y que no tenga que pasar por necesidades.
 Ella pide este préstamo para renovar los productos en su negocio de venta de ropas y surtir la despensa que tiene, y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Marcia comes from the city of San Pedro. She has two businesses: a grocery store which is located in her own house and a haberdashery stall in the market in the city centre. She is also a civil servant. She is a very enterprising woman and this is how she has been able to work hard for her family, to give them everything that she couldn't have and to make sure they don't have to go without anything.

She is asking for this loan to update the stock in her clothing business and to stock her grocery store, so she can continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell and supplies for the grocery store.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
Virgen del Carmen está en el 2do ciclo el programa de Comité donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Heidi, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de especias, esta actividad lo realiza desde su casa y tiene clientes del barrio que acuden diariamente. 
Su lucha es para poder ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo, y de esa forma darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener. El préstamo lo quiere invertir para la compra de especias, que podrá vender, y de esa forma seguir luchando por mejorar su vida.
Ellas agradecen por la oportunidad que ellas están recibiendo, ya que les será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The 'Virgen del Carmen' group is in the Committee's second loan cycle. One of the members is Heidi, who makes a living preparing and selling spices. She does this from her home and has customers from the neighbourhood who come to her every day. She strives to help her family through her work and, in doing this, tries to give them everything that she couldn't have.

She wants to use the loan to buy spices which she will be able to sell, thus continuing in her quest to improve her life. 

The women are grateful for the opportunity they are being given, since it will be a great help to them.

loans.use: to buy spices to sell.

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  femmes du groupe Djiguiya vivent toutes dans des familles monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 28 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Darsalam de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la Républiques du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier de Darsalam. Elles font  de la restauration et le petit commerce  de fruits et légumes, de grains. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  1ére cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Fatoumata (1ére femme debout de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de galettes dans le quartier  de Darsalam et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs de mil  pour la satisfaction de la demande  clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Fatoumata espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de  20 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé  pour la prise en charge d’une partie des dépenses familiale et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The four women of the Djiguiya Group all live within monogamous families. These women have an average age of 28 and around three children each. They all live in the Darsalam district of Ségou (the fourth largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali). They know each other through the ties of neighbourhood, family, marriage and their revenue-generating businesses in Darsalam district. They run food stalls and sell fruits, vegetables and grains. 
In order to increase their business funds, the members of the the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. This will be their first loan with them.

Fatoumata (the woman standing to the left of the photograph) is a top pancake seller in both the Darsalam district and its surrounding areas. She plans on using this loan to buy two sacks of millet for making pancakes in order to satisfy the demand from her customers. She sells her produce for cash, but often in exchange for credit, to a mixed customer base. With this loan, Fatoumata hopes to be making an average monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA. These profits will be used to meet her family's needs and to increase her business funds.

loans.use: to buy millet

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Benkadi vivent toutes dans des familles monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 43 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la Républiques du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenus dans le quartier Hamdallaye. Elles font le petit commerce, de condiments et de la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  5éme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Koniba  (1ére  debout de la  droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de galettes et de sauce dans le quartier  Hamdallaye et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 6 sacs de mil pour faire des galettes  afin de satisfaire clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Koniba  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de  55000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé  pour subvenir aux petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The four women of the Benkadi Group all live within monogamous families. These women have an average age of 43 and around four children each. They all live in the Hamdallaye district of Ségou (the fourth largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali). They know each other through the ties of  neighbourhood, family, marriage and their revenue-generating businesses in Hamdallaye district. They work in retail, where they sell condiments and run food stalls. In order to increase their business funds, the members of the the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. This will be their fifth loan with them. 

Koniba (the woman standing to the left of the photograph) is a top pancake seller in both the Hamdallaye district and its surrounding areas. She plans on using this loan to buy six sacks of millet for making pancakes in order to satisfy the demand from her customers. She sells her produce for cash, but often in exchange for credit, to a mixed customer base. With this loan, Koniba hopes to be making an average monthly profit of 55,000 FCFA. These profits will be used to meet her children's needs and to increase her business funds.

loans.use: to buy millet

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Sagrada Familia está en su ciclo número 6º , ellas participan activamente en las actividades propuestas por el grupo, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que tienen dentro del  grupo.
Jorgelina es la presidenta del comité, ella vende comidas que ella misma hace, y que sale a vender en forma ambulante. Ella es una persona muy sacrificada y luchadora que quiere dar a sus seres queridos las comodidades de una mejor vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder seguir haciendo los comestibles que vende, y que es la manera en la que ayuda a sus seres queridos.
texts.en: The group 'Sagrada Familia' (means 'Holy Family') is in its sixth loan cycle with the lending institution. It takes an active part in the activities proposed to it. All the members help each other to reach their common goals. Jorgelina, the group's president, sells food she prepares herself, door-to-door. She spares no effort in her struggle to give her loved ones a good and comfortable life. She asks for a loan in order to buy the ingredients she needs to prepare the food she sells. This is how she helps her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food to sell.

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
En este grupo llamado Santa Librada, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde gracias al trabajo que ellas están haciendo han mejorado bastante su situación.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Julia quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, es decir que ha mejorado su situación económica, a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo. Ella se dedica a las ventas, ya que tiene una despensa en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas.
Julia pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, frutas, carnes, enlatados y demás, con lo que podrá surtir su despensa y dar a sus clientes todo lo que piden y seguir también ganando los ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
In this group, which is called 'Santa Librada', the women are doing the poverty elimination survey, in which they have improved their situation considerably through the work they are doing. One of the members is Julia, who had a poverty level below level three in her last survey, which means she has improved her financial situation through dedication and continuous hard work. 

She makes a living in retail, as she has a grocery store where she works every day from very early in the morning.

Julia is asking for this loan to buy fruit, vegetables, meat, tinned goods and other items. This will enable her to stock the grocery store and provide her customers with everything they ask for. She will also continue to make an income to help her family.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, meat, tinned goods and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a refrigerator so he can sell frozen food too.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cloth material to make African attire, seat covers and bed covers

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en: Angeline is 40 years of age and blessed with three school aged children.  She is engaged in the buying and reselling of fruits and vegetables within the local community.  Due to high cost of school fees, Angeline aims to improve her business in order to increase her income.  Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000.00 to buy more stocks of fruits and & vegetables to resell.  She is hoping that her loan request will be granted to enable her to improve the business and increase her income to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fruits and and vegetables to resell

location.town: Brgy. Almaguer North, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: La señora Rosario, es una persona trabajadora y responsable, tiene 25 años, convive con el señor Oscar con el cual tienen un hijo dependiente que se encuentra estudiando en una escuela fiscal,  viven en casa de sus suegros en la zona de Sacaba debido a que no cuentan con suficientes ingresos para comprarse su propio terreno y hacer construir una casa, la señora termino el colegio y posteriormente decidió ingresar a la universidad púbica donde conoció a su esposo el cual le colabora con los gastos de la universidad, ya que todavía no termino sus estudios. En la anterior gestión ambos decidieron comprarse una vagoneta invirtiendo parte de sus ahorros, la misma la utilizaron para el transporte de pasajeros, el crédito que solicitan estara destinado al mantenimiento y reparación de la vagoneta, ya que actualmente no se encuentra en buenas condiciones, de esta forma lograra ofrecer un servicio más eficiente e incrementara su ingresos.
texts.en:
Rosario is a hard-working and responsible person. She is 25 years old and lives with her partner Oscar. They have a dependent son who is currently studying at a State school. They live with her partner's parents in the Sacaba area, as they do not have enough income to buy a plot of land of their own and have a house built. 

Rosario finished her schooling and then decided to go to the public university, where she met her partner. He supports her with her university costs, as she has not yet completed her studies. On a previous occasion they both decided to buy a station wagon using part of their savings. They use this to transport passengers.

The loan they are requesting will be used for maintenance and repairs on the vehicle, as it is currently not in a very good state. By doing this she will be able to offer a more efficient service and increase her income.

loans.use: to maintain and repair the station wagon.

loans.name: Nathalí

texts.es: Nathalí, es una joven talentosa y emprendedora, actualmente alterna su trabajo como administradora en una empresa, con la venta de mercancía que hace en forma independiente, esta actividad le ha representado muchos premios por su ardua labor como vendedora, y para ver cumplido su sueño ella solicita el crédito a la Corporación, con lo cual surtirá con más variedad de productos (cosméticos, accesorios, perfumería), los cuales ya tiene en lista de pedidos para así satisfacer las necesidades de su amplia y fiel clientela, con las ganancias y producto de su trabajo, Nathalí continuará capacitándose más y su nivel de vida aumentará, de esta forma podrá disfrutar del resultado de la constancia en lo que se propone.
texts.en: Nathalí is a talented young woman full of enterprising spirit. On top of working as an administrator in a company, she has a business of her own, which consists in selling merchandise. She attributes her success to her hard work as a saleswoman. She asks for a loan in order to make her dreams come true. She wants to buy more products (cosmetics, accessories, perfume) to fulfill customers' orders, so as to keep her already large and loyal customer base. Nathalí's aim is to use the profits from her business to keep studying so as to increase her standard of living. She wants to reap the fruits of her steadfast labour.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe!  This is 56 year old Mary from Gokwe.  She is widowed with no children.  She also cares for two dependents.  Mary runs a retail business selling groceries and she runs a saloon.  The business has been in operation for 5 years. 

She says the main challenges faced are lack of access to finances resulting in few stocks, hence reduced revenue.  Mary has requested a loan of $500 to restock her grocery shop and saloon.  She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to bring stability to her family through increased income and she can self sustain her life.  In the future Mary plans to operate from her own premises as she already bought a business stand and she wants the business to be self-sustaining in its operations without borrowing.

loans.use: to restock the grocery shop and saloon.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 54-year-old Lawrence from Machipisa, the second oldest suburb in Harare. He is married with six children and four are attending school.

Lawrence is into a poultry business. He has requested a loan of $500 to buy stock feeds. Although he has operated the business for 16 years, he says the major challenges he is facing are shortage of stock feeds due to lack of adequate capital and also low supply of day old chicks during the winter season. 

The extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to bridge the gap between payments and breeding periods. In the future, Lawrence plans to be a successful poultry producer on a large scale.

loans.use: to pay for stock feeds

loans.name: Aleksandar

texts.en:
Aleksandar is 53 years old, single and lives with his elderly parents in a minority community of Kosovo. They all live in a small village when the unemployment is very high. He works at a hospital as a technical assistant and his parents receive a pension. 
For many years they have continued to live in their old home with furniture that has been in need of repair and been wearing down through the years of wear and tear. Aleksandar is now requesting a loan so that they can purchase some new items for the home such as beds and closets so that they can enjoy improved living standards and conditions. He is very grateful for this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items for the home such as beds and closets so that they can enjoy improved living standards

loans.name: Ma. Florencia

texts.en:
Maria Florencia is a 42-year-old woman from the town of Guindulman, Bohol. She is married with 2 children ages 17 and 6 years old respectively.

She is into a retail type of business. She sells frozen goods like sausage, bacon, hot dogs and longganisa (Filipino pork sausage). Her business started 1 year ago. She is asking for a loan to have additional capital to buy more frozen goods so she can increase her income and be able to meet the family's daily needs.

In the future, Maria Florencia hopes to expand her business and increase business profitability for the welfare of her children.

loans.use: to have additional capital to buy more frozen goods

loans.name: Danijela

texts.en: Danijela is only 29 years old but already a widow as her husband has passed away tragically 4 years ago, leaving her to care for their 2 young girls. For more than 10 years now she has operated her own business selling mobile phones, parts, equipment, and providing services for fixing problems. In the beginning of her business she started with a small shop selling only phone but now has been able to expand into these other areas and services for her customers. She is now asking for a loan in order to purchase equipment for the phones for her to sell, which will help to generate more income as she will be able to create more sales. She hopes in the future to again be able to upgrade and expand her business so that she can continue to provide and support her daughters without any other help. She really wants to thank all of the lenders for their help.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for the phones for her to sell, which will help to generate more income as she will be able to create more sales

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy speakers, solar panels, suits, t-shirts and blankets for resale

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey is a farmer who is raising his family in a rural community. Despite financial difficulty, he desired to uplift their status of living to give his family a better life. 

Since farming is the main source of their living, he aims to improve his farming business to increase his income and sustain the necessities of his family. He planned to expand his vegetable plantation, but he has inadequate capital. 

For this reason, he is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000.00 to buy certified seeds, fertilizer and herbicides needed for vegetable production. 

He believes that this financial assistance will help him to improve his farming business.

loans.use: to buy certified seeds, fertilizer and herbicides needed for vegetable production

location.town: Brgy. Kongkong, Kasibu, Nueva Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Dromo Group

texts.en:
These women are part of Dromo Group, with an average age of 44 years and 2 children. They all live in traditional extended families in Teshie, a neighborhood in the city of Accra, Ghana.

The women know each other through family ties and make a living from the sale of porridge, slippers, ready-made dresses and groceries. After having successfully repaid their previous loans, the women in the Dromo Group are on their 4th loan cycle.

Matilda is the woman in the middle of the photo. She plans to use her loan to buy Milo, milk, eggs, cooking and ready-made oats to sell to customers. She buys her products locally from wholesalers. She sells her groceries to clients consisting of both men and women for cash. She plans to make a good average monthly profit that she will use to cover healthcare, food and clothing expenses. She will reinvest the remaining amount into her business.

loans.use: to buy Milo, milk, eggs, cooking and ready-made oats to sell to customers

loans.name: Momirka

texts.en:
Momirka is 42 years old, married and has one 16-year-old son. She, her husband and her son all live in a village where the unemployment rate is very high and the area’s economy is underdeveloped. While Momirka is a housewife, caring for the home and their son her husband works for an electrical company to earn an income as well as working in agriculture. To further supplement their income, he plants corn, wheat and potatoes which he really enjoys doing. 

At this time she is requesting a loan for the first time in order to purchase a spray pump for her land. She will be able to use the pump to spray the land before planting, making his work more efficient and less time consuming. In this way, she will be able to generate even more money, as he will be able to work for more people in a shorter period of time. She considers this business very profitable and is hoping to be able to continue this work for many years in the future. Her goal is to have a better life for her son and family. Momirka and her husband appreciate the support and want to thank all of the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a spray pump for his land

loans.name: Nysret

texts.en:
Nysret is 28 years old and single, living with his entire family. Based on family tradition, Nysret works together with his father in agriculture. They work on their land, planting wheat and corn and Nysret helps his family to secure wheat for production for the following year for their personal consumption and to save money on expenses. 
At this time he is requesting a loan in order to purchase guano. The loan will help him to improve and secure their income for even the upcoming year by increasing their production. In the near future he hopes to get married and have his own family. He and his family are very thankful to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase guano

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, está estudiando la carrera de ciencias químicas, ella comenta que su meta es poder terminar su carrera ser una buena profesional y poder habilitar su propio local.
Su inspiración es su madre, ya que ella fue un gran apoyo para ella, y la ha ayudado a poder estar más cerca de su meta.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus clases de la universidad, y también poder cubrir sus gastos de transporte, y agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en: Liz is from the city of  San Lorenzo. She is studying chemistry. She says that her goal is to finish her major and be a good professional and be able to have her own locale. Her mother is her inspiration, because she was a big support for her and has helped her get close to her goal. She is asking for this loan to be able to invest it in college classes as well as to cover her transportation costs. She is grateful for this opportunity she is receiving.

loans.use: to pay for college classes and transportation.

loans.name: Ekrem

texts.en:
Ekrem is 41 years old, lives in a small village, married and has 3 children between the ages of 8 and 13 years old. His wife stays at home taking care of the children and the house while he is a guard in a private company. He is also engaged in agricultural work. 

Based on family tradition, he works on his land, planting wheat and corn. In this way, he helps his family with both nutrition, increased income from sales and decrease in expenses for products. He also keeps a cow for the same purposes. Ekrem is now requesting a loan in order to purchase guano and renovate the stable for his cow. The loan will help him to increase his agricultural production and therefore his income. In the future he hopes to further expand his farm and add additional cows. He is very thankful for all of the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase guano and renovate the stable for his cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate one room and the kitchen

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Avdullah is 48, married, and a father of 5 children; 3 sons and 2 daughters. He is engaged in agricultural work while His wife stays home to care for their home and their children in the small village that they live in. Bekim has 1 cow and 2 horses that he cares for and maintains. He is in need for a loan for 1350 Euros in order purchase 10 sheep and 5 goats. 
The loan and the additional animals will improve the family conditions as he will be able to provide additional nutrition directly to his family, save on the costs of milk, as well as sell the milk and milk products in their neighborhood to generate more income. He hopes to continue to work in agriculture and be able to continuously expand his far. He hopes to offer a better life to his family and promises to pay the loan on time. He is very grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase 10  sheep and 5 goats

loans.name: Zymmber

texts.en: Zymber who is 45 years old, lives in a minority community and a father of 3 children between the ages of 10 and 17 years old, works in a private milk company in order to earn a living. He makes a very low salary and as his wife is a stay at home mother, caring for the home and children, they are very poor and have little to no income to spare. The living conditions of their home is very poor and unhealthy, especially in regards to the bathroom and toilette. He has not been able to do any renovations to address this issue and his family’s health and is asking for the first time for a loan to renovate toilette. This loan will help to improve the living conditions and he is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders!

loans.use: To renovate toilette

loans.name: Bogdan

texts.en:
Bogdan is married and has a 19-year-old son. While his wife is employed doing administration work, Bogdan is a teacher but also is engaged in some agricultural work, working on his own land and the land of others for a fee, usually planting and harvesting wheat and corn. 

Currently he has one very old tractor and needs a loan to purchase a new one. Bogdan believes that this loan will increase his income because he will be able to generate more income by working more effectively and efficiently. He hopes that in this way he will then be able to improve the living conditions of his family. He thanks all Kiva lenders for their help.

loans.use: To  purchase new tractor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, foliar spray, fertilizer, etc. to assist her coffee crops.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose es estudiante de mecánica automotriz, vive con su madre y hermanos. Sus metas futuras son la de trabajar para  seguir estudiando y montar su propio taller  para obtener mejores  ingresos y ayudar a su familia 
Jose pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus gastos de titulación, y de esa forma poder cubrir este gasto que tiene.
texts.en:
Jose is an automobile mechanics student. He lives with his mother and siblings. His goals for the future are to work so keep studying and open his own shop to obtain better income and help his family. 
 
Jose is asking for this loan to be able to invest it in paying for his graduation costs, and in this way cover the expenses he has.

loans.use: to pay for graduation costs.

loans.name: Valbona

texts.en:
Valbona is 34 years old, married and has three children between the ages of 8 and 12 years old. Her husband works as a construction worker in a private company and together they live in an area that is more economically developed than other cities in Kosovo. 

For more than 10 years now, Valbona has been operating a handicraft business from home where she makes and sells products in order to earn a living. She bases these products on specific customer order and request. Now she is requesting a loan in order to purchase materials for her work, which will allow her to be able to continue making her items to sell. Her goal is to improve her family’s living conditions and save money towards her children’s education. She is very thankful for the help.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her work, which will allow her to be able to continue making her items to sell

loans.name: Ivana

texts.en:
Ivana is 28 years old and a mother to a son and daughter ages 4 and 6 years old. Her husband is works maintaining a primary school locally and together with Ivana, works on the land that they own planting wheat for their family and also for selling. 

Currently Ivana is requesting a loan in order to purchase a machine to irrigate their land as well as artificial garbage for the land to better till it. She hopes that this will increase the cultivated area they have and produce more wheat to sell. Her goal is to ensure better living conditions for her family and wants to thank all lenders for that opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase a machine to irrigate their land as well as artificial garbage for the land to better till it

loans.name: Fatmir

texts.en: Fatmir is 36 years old, married and living in the southern part of Kosovo with his family. In order to earn a living, Fatmir transports goods and materials for others for a small fee. Since his wife stays home to take care of the family and his income is low, the small old house they live in is still in urgent need of repair and renovations, which have not been completed due to lack of income. Specifically, her house has insulation problems and loses heat during the winter, making the home cold and increasing the costs to heat it to keep them warm. It is very important for her family to be able to live comfortably and to remain healthy so they are requesting a loan in order to address this problem. After this, he hopes that the living conditions for his family will be dramatically improved. He wants to thank all of the lenders for their help and support.

loans.use: To renovate house

loans.name: Gorica

texts.en:
Gorica is 44 years old, married and a mother of 2 adult children ages 19 and 21, both students studying in another city. She and her family live in a small village in a minority community and she receives social help while her husband is working as a teacher. 

Since her children are away at school the family has additional expenses that are necessary for their stay and their study. Gorica is in need of a loan in order to improve the living conditions for her house which is very old and needs to have some façade work done. She never had a chance to save the money for this with all of their expenses and knows that without this loan it will not be possible. She is very happy for this opportunity and wants to thank all fo the lenders.

loans.use: To renovate house

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana, 58 years old, lives only with her husband as her children are married and live with their own families. They live in a minority community which is very poor even though she is working as a teacher and her husband receives a pension. Because of the low amount of income, they live in a home that needs renovations for a long time now and has not been completed. 

For this reason she is asking for a loan in order to purchase materials to façade her home. She believes that this will lead to better living conditions and she is very happy to have the chance to be able to finally address this issue. She promises to pay on time and is grateful to the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials to façade her home

loans.name: New Hope B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is Peter, who is 34 years; he is married, and has one child who is 16 years old and attending school. He is the leader of New Hope B Group.

He operates a flea market business in Chipinge Branch in Zimbabwe.  He has been running this business for seven years, and sells his products to the local market. He has no other source of income. He says that the main challenges to his business is the lack of working capital.

Peter requested this loan of $750 through MicroKing to purchase more stock. 

He says that the extra income from this loan will will help him to diversify.

In the future, he would like to diversify into selling groceries and build his own shop, as he is currently renting.

loans.use: to pay for stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To fix the yard, so that in the future he will be able to plant fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair her furniture shop to start a new business

loans.name: Obert

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is Obert who is 41 years old. He is married and has three children ages four, 13, and 16. Two of Obert’s children are attending school. For the past eight years, he has been running a flea market under the Chipinge branch in the southeastern part of Zimbabwe.  This is his only source of income and his major business challenge is that he sometimes runs out of stock.

Obert is requesting a 500 USD loan through MicroKing to increase his stock of footwear and clothing items. He says that the extra income will enable him to adequately stock his business. In future, Obert would like to be a fully-fledged clothing and footwear supplier in town.

loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
Gulchehra is 42 years old. She is a woman who always tries to find a new source of income. She is divorced and does not have children. She lives alone. 

Three months ago, Gulchehra began her own business deal selling fabrics in a local market. She sells variety of fabrics. She works hard, and tries to develop her new business. She took part in a course, ‘To Get Ahead’, with a women's organization, and got a certificate. 

She is asking for a loan of 1,000 Somoni to buy fabrics to increase the working capital of the new business. 

She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy fabrics to increase her working capital of new business

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana is a married woman and a mother of five grown up children from Guindulman, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 30 years now. 

Marciana is asking for a loan to buy buckets for storage and gasoline for the boat. 

With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. 

In the future, Marciana dreams of making their fishing business a success.

loans.use: to buy buckets for storage and gasoline for the boat

loans.name: Raffe

texts.en: Raffe is a 32-year-old fisherman from Guindulman, Bohol. He has been in this business for more than seven years now. This is the source of his income. Raffe is asking for a loan to buy a new engine for his fishing boat.  With this loan, Raffe will be able to improve his catch, thus, giving him more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Raffe hopes of making his fishing business a success.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for his fishing boat

loans.name: Dejan

texts.en:
Dejan is 48 years old and single. He is living in a minority community with his father and brother. His father receives a pension and his brother works for the railway. For more than 3 years now, Dejan has owned a video game business where young people come and spend time playing video games at his business. 

Currently he is requesting a loan in order to purchase some inventory, including 2 more computers, which will help him to expand his business. He is planning to opening another video game business as this is a very popular activity for young people and profitable. He is very grateful for this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders!

loans.use: To purchase inventory, including 2 more computers, which will help him to expand his business

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha está Cursando el último año de su Carrera de Licenciatura en Enfermería. Ella se dedica a Trabajar en el mismo ramo donde esta de vendedora en un Negocio Farmacéutico. Ella está viviendo actualmente con su hermana gemela, que por cierto solo viven solas y tratan de salir solas adelante ya que su madre a fallecido y su padre le han dejado desde pequeñas.
Ella es una persona muy emprendedora, que quiere salir adelante, es por eso que estudia para  mejorar su vida.
