Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación, ya que necesita cubrir ese gasto y de esa forma no tener que preocuparse de ello.
texts.en:
Martha is studying in her last year of her degree in Nursing.  She works in the same field as a salesperson for a pharmaceutical business.  She is currently living with her twin sister, and in fact the two of them live along and try to get ahead on their own since their mother died and their father left then when they were young.  

Martha is a very entrepreneurial person who wants to get ahead.  For this reason she is studying in order to improve her life.  She is asking for a loan in invest in the expenses for her degree, since she needs to cover that expense and in that way not have to worry about it.

loans.use: To pay for the expenses related to her nursing degree.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena es una persona estudiosa que viene de una familia humilde, se esmera para estudiar, y comenta que su meta es tener un trabajo seguro y ayudarle a sus seres queridos.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas de la universidad, lo que le permitirán seguir estudiando y luchando por poder cumplir con su meta de ser una profesional exitosa.
texts.en:
Lorena is a studious person who comes from a humble family background.  She works hard to study, and she comments that her goal is to have a secure job and to be able to help her loved ones.

She is asking for a loan in order to invest in paying her University tuition, which will help her to continue studying and struggling to reach her goal of being a successful professional.

loans.use: To pay her university tuition.

loans.name: Daler

texts.en:
Daler was born in 1992. He is a hardworking and smart man. 

Daler is a student in his third year at the Tajikistan Open Institute. He studies well, and he likes all the subjects he studies at the Institute. He always goes to the library, and reads a lot of books. He wants to be the best specialist and to work in any organization. 

He lives with his parents; his parents do not have the opportunity to pay for his tuition. 

He is asking for a loan to pay for his tuition. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition

loans.name: Pineaple Grp Group

texts.en:
Lucas, who is in his late sixties, is married and has got eight grown children. He makes his family living by running a fish business. Lucas start working from 07am to 06pm and is able to make a small monthly profit. He is in this business for ten years now.

This will be his first loan request from Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this loan to replenish business fishes to resell. Lucas dreams to expand his business to upcountry. He will share this loan with his loan group" PINEAPLE" which totals ten members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish business fishes to resell.

loans.name: Ruzikhol

texts.ru: Рузихол 49-летняя жительница района Шахритус. Она разведена с тремя детьми. У нее прекрасные дочери в возрасте 17, 24 и 25 лет. Старших она уже выдала замуж. Рузихол сама вырастила и поставила на ноги своих детей. Она в своей жизни повидала многое -  и хорошее и плохое, но в минуты трудности она никогда не падала духом. Рузихол сама обеспечивает семью. Она уже несколько лет как занимается торговлей женской обуви. Сейчас она обратилась за кредитом, чтобы обустроить дом и купить удобную мебель. Она надеется на вашу поддержку и понимание.
texts.en: Ruzikhol is a 49-year-old resident of the Shahrituz region. She is divorced and has three children, wonderful daughters aged 17, 24 and 25. The two oldest are already married. Ruzikhol raised her children by herself. She has seen a lot in her life, both good and bad, but in times of difficulty she never lost heart. Ruzikhol takes care of her family by herself. She has been working selling women's footwear for several years already. Now she is looking for a loan in order to finish her house and buy suitable furniture. She hopes for your support and understanding.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her home

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn owns and manages a small variety store within the local community. She is 46-years-old and has four children who are in school. Due to financial insufficiency, she aims to improve her store and increase her income to support the education of her children. Having inadequate capital, she wants to request a loan amount of PHP 20,000 to buy additional stock of soft drinks, canned goods, beverages, snack foods, assorted candies, laundry soaps and seasonings to resell. Being a hard working mother, she believes that she will make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of soft drinks, canned goods, beverages, snack foods, assorted candies, laundry soaps and seasonings to sell

location.town: Brgy. Parai, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Adolat

texts.en: Adolat was born in the year of 1970.  She is divorced and brings up five children. She is the only feeder and keeper of her children. Adolat worked in an organization some years ago. During some years ago she was ill and didn’t work anywhere. Now, her health is better. She wants to start her own business and earn her living this way. She is going to start a business selling men’s and women’s clothes. Adolat is asking for a loan of 3,000 USD to buy goods for organizing her new business. Her son Anvar will help her manage the business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy goods for organizing her new business

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman and a mother of five children who is from Guindulman, Bohol. For several years, she has been engaged in a fish-vending business that is her only source of her income.

Emma is requesting a loan to buy more fish to sell. She will use her loan to improve her business and augment her sales and income. In the future, Emma hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Vicylgen

texts.en:
Vicylgen is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of two children ages 11 and nine.  She lives with her family in the town of Guindulman, Bohol. Vicylgen is engaged in retail sales of dry goods such as slippers, children's toys, school supplies like paper, notebook, pencils and pens. 

Vicylgen is requesting a loan to buy more stocks to sell such as slippers, hair curlers, fashion accessories, school supplies and other items. She will use her loan to attract more buyers to her store thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy slippers, hair curlers, fashion accessories, school supplies and other items

loans.name: Juncres

texts.en:
Juncres is a 33-year-old merchant from the town of Guindulman, Bohol. He is engaged in retail sales of dry goods like slippers, sandals, ropes, school supplies like notebooks, pencils and other items. This is the sole source of his income.

Juncres is requesting a loan to buy more stocks to sell such as slippers, ropes, and school supplies. He will use his loan to improve his stocks thus allowing him to sell more products to his customers. In the future, Juncres hopes to make his business a success.

loans.use: to buy slippers, ropes, and school supplies

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo is forty-six years old and comes from the town of Guindulman, Bohol. He has two children aged one and three. He and his partner cook snacks for a living. This business has been in operation for two years now. They make bread and fried sweets to sell in the community. Wilfredo is asking for a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy flour, sugar and cooking oil. These ingredients will allow Wilfredo to produce more in the days to come and will ensure him of a better profit.

In the future, he hopes to expand his business and send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, meat, peppers and palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Akwadu Group

texts.en:
Akwadu is a group that is composed of eight members who know each other and are from the same neighborhood. They are people with the average age of 45-years-old with three children. They live in large traditional families in Teshie, Accar.

The group members engage in different kinds of businesses, especially the buying and selling of underwear, African wax-print, firewood, fish, cosmetics, groceries, shampoo, conditioner, wigs, bananas, plantains, maize, fishing nets, cooking oil and charcoal. They have been in this type of small-scale commerce for several years and are highly sought-after.

In order to meet the growing need of their customers, the group members decided to join the ID-Ghana's loan program. They are on their sixth group loan.

Gladys is the featured borrower of the group and is very well known in Teshie, where she excels at selling fish, groceries and cosmetics. She plans to use her loan to buy fish, groceries and cosmetics to sell to her customers. She procures her goods locally and in Accra from wholesalers and makes her retail sales in Teshie for cash. She is married with two dependable children. She hopes to earn a good profit from this loan cycle which will be used for repayment of the loan and to reinvest in her business of selling fish.

The group needs a total loan amount of GHS 7,700 to be able to serve their customers best.

loans.use: To buy fish, groceries and cosmetics to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mawela Group

texts.en:
Pudenciana, who is married, is aged in her late twenties. She has got one kid who is still small. Pudenciana has been managing a business of breads for seven years. She sales her breads on bus-station where she has a permit from local government. She start working from 05am to 01pm daily. Because of living far from bus station, she wakes up 03am and take like two hours distance to business place. She need to board a bus go and return everyday.  Pudenciana is able to make a fair monthly return. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her first loan request which she will use to start new business of fabrics. Her business sales does not generate a satisfactory income, therefore she cannot meet her daily family needs as expected. By starting fabrics business, Pudenciana believe her extra income will grow and makes her life better. She dreams that one day she will be able to open a big shop selling fabrics and improve her family life.
She will share this loan with her loan group" Mawela" which consist of ten members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to start new business of fabrics .

loans.name: Florida B Group

texts.en:
Ruth, who is in her late twenties, is married. For three years now, she makes her living by running a shop selling dry food items like rice, beans,sugar and maize and baking flour. Ruth also involve with poultry business where she grows 300 to 500 chickens(broilers). She starts her business activities from 08am to 10p per working day and is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

This is her first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Ruth will use this loan to buy 700 chicks and purchase food items for her shop.  In the coming years, she would like to expand her business portfolio. She will share this loan with her loan group" FLORIDA B" which totals three members. The member of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy 700 chicks and purchase food items for her shop.

loans.name: Ranulfa

texts.en: Ranulfa is a 55-year-old woman from the town of Guindulman, Bohol. She is married with two adult children. For four years now, she has been selling fresh and decorated flowers for a living. She also raises hogs for an income. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy more flowers and feed. This will ensure her continued business and better sales for her. In the future, she dreams of improving her barn and making her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more flowers and feed

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is 35-years-old from Guindulman, Bohol. She is married with four children between the ages of 1 and 13.  For 15 years now, she has been engaged in selling fresh shrimps and farming rice for a living.  She is asking for a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy shrimps, a weighing scale and rice. She hopes to have a better source of livelihood so she can continue to send her children to school and give them a better future.

loans.use: to buy shrimps, a weighing scale and rice

loans.name: Gentiana

texts.en:
Gentiana is married and the mother of two children. She is very happy to be able to live in a village where she can own a cow to provide milk products for her family who she loves very much. Her husband works as a taxi driver while she cares for the cow. Now for the first time she decided to requesting a loan in order to purchase another cow so she can continue to provide nutrition to her family and sell milk and milk products to others in her neighborhood.  

She is hoping that she will be able to add income to her family that will improve her family’s living conditions and hope for the future. She promises to pay on time and wants to thank everyone for this support.

loans.use: To purchase another cow so she can continue to provide nutrition to her family and sell milk and milk products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, cola, sugar and oil to sell in the local market

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea Yate  es una persona  que siempre ha tenido una vida  muy bonita, con  obstáculos  y problemas  pero que  ha sabido afrontar  a pesar de que no ha sido fácil la vida, ha pasado por muchas cosas, entre otras por el desplazamiento, es una persona muy humanitaria , ella termino los estudios académicos en el año 2003, una meta que  ella tenía desde siempre, es  lograr hacer el sueño realidad  de estudiar enfermería, en estos momentos ella con dificultades  económicas  y de tiempo, pero  lo está logrando, la motivación de ella son los dos hijos, tiene metas muy claras y  una de ellas es terminar el estudio de enfermería, poder especializarse   en este campo para brindar  ayuda a la comunidad  y poder brindar un mejor futuro a los hijos y a ella misma, ya que sin estudio no puede aspirar a  un mejor futuro para la vida de cada persona. 

Agradece a las personas que en algún  momento le han brindado el apoyo y a las que en algún momento lo decidan  hacer. 

Como ella comento antes la situación económica no es la más estable, ya que es una persona que no tiene los recursos económicos suficientes para poder cancelar el valor de la cuota mensual, es por eso que ella desea tener el convenio de kiva, ya que es una ayuda que a ella le puede servir para que pueda pagar las cuotas del estudio y no tenga que abandonar este gran sueño para ella.
texts.en:
Andrea Yate is a person who has always had a beautiful life, with obstacles and problems, but she has known how to confront them even though life has not been easy.  This challenge has been for many reasons, among which is being displaced, but she is a very humanitarian person.  She finished her undergraduate studies in 2003. One goal that she has always had is to study to be a nurse. Despite the economic difficulties of her current situation, she is pursuing her goal of becoming a nurse.  Her motivation is her two children.  She has clear goals and one of them is to finish nursing school, and then to specialize in this field in order to bring assistance to her community and a better future to her children and herself.  Without studies she will not be able to aspire to a better future for everyone.    

She is thankful to the people who have offered help at different points in time.  

As noted above, her current economic situation is not the most stable, since she does not have the money sufficient to pay for the monthly tuition fee.  For this reason she is asking for help from Kiva in order to be able to pay for her studies and not have to abandon this great dream.

loans.use: To pay for tuition for nursing school.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more artificial hair and other beauty salon products for her business.

loans.name: Florida 1 Group

texts.en:
Esther is in her late thirties and has got three children, all are enrolled to school. She is a widowed woman and for seven years now she has been involved with poultry activities. Esther grows pigs and chicken (layers and broiler) for selling. Since her husband died, Esther is responsible for taking care of her family needs. How school fees, food and medical expenses will be covered, is among of the questions made Esther to engage with these businesses. She wakes up earlier in the morning (06am) where she goes through her chicken-shed to looks for chicken food and water. Her pigs do not need close and every time checking. Esther’s activity end up on 06pm per working day and is able to make a very good return per month. 

This is her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Esther will use this loan to buy chicks and laying chickens. She dreams that one day she will be able to buy a car and improve her businesses. She will share this loan with her loan group" FLORIDA 1" which consist of three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy broiler chicks and laying chickens.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta  de mazi y venta de comida,la socia hace diferentes platos como arroz con pollo,pollo frito y sopas,la socia vende la comida en el mercado,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de comida.La socia solicita el credito para comprar insumos para cocinar como pollo,carne y verduras.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rosa continues to work in the business of selling corn and food. She has various dishes such as rice with chicken, fried chicken, and soups. She sells the meals at the market. She works from 8:00 in the morning until 6:00 in the evening. She has already been working in this business for many years and it is going well. She dreams of expanding her business of selling food. 

Rosa is applying for a loan to buy consumables such as chicken, meat, and vegetables. She is happy for the loan and is committed to making her payment installments.

loans.use: to buy consumables to cook such as chicken, meat, and vegetables.

loans.name: Wazazi Grp Group

texts.en:
Ramadhani is a man of mid twenties who is married and has got three girls who are in school. For two years six months, He has had a general store selling different items like soft drinks, dry food items and others. Ramadhani open his shop from 06:30am to 08pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is Ramadhani's first loan request which he will use to buy a stock of new products for his shop. He dreams that one day he will be able to open a wholesale shop. He will share this loan with his loan group “WAZAZI GRP" which totals five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a stock of new products for his shop.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia is a 50-year-old mother who works buying and selling fruits and vegetables within the public market. This is her way of helping her husband generate income to sustain the necessities of their family. 

Lucrecia is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to buy more stock of mongo seeds, onions, garlic, pepper, carrots, beans, and potatoes to sell. She is a hardworking mother who believes her loan will improve her business and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy mongo seeds, onions, garlic, pepper, carrots, cabbages, beans, and potatoes to sell

location.town: Brgy. Malasin Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy new products for her business.

loans.name: Lito

texts.en:
Lito is the father of four adult children.  They live in a rural community and make their living through farming.  Due to hardships, he aims to improve his farming business in order to increase his production and income to satisfy the necessities of his family.

He had planned to expand his vegetable plantation but he has inadequate capital.  For this reason, he is asking for a loan of PHP 16,000 to buy fertilizer and herbicides needed in vegetable production.  Through patience and hard work, he believes that he will improve his farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides needed in vegetable production

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is a 39-year-old woman from the town of Guindulman, Bohol.  She is married with five children ranging in age from 2-14 years old.  Her husband is a fisherman and Beatriz sells what he catches.  She also buys fresh fish from other fishermen to resell.  Their business was started four years ago, earning her 10,000 PHP per month.  She is asking for a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy new fish nets, fresh fish and ice buckets for her fish vending business.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and increase the business profitability in order to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy new fish net, fresh fish and ice buckets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en:
Rahila is married and the mother of four children. All of her children were married. Today Rahila is living in Baku region with her husband and the family of her youngest son.  She has been in the farming business for 26 years. Rahila learned this profession from her mother-in-law and now she has extensive experience in this business. 

Rahila grew saffron in her own land under crops. Saffron is used in national dishes; also, saffron is a very useful plant for health. Now Rahila has applied to Komak Credit Union for a loan of 2,100 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). The loan helps to develop Rahila’s business. With this loan she wants to plant new roots of saffron. It’s her second loan; previously, she took a loan and all of it was paid in time. Rahila says great thanks to the Kiva organization for everything.

loans.use: to plant new roots of saffron

loans.name: Meri

texts.en: Meri is 41 years old single woman, from Batumi city. She lives alone and generates small income from buying and selling cars in increased price. It isn't stable activity, so Meri is unavailable to pay all daily expenses and make savings for starting any other business. She requested a loan to MFO Credo, the start-up program that gives people chance to start or re-start businesses. So Meri was approved the loan of 1800 USD for cafe, particularly she will rent the place in a good location of town, purchase necessary equipment and all merchandise and open it. This will be great support for her, to have her own stable source of income, get clients herself and make a good relationship with them. Her income will significantly increase, as Batumi is one of the best resting place on the black sea cost in Georgia that has pretty much tourists during the season. Meri will be grateful for the help Kiva lenders can provide and will highly appreciate it. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To purchase necessary equipment  for cafe

loans.name: Hiari  Ya Moyo Musoma Group

texts.en:
Flora is a mother of four girls who are in school. She is early 30s years old and is married. Flora who is a treasurer of her group, she has had a business of small dry fishes known as dagaa. She opens her business from 07am to 06pm per working day and is able to make a small profit per month. 

This is her third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans all of which paid back successfully to buy dagaa which she resold to more people. She used her profit to cover school fees and household expenses and plow back to her business. She believe that by restocking more stocks, will make her profit to grow. Whatever the profit she makes, part of it plow to her business to grow. Flora will use this loan to restock her business. She dreams to build a nice family house. 

Flora will share this loan with her loan group" HIARI  YA MOYO" which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more dried fish and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stock for her dry-goods business.

loans.name: Maclaren Group

texts.en:
YASINTA who is in her early 40s is married with three children who are still at school.  She has been making and selling shoes since 1999.  She works from 7.30am to 830pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be YASINTA's 8th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy more materials and made many shoes which she managed to sell.  She used the profit to pay school fees and covered house hold expenses. She is doing great with the loan and appreciates Kiva for supporting them. She will use this loan to buy materials, threads and  glue for making more shoes.  She dreams of building her own house.

Yasinta will share this loan with her loan group "MACLAREN" which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy materials, threads and  glue for making more shoes.

loans.name: Kakakuona Group

texts.en:
HAMIS who is in his early 30s is married and has one child who goes to school.  He has been running a stationary store for three years now.  He works from 06am to 07pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be HAMIS's 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy more stationary and has paid back all his loans successfully.  He used the profit to buy bricks, sand and covered household expenses.  He is really happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for supporting their group.  He will use this loan to buy the missing items in the stationary store.  He dreams of building his own house.

Hamis will share this loan with his loan group "Kakakuona" which has ten members  who will hold each accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy  the missing items in the stationary store.

loans.name: María Clemencia

texts.es: Clemencia es una señora de 51 años de edad,  ella es casada y tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales 2 se encuentran asistiendo al colegio, Clemencia y su esposo se dedican a la ganadería y al trabajo en el campo, el crédito lo va a utilizar en la compra de terneros para criarlos y comercializarlos en la feria de la localidad, comenta que le va bien en este negocio ya que se dedica a el desde hace 35 años atrás y la experiencia hace que tenga buenos resultados, lo que más anhela Clemencia es tener el suficiente dinero para cubrir la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en: 51-year-old Clemencia is married with 4 children, 2 of whom are still at school. Clemencia and her husband breed livestock and work in the fields.  She intends to use the loan to buy calves to raise them and then sell them at the local fair. She says that her business is going well because she has been involved in it for 35 years and this experience helps her achieve good results.  Clemencia's dearest wish is to have enough money to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Minani

texts.fr: Le client  Minani est employé dans un établissement universitaire. Il est parent de 2 élèves inscrit  régulièrement à l’école. Il a été informé de nouvelles opportunités de crédit éducation qu’offre l’IMF Hekima pour financer anticipativement les frais de scolarité. Ainsi, ce nouveau prêt lui servira de payer les frais de scolarité de ses  enfants  pour qu’ils ne soient plus exclus des cours durant toute l’année scolaire 2013-2014. Ce parent rêve un avenir meilleur pour ses  enfants. Au final, il salut grandement l’initiative spéciale de Hekima.
texts.en: This client, Minani, is employed at a university establishment. He is the parent of two pupils enrolled regularly in school. He was informed about new education loan opportunities that the microfinance institution Hekima is offering to finance education costs in advance. Thus, this new loan will be used to pay the education costs of his children, so that they are no longer excluded from classes for the entire 2013-14 academic year. This parent dreams of a better future for his children. In conclusion, he raises his hat to Hekima's special initiative.

loans.use: to pay his children's education costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for an affordable and efficient cooking gas package (liquefied petroleum gas).

loans.name: Msisiri Group

texts.en:
WINIFRIDA, who is in her mid 20s is single.  She has been running a beauty salon for five years now.  She works from 08am to 8.30pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.  

This will be WINIFRIDA's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to restock the missing items in the salon stock.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to cover household expenses and her welfare.  She will use this loan to buy more and advanced salon equipments.  She dreams of owning a bar business.

WINIFRIDA will share this loan with her loan group "MSISIRI" which has six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more and advanced salon equipments.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is 59 years old and lives with her 3 children and husband in a minority community in the southern part of Kosovo. While her husband works as an auto mechanic, she is involved in agriculture, earning money by working on hers and her neighbor’s land with the help of her husband. Svetlana is a very hard worker and plants vegetables, corn and wheat to harvest for her family’s needs and to sell for income while also collecting a fee from the work she does for her neighbor. 

She really enjoys her work and is very satisfied with the income she earns and the way that she is able to contribute to her family. Now, she is in need of a loan to purchase tools and machinery to continue to plow and harvest the land since her current tools are worn out and old, not being as useful or effective anymore. With the purchase of new equipment she will be able to become more effective and efficient in her work and increase the profit she makes. She is very grateful for the financial support given to help her family improve their lives and make a better future for her children.

loans.use: To purchase tools and machinery to continue to plow and harvest the land

loans.name: Souadou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 5 femmes appartient au banc villageois qui a été crée le 14 novembre 2009. Ce banc regroupe des membres très dynamiques et solidaires qui habitent pour la plupart dans le même quartier. Elles font en général le commerce. 
Souadou, debout à droite de la photo est âgée de 48 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont 2 filles.
Avec le prêt elle envisage de faire du commerce d'ustensiles de cuisine. Elle part en voyage ou par le billais de ses connaissance à l'étranger pour avoir ses marchandises, elle dépense 300000 pour les ustensiles. Une fois que les marchandises arrivent, elle les place à crédit . Avec le reste de l'argent elle fait aussi de la vente de savon. Elle achète 16 cartons de savon à 9000f l'unité et une fois vendu ça lui revient à 24000f le carton . 
Les bénéfices lui servent à renforcer ses épargnes et à prendre les frais de scolarité de ses enfants, car son mari est à la retraite. Elle prend aussi en charge les frais médicaux de son frère atteint par une maladie du coeur.
texts.en:
This group of five women belongs to the 'banc villageois' that was created on November 14, 2009. It is composed of very energetic members in solidarity who lives for the most part in the same district. The women do commerce in general. Souadou, who is standing at the right in the photo, is 48 years old, married, and the mother of five children, including two girls. 

With this loan, she envisions selling kitchen utensils. She goes on travel [or abroad in the case of her acquaintances] to obtain her merchandise. She spends 300,000 [francs] for the utensils. After the merchandise arrives, she sells them on credit. With the rest of the money, she also sells soap. She purchases 16 boxes of  soap at 9,000 each, and this brings in 24,000 per box upon being sold. 

The profits are used to bolster her savings and to cover her children's education costs, since her husband is retired. She also covers the medical costs for her brother, who suffers from a heart ailment.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen utensils and soap

loans.name: Blessing Group

texts.en:
The five members from blessing Group are of the average age of 44 years with two children. They got to know each other through bonds of community and they retail wigs, hair creams, second-hand clothing, fresh fish, chicken meat, phone credits and stationery products.

In order to bolster their working capital, the members of the group decided to work with ID-Ghana, from which they are seeking their second loan cycle.

Kwaku is the only man standing in the photograph. He's a big seller of stationery. He intends to use his loan to buy books, pens, pencils, mathematical sets, drawing boards, etc., from the manufacturers to sell to customers in the market.

With this loan, he intends to make a good return, part of which he will use to be reinvested in his business, and part will be used to cover the daily needs of his household. He is married with two children.

loans.use: To buy books, pens, pencils, mathematical sets, drawing boards, etc., from the manufacturers to sell to customers in the market.

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 6 femmes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée 16 novembre 2009. Ce banc est constitué essentiellement de femmes du même quartier. Elles entretiennent de bonnes relations et font comme activité le commerce.
Ndéye, à droite de la photo et levant la main, est âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont 3 filles.
Avec le prêt elle envisage de faire la transformation et commercialisation de l'huile d'arachide et de pate d'arachide. Elle va acheter de l'arachide à 225000f. Elle assure la transformation de la moitié d'arachide en huile et l'autre en pâte d'arachide. Une activité qui marche bien puisse qu'elle peut vendre le litre d'huile d'arachide à 750f et la pâte à 700f le kg.
Les bénéfices lui permettent d’épargner et de subvenir aux besoins de la famille
texts.en:
This group of six women is part of the 'banc villageois' which was created on November 16, 2009. It is composed essentially of women from the same district. They maintain good relationships, and they work in commerce. Ndéye, who is at the right in the photo with her hand raised, is 41 years old, married, and the mother five children, including three girls. 

With this loan, she envisions processing peanuts and selling the peanut oil and peanut butter. She is going to purchase some peanuts at 225,000 francs. She makes sure that half of the peanuts is processed into oil and the rest into peanut butter. It is a business that is going well, since she can sell a liter of peanut oil at 750 francs and peanut butter at 700 francs per kilo. 

The profits enable her to save money and to meet family needs.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 49 years old and from Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. She is married and relies on farming vegetables and bananas for an income. Her business has been her source of livelihood for quite some time now. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer to improve her yield and make her crops healthy. 

Carmelita attributed her crop's healthy growth to the availability of fertilizer. Her income from this business will be for her family's daily consumption.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Mame's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois qui a été crée le 12 décembre 2009 regroupe des membres qui entretiennent de bonnes relations et font comme activité le commerce. Ce groupe de 3 fait parti de ce banc et a comme vedette Nogoye.Sur la photo, elle est en position debout et a levé la main pour se faire distinguer. Elle est âgée de 34 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont 2 garçons.
Avec le prêt elle envisage de faire du commerce de céréales et de l'embouche. Elle va acheter 4 moutons à 50000f chacun pour revendre à 85000f. Elle va élever aussi des poules des chèvres. Concernant la vente de céréales elle va acheter 160kg de mil à 225 le kg pour le revendre à 300f le kg.
Elle compte renforcer son épargne avec ses bénéfices et prendre en charges les frais médicaux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This Banc Villageois was established on December 12, 2009. It regroups members who maintain good relationships, and whose business is retail.

This group of three people is part of this Banc Villageois, and its featured borrower is Nogoye. She's the woman raising her hand in the photograph in order to be told apart. She's 34 years old, married, and the mother of seven children, two of them boys.

With her loan, she foresees buying cereals to resell and raising livestock. She will buy four sheep costing XOF 50'000 each, that she will resell for XOF 85'000 each.

She will also breed chicken and goats. Regarding her cereal business, she will buy 160 kg of millet for XOF 225 per kg, and resell it for XOF 300 per kg. She intends to use her profit to bolster her savings cover her children's healthcare expenses.

loans.use: to buy millet, black-eyed peas, hibiscus, and sheep

loans.name: Mgeule Group

texts.en:
ZULFA, who is in her early 20s is single. She has been running a hardware shop for two years now. She works from 07am to 08pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.  

This will be ZULFA's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy hardware stock to resell.  She dreams of building her own house.

Zulfa will share this loan with her loan group "MGEULE" which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy hardware stock to resell.

loans.name: Daima Group

texts.en:
MARIAM, who is in her early 30s is married.  She has been a food vendor for three years now.  She works from 05am to 10pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be MARIAM's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use his loan to buy rice, maize flour, baking flour, beans, sugar, salt and meat.  She dreams of building her own house.

Mariam will share this loan with her loan group "DAIMA" which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy rice, maize flour, baking flour, beans, sugar, salt and meat.

loans.name: Mirian Liliana

texts.es: Liliana tiene 31 años de edad, ella es madre soltera tiene 3 hijos de 14, 10 y 7 años  de los cuales uno asiste al colegio y dos asisten a la escuela, Liliana se dedica a cuidar vacas y a trabajar al jornal, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca ya que mediante el ordeño y la venta de leche es como logra cubrir los gastos de alimentación y educación de sus hijos, lo que Liliana aspira es incrementar su negocio para mejorar sus ingresos para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en: Liliana, 31, is a single mother of 3 children aged 14, 10, and 7, all of whom attend school. Liliana raises cows and works as a day laborer. She wants to invest the money from the loan in the purchase of a cow because she makes money to cover the food and education expenses for her children from milking the cow and selling the milk. Liliana aspires to increase her business to improve her income so she can provide for her children.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goods (rice, peppers, onions, vita, salt, etc.) to sell at her business table in the market.

loans.name: Ashoki B Group

texts.en:
Hafsa is a mother of two children,one boy and one girl, who are in school. She is aged in her late thirties and makes her living by running a shop selling men and women shoes. She is in this enterprise for three years now and is able to make a good monthly profit. Hafsa open her shop from 06am to 06pm daily. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is Hafsa's fourth loan request which she will use to buy new and sold out stock of shoes for her shop. With the previous loans all of which paid back successfully, she used to restock her shop stocks and paid shop rent. Hafsa received an extra income which she used to pay house living rent and food expenses. She paid school fees and covered part of house building expenses. She dreams to open another successfully business. 

Hafsa will share this loan with his loan group" Ashoki B" which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new and sold out stock of shoes for her shop.

loans.name: Coumba's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 2 femmes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 20 novembre 2009. Ce banc regroupe des membres qui entretiennent de bonnes relations et font comme activité principale le commerce. 
Daba âgée de 39 ans est la vedette de ce groupe et sur la photo est en position debout et a levé la main. Elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont 3 garçons. 
Avec le prêt je vais acheter du mil à 175f le kg pour le vendre à 200f. A noter qu’elle travaille avec son mari qui a des machine à moulin, elle envisage de lui donner 250000 pour l'achat d'une autre machine.
Avec les bénéfices elle envisage d'acheter un lit et une armoire.
texts.en:
This group, made up of two women, is part of the Banc Villageois that was established on November 20, 2009. It regroups members who maintain good relationships and whose main business is retail.

Daba, age 39, is the group's featured borrower. She's the one raising her hand in the photograph. She's married and the mother of seven children, three of them boys.

With her loan, she will buy millet for XOF 175 per kg, to resell it for XOF 200 per kg. Its has to be noted that she works with her husband, who owns grinding machines. She foresees giving him XOF 250'000 to buy another machine.

With her profits, she foresees buying one bed and one cupboard.

loans.use: to buy millet, sorrel, and peanuts

loans.name: Ashoki C Group

texts.en:
Asteria, who is in her early forties, is married and has got two boys and one girl, all of whom are in school. For a period of five years, Asteria makes her living by managing a shoes shop. She opens her shop from 07am to 06pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

Asteria is requesting a eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans all of which paid back successfully to restock on shop shoes. Asteria, together with her husband, are doing great with the loans received. She keep on servicing her business with more stocks to the level that it can produce high returns and depend on itself. She used the business profit to cover house living rent and covered school fees, household expenses and plow back to her business. In the coming years, she would like to make her business successful and build a house. Asteria will use this loan to restock her shop with new fashion shoes.   

She will share this loan with her loan group' Ashoki C" which consist of four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock her shop with new fashion shoes.

loans.name: Belsy Anacely

texts.es:
Belsy tiene 30 años de edad, solo llego hasta cuarto grado en la primaria debido a que sus padres no la quisieron seguir apoyando para que siguiera estudiando por lo cual ella se dedicaba a los quehaceres del hogar. Con el pasar de los años conoció a quien ahora es su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura y también trabaja como constructor cuando hay oportunidad de trabajo con quien tiene 2 hijas: Doris tiene 7 años y está en segundo grado del centro básico de la comunidad y Karol tiene 17 meses. Juntos se dedica al cultivo de café desde hace dos años por lo tanto este año obtendrán su primera cosecha de café. También siembran maíz en medio del surco del café así obtienen los granos para su alimentación sin tener que comprar. Ella hasta el momento está aprendiendo a realizar todas las actividades concernientes al cultivo esto debido que se ha dedicado más al cuidado de su hija menor. Poco a Poco se involucra más en este proyecto porque quien se ha encargado más es su esposo y quien le esta enseñado. Anteriormente ellos tenían un terreno demasiado largo de la comunidad el cual vendieron y compraron en un lugar más cercano ubicado a 20 minutos caminando y es un poco menos de una manzana. Ellos decidieron dedicarse a esta actividad ya que la zona es apta para el cultivo de café y además es la principal fuente de empleo e ingresos en la misma.
Ella y su esposo tienen como meta mantener sus cultivos de café ya existentes y comprar más para asegurar y darle un mejor nivel de vida a su familia sobre todo la educación de sus hijas Quienes quisiera que sacaran una  carrera universitaria y que encuentren un buen trabajo para que tengan otros ingresos. También si fuera posible ella sueña con que más allá se le cumpla el sueño de comprar un vehículo para trasportarse. Por lo que ella solicita apoyo financiero el cual invertirá en comprar fertilizantes para abonar y pagar mano de obra para la limpieza de la tierra así darle un buen mantenimiento debido que es plata nueva la cual este año está empezando a florear y quiere fortalecerla para que su primera cosecha sea excelente.
texts.en: 30-year-old Belsy was only able to study for the first four years of primary school because her parents did not want to continue to support her education and so she worked in the house. In time, she met the man who is now her husband.  He works in agriculture and building too, when there is a chance of work. They have two daughters: Doris, who is 7 and in the second year at the local elementary school, and Karol, who is 17 months old. Belsy and her husband have been growing coffee for two years and so they will have their first coffee harvest this year. They also grow corn in the middle of the coffee plantation so they have grain to feed themselves and do not have to buy it. Belsy is currently learning to carry out all the tasks required for growing her crops, because up to now she has given up most of her time to look after her younger daughter. She is gradually getting more involved in the project because it has been her husband who has done most of the work and who has taught her. Previously, the plot of land they had in the locality was too big and so they sold it and instead bought something closer, a 20-minute walk away, which is a little under a 1.75 acres.  They decided to work in agriculture because the area is perfect for growing coffee and it is also the main source of employment and income there. She and her husband share the goal of looking after their current coffee crops and buying more to ensure that they can provide a better standard of living for their family and, in particular, provide for their children's education.  Belsy would like to see her children study at university and get good jobs which will give them other sources of income. Also, if it were possible, she dreams of one day being able to buy a vehicle for getting around. For this reason, she is seeking financial help which she will use to buy fertiliser and to pay workers to clean up the land and look after it well. It is newly planted this year and is now beginning to bloom and she wants to strengthen it so that her first harvest will be an excellent one.

loans.use: to buy supplies and pay workers to take care of her coffee crop

loans.name: Indriana Alexis

texts.es: Indriana es una de las integrantes de Banco Mujer Mujeres Vencedoras, tiene 24 años de edad, es estudiante y se mantiene con su local de fotocopiado, recargas telefónicas y venta de artículos de librería, este local se encuentra ubicado muy cerca de la frontera entre Costa Rica y Panamá, es una de las pocas fotocopiadoras de la zona, por lo que muchos niños de las escuelas cercanas comprar los artículos ahí mismo. Ella desea este crédito para comprar más materiales escolares, tintas para sus impresoras y fotocopiadora. Esta actividad le permite a esta joven continuar con sus estudios ya que por las tardes se dedica a ir a la Universidad para terminar su carrera. Recibe mucho apoyo de su madre, ya que atiende la fotocopiadora por las noches. Desea continuar trabajando con Fundación Mujer por la baja tasa de interés, facilidad en los trámites y apoyo a la mujer emprendedora.
texts.en: Indriana is a member of the Communal Bank "Banco Mujer Mujeres Vencedoras". She is a 24-year-old student who supports herself with a shop for photocopying, mobile phone recharges and bookstore items. The store is located very close to the border between Costa Rica and Panama and it is one of very few copying businesses in the area, which is why many children from nearby schools go there to buy supplies. Indriana wants this loan to buy school supplies and ink for her printers and photocopy machines. This activity allows this young woman to continue with her studies, because she attends university in the afternoons in order to finish her degree. Indriana receives a lot of support from her mother, who takes care of the store in the evenings. Indriana wants to keep working with the lending partner, Fundacion Mujer, due to their low interest rate, the easiness of the procedures and their support of enterprising women.

loans.use: to buy items for her photocopying business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, vita, onions, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Witogwa Group

texts.en:
NEEMA  who is in her mid 30s is married with three children who are still at school.  She has been running a business of selling dry food for twelve years now.  She works from 06am to 06pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This is her first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy rice, beans, cooking oil, wheat flour, ubuyu and groundnuts. She dreams that one day she will be able to build a house. Neema will share this loan with her loan group "WITOGWA" which totals five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, cooking oil, wheat flour, ubuyu and groundnuts.

loans.name: Ashoki A Group

texts.en:
Linda, who is in her early thirties, is single and has got two kids, one of them, is in school. She has been managing her family living by running a shop selling woman clothes. Linda is in this enterprise for a period of six years now. She starts working from 08am to 05pm per working day and is able to make a good range of monthly profit. 

This is her second loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan which she paid in full to buy her shop stocks from Nairobi. Linda normally obtains her business clothes from Nairobi where she spend like a week since her travel. Linda earned a profit which she used to pay for her family house rent, covered school fees and food expenses. She will use this loan to replenish her shop with new fashionable clothes from Nairobi. Linda dreams that one day she will be able to own a house and managing well her business. 

She will share this loan with her loan group" Ashoki A" which totals four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish her shop with new fashionable clothes from Nairobi.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 66 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo grado de educación básica,  no pudo prepararse mas porque su familia tenía altas limitaciones económicas, ahora él está casado y su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, tiene 7 hijos, de los cuales solo una hija estudia y el resto ya están trabajando, pues con esfuerzo y dedicación con su esposa han logrado criar  a sus hijos con valores y en personas productivas. 

Fontanero es el trabajo al cual Francisco se dedica, él trabaja en el proyecto de agua potable de su cantón, tiene dos años en este rubro, paralelamente cultiva la tierra, pues siembra maíz y frijol. Cada día se levanta a la 5:00 AM  para comenzar su rutina de trabajo tanto en la fontanería como en la siembra de cultivos.

El préstamo solicitado lo necesita muchísimo para comprar materiales de construcción: arena, cemento, hierro, entre otros materiales, para terminar de construir su vivienda, pues hasta el momento solo está comenzada y quiere finalizar la construcción en esta época que no han comenzado las lluvias.

Sus principales metas y sueños son que a sus hijos no les falte nada y que  los que puedan estudiar que sigan preparándose,  que puedan valerse por si mismos aprendiendo oficios que les permitan tener una vida digna y de prosperidad.
texts.en:
Francisco is 66 years old. He is married and his wife takes care of the house. He has 7 children. Only one of them, a daughter, is still studying, the rest work. With a lot of dedication and effort he and his wife managed to raise their children with values and to be productive people. Francisco studied up to Grade 2 but could not continue due to his family's economic limitations.

Francisco works as a plumber for the potable water service of his Canton. He has been doing this for 2 years. At the same time he farms, growing corn and beans. He gets up at 5 am every morning to begin his work routine as a plumber and as a farmer.

The loan Francisco is requesting is urgently needed to buy construction materials like sand, cement and re-bar to finish construction on his home. At present he is just starting and wants to finish construction in this season before the rains start.

His principal goals and dreams are that his children do not go without anything and that they can study to prepare themselves and prove themselves learning work that will provide them with a dignified and prosperous lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement re-bar etc. to finish construction on his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, red oil, and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more food ingredients for her cook shop (restaurant).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay monthly university tuition fees.

loans.name: Mnuka Group

texts.en:
Halima is in her early thirties and is married with two children who are in school. She has had a charcoal store for two years now. Halima start operating her business from 12:30pm to 06pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This is her third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Halima has used the previous loans to restock on her store with sacks of charcoal. She has paid back all of her previous loans successfully. She received an extra income which she used to cover home food costs and renovated her house with new color. Halima, a good business woman who manages both her family and business issues, will use her new loan request to repair her charcoal store to looks attractive. She dreams that one day she will be able to give her children better education. 

She will share this loan with her loan group" Mnuka" which totals seven members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to repair her charcoal store to looks attractive.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food ingredients such as pepper, fish, meat, vita, oil, etc.

loans.name: Mnarani Group

texts.en:
Halima, who is married, is a mother of two schooling kids. She is aged in her late 20s and for two years now she has been managing a mamalishe business. A business selling breakfast with bites like donuts,vitumbua and chapati and lunch food such as rice,ugali with meat,vegetable and beans. She started her business with small capital but currently, she has been showing a good progress. Halima plans to move to a new, big and attracting place where she can be able to save more people and grows her extra income. She opens her business from 05:00a.m to 02:00p.m daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is Halima's first loan request which she will use to rent a good business room to attract more people. Halima dreams that one day she will be able to be a successfully business woman. She will share this loan with her loan group" MNARANI" which totals ten members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to rent a good business room to attract more people.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 49 years old, from the municipality of Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. She is married and has been engaged in a hog-raising business for a living. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy feed and supplements. This will help, so she can keep her hogs healthy and free from diseases. 

Carmelita hopes that, in four month's time, she will be able to sell her fattened hogs for a good price. Any income will be for food, savings, and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy feed and supplements for her pigs.

loans.name: Amélida

texts.es:
Amélida de 36 años de edad, es una mujer que se ha sacrificado por su familia, viene de una familia muy numerosa, en la cual ella tuvo que dejar a un lado los estudios para dedicarse de lleno a buscar el sustento para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su  familia. Es una madre soltera, pero eso no le ha quitado las ganas de luchar y buscar maneras de obtener ingresos para su hogar,  de los siete hijos que tuvo, solamente cuatro viven con ella, de estos cuatro solo una hija estudia y los demás le ayudan  involucrándose al trabajo.

Ella tiene una pequeña tienda , donde vende golosinas, granos básicos, bebidas, entre otros productos, tiene 6 años de experiencia y este oficio lo aprendió gracias a la iniciativa para aventurarse en el negocio y poco a poco ha ido tomando experiencia. Antes de estar en el negocio, vendía platos típicos como pasteles, tamales, todas las tardes cerca de su casa. Sus hijos le ayudan, atendiendo su pequeño negocio cuando ella tiene que hacer otras actividades.

Ella invertirá este crédito para surtir el negocio, aprovechando precios mas cómodos al comprar algunos productos al por mayor, esto le generará mayor margen de ganancia, y sin la ayuda será casi imposible que ella pueda continuar con su tienda ya que debe sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Su sueño es poder construir su propia casa, debido que por el momento viven en una que no les pertenece,  con la ayuda de sus hijos y su trabajo está segura que poco a poco podrá  hacer sus sueño realidad.
texts.en:
Amélida, 36, comes from a large family and has sacrificed a lot to help support them.  She left school early, she says, because her family needed her income just to put food on the table.  She's a single mother, but that hasn't stopped her from working hard to support herself and her children.  Four of her seven children still live at home and only one, a daughter, is still in school.  The others work and help with family expenses.

Amélida has a small store where she sells food grains, snacks, drinks and other everyday products.  She started the business 6 years ago, with no experience, learning what she needed to know from one day to the next.  Before the started the business, she sold traditional prepared foods, e.g., tamales.  Her children help her with the business, filling in when she has other responsibilities.

Amélida will use this loan to stock her business.  She will buy bulk supplies of the merchandise she sells to make the most of wholesale discounts and, in turn, increase the margins on everything sells.  The loan is very important to her and she says it's hard to see how she can continue the business without it.

Amélida lives in a rented house and her great hope is that she can buy a house of her own one day.  With help from her children and her own hard work, she thinks she will ultimately meet her goal.

loans.use: to stock her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and care for her coffee crop

loans.name: Yehowa Dzi Mikwelo Group

texts.en:
Yehowa Dzi Mikwelo Group is made up of nine people who live in the same area. The group's representative, named Monica, is 28 years old and has attended school to the secondary level.

She's married to a carpenter named Prince. Together they have two children, both of whom go to school and are in their care. Monica lives with her children, and she takes care of the various family's expenses.

For this reason, she's been buying and selling underwear, shirts, and trousers for both men and women. She has been doing this business for the past eight years. This enables her to provide for her family and for herself.

Monica gets her supplies from the market in Ghana. To bolster her business, Monica, together with the other members of the Group, is seeking a first loan from Kiva's partner, ID Ghana. They promise to work hard to repay this loan without trouble.

loans.use: To buy underwear, shirts, and trousers for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish and rice for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for roof repairs.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 29 años de edad, sus padres eran de muy escasos recursos y por lo tanto pudieron brindarle la educación hasta cuarto grado ya que tenían que trabajar para mantener a la familia, además él era el hijo mayor y por lo tanto de vio en la necesidad de ayudar a sus padres, ahora él está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y al cuido de animales de granja, y solo tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad.

Pedro tiene una pequeña granja de pollos y también se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura y a trabajos particulares como jornalero, la granja la cuida su compañera de vida y la agricultura la realiza en época de invierno, trabaja todos los días y tiene que madrugar ya que los animales que cuida son de una persona que vive bastante retirado de su casa a una distancia de un kilómetro.

Los fondos del crédito que está solicitando serán utilizados para comprar pollos de engorde, concentrado y vitaminas para la alimentación de los mismos. 

Espera para un futuro terminar de construir su vivienda para que su familia tenga una casa digna, ademas ampliar el número de animales de granja ya que es una buena fuente de ingreso para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is 29 years old. His parents had low income and so could only provide education for him until 4th grade. They had to work to provide for the family and because Pedro was the eldest son, he had to help his parents. He is now married, and his wife works as a housewife and breeding farm animals. They have a 2-year-old son.
Pedro has a small chicken farm and also works in agriculture and doing individual jobs as a day laborer. His spouse looks after the farm and Pedro does farming in the wintertime. He works every day and gets up early because he looks after the animals of a person who lives a bit far from his house, 1 km away.
The money from the loan will be used to buy chickens to fatten, food concentrate and vitamins to feed them.
In the future, he hopes to finish building his house so that his family can have a decent home and he would also like to increase the number of animals in the farm because they constitute a good source of income for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy chickens, concentrated food and vitamins to feed them.

loans.name: Shivayogi

texts.en:
Organic cotton cultivation is mushrooming in large swaths of rain-fed lands due to increasing demand for exports. Therefore, some farmers are shifting from hybrid to organic cotton plantation. This cultivation gives good yield and is less labour-intensive.
 
Promotion of organic cotton, collective procurement and marketing to niche buyers for increased and better price realization is the dream of many farmers. 

Shivayogi, from Hirekerur, Haveri, is one of them. He has had profound had experience in socio-developmental activities and women's empowerment for more than two decades. He is married and has two sons. They reside in a 600 sq. ft. ancestral house with basic facilities. The elder son is working with a private firm as a program coordinator and the younger one is in school.
 
Shivayogi is taking this loan to buy machinery so he can start an organic cotton processing unit and enter into direct marketing. He also wants the loan to buy organic cotton from the local farmers.

Shivayogi encourages other farmers to cultivate traditional/organic crops and has played a pivotal role in spreading the potential of desi (traditional) cotton varieties to many farmers.

loans.use: to buy machinery to start an organic cotton processing unit and to buy organic cotton.

loans.name: Nagappa

texts.en:
Nagappa is one of the few farmers who have literally turned the tables, not just in his village but across a belt in North Karnataka. 

Post 1947, when British colonial rule ended in India, the government stressed the adoption of high yield varieties of various crops that included cotton. India had its own rich heritage of cotton varieties, which for their short staple were a favorite of European hand-looms. Many Indian cotton types are also considered to be high absorbents and preferred in surgical processes. But later the government made farmers adopt the hybrid seeds for higher production. This process got a further boost during India's green revolution in the 1970s.   

As the world started to look for more choices for different clothing types and more environmental concerns were raised, a need in markets was felt for cotton that was not hybrid.   

Following the trend of a growing demand for this kind of cotton, some local NGOs in India decided to persuade some farmers to adopt again the traditional varieties.  Initially there were few takers, but Nagappa was one of them. 

Nagappa has dedicated himself to organic cultivation of desi (traditional) fiber crops for a long period. His family has been in cotton farming for generations.  He alone has revived 24 desi cotton varieties, some of which are currently cultivated in more than 200 acres of land in Makiri village, a rural pocket some 20 kms away from Bydag, Haveri district. He is supplying manufacturers that are creating brands using only organic cottons.

Nagappa has laid a foundation for other farmers to learn how to tap the potential of sustainable agriculture.  

He requested this loan so that he can set up a showroom of organic vegetable seeds, desi cotton and millet for clients and other farmers. 

His dream is to make his farm a biodiversity center that can be a breathing place for people with similar notion and mindset.

loans.use: to set up a showroom of organic vegetable seeds, desi cotton and millet.

loans.name: Puttaraju

texts.en:
Establishing seed diversity centers, entrepreneurial stewardship for farmers, availability of healthy wholesome food and market independence from brokers is of prime importance today.

Puttaraju is a dedicated organic farmer growing millet and potatoes. His interest is to develop a market for uncultivated wild food crops and make them accessible to urban consumers.

Puttaraju is married and has two children. Both of them are studying. His son is in fifth grade and his daughter is in tenth grade. He lives in a small house with basic amenities. 

Puttaraju has established a basic seed bank at his house. He has even received good media coverage for it. He also entertains exchange of seeds with other farmers from various places.

He is seeking this loan to realize his dream of showcasing the traditional varieties of uncultivated food crops under one roof, which will help other farmers and interested people to explore all possible avenues. Such a showcase will allow him to identify the specific needs of buyers and also to network with people across this sector.

loans.use: to showcase the traditional varieties of uncultivated food crops.

loans.name: Malenadu Bhatta Belegarara Sangha Group

texts.en:
Malenadu Bhatta Belegarara Sangha (Malenadu Rice Growers Association) has been actively networking with various market players for organic rice and red rice. It is working with more than 170 farmers from four villages producing organic traditional rice varieties and is linking them with markets.

The lack of niche market for their produce led the farmers to set up a common outlet for selling their products.

The association has revived four red rice varieties and spread awareness among the public about the benefits of consuming organic rice. The group aims to create trust in farmers to grow traditional paddy varieties instead of the hybrid ones as it has potential to maximize the returns.

Shivaputra (with hand raised) belongs to the Malenadu group. He is married. His wife is a housewife and they have a daughter who is six months old. He has studied Bachelor of Arts and Law, yet he is passionate about organic farming. Shivaputra goes around various villages to educate the other farmers about organic farming. He explains the procedure of organic farming in detail and helps them to start organic farms. 

The group wants the loan to buy seeds in bulk and distribute them to the farmers. 

The group dreams of starting a community rice mill for collective production, processing and marketing, which will maximize returns to the farmers.

loans.use: to buy seeds in bulk to distribute to farmers.

loans.name: Virginia Noemy

texts.es:
Virginia de 38 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, no siguió estudiando ya que quería ayudarle a sus padres para conseguir el sustento de la familia, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a trabajar en la pesca artesanal y al comercio del mismo. Sus hijos están estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad y el mayor esta estudiando en el instituto de la ciudad mas cercana de su vivienda.	

Desde muy pequeña Virginia se ha dedicado a trabajar en la actividad de comercio de peces, se lo enseñó su madre quien también se dedicó a esta misma actividad, sale todos los días a vender peces de casa en casa y a los costados  de la calle principal donde transitan una buena cantidad de personas a los que les ofrece el producto para la venta, su esposo es el encargado de capturarlo en la laguna del lugar y luego la Virginia los vende, esto lo hace todo los días ya que es la principal fuente de ingresos de su familia.

Los fondos del crédito serán utilizados para comprar mercadería como frutas y verduras y posteriormente venderlos.

Su sueño es seguir adelante trabajando, apoyando a su familia y darle el estudio a sus hijos ya que espera que tengan mejores oportunidades en el futuro para poder obtener un trabajo.
texts.en:
Virginia is 38 years old. She has a ninth grade education; she did not continue studying because she wanted to help her parents earn money to sustain the family. She lives with her partner, who earns a living working in traditional fishing and selling his catch. Their children study at the community school and the oldest is studying in the institute of the city nearest their home.

Since she was very small, Virginia has earned her living working in the business of selling fish. Her mother, who also worked in the business, taught it to her. She goes out every day to sell fish door to door and along the main street where there are lots of people to whom she can offer her product for sale. Her husband is the one responsible for catching the fish in the local lagoon, and then Virginia sells them. She does this every day, since it is the main source of income for her family. 

The funds from the loan will be used to buy merchandise like fruits and vegetables that she will later sell. Virginia's dream is to continue working, supporting her family, and giving her children an education, as she hopes that they will have better employment opportunities in the future.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise like fruits and vegetables to later sell.

loans.name: Honneru Balaga Group

texts.en:
Honneru group, located in Mysore, Karnataka, is a platform for organic farmers to market their products directly to the consumers. They are promoting agricultural producers, especially from rain-fed regions, mainly North Karnataka (Shimoga, Haveri, Hubli, Gadag, Dharwad, Bellary and Belgaum). Members of the group are designated with roles and responsibilities to carry forward this initiative to reduce the overhead expenses.

Asha, the featured borrower (with hand raised), is married and has a daughter studying in tenth grade. Her husband is working in a garment shop. She has completed a Master of Arts and Bachelor of Education. She has a passion for social work and she is a nature lover, a versatile person altogether. Asha believes in Lal Bahadur Shastri’s words, “Jai jawan, Jai Kisan,” which means “hail soldiers and farmers.”

In 2013 the group opened an organic outlet that has been functioning on its own with minimum working capital. This is the first of its kind: an outlet formed by organic farmers with a social cause. It aims to strengthen the consumer’s beliefs and perception of native and organic products, to directly link farmers with consumers, and to create a niche market for organic produce. By eliminating other intermediaries, farmers get a better (and fairer) value for their produce. 

Members (farmers) want to scale up to a national level and to start connecting with farmers across the country. They know their activities will generate more employment for farmers and that they can grow their consumer base because of the healthier properties of the organic products. 

Honneru group will use this loan to pay for the promotion of their farmers' platform among other farmers and consumers through showcases, marketing materials, etc.
                                                                                                    
They hope one day to start a fully organic supermarket.

loans.use: to pay for the promotion of organic farming to other farmers and consumers.

loans.name: Mango Group

texts.en:
JOYCE who is in her early 30sm is married with one kid who still goes to school. She has been running two projects, electronic money transfer and selling small dry fish called daga.  She has been in her business for five years now. She works from 06am to 9pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This wil be Joyce's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which she wants to use for buying electronic money transfer and to sell small dry fish called daga.  She dreams of making her business big.

Joyce will share this loan with her loan group "mango" which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy electronic money transfer and to sell small dry fish called daga.

loans.name: Reebok Group

texts.en:
Hussein, who is in age of late thirties, has got four boys who are in school. For a period of sixteen years now, he has been managing his life by running one main business of fruits. After started receiving loans, He decided to open a new business of TV room where he shows football matches especially Europe football leagues.  Hussein employed one helper who runs his TV show room. With his fruits business, Hussein wakes up 06am from home and boards a bus to the fruits market where he finish selling at 11am. After that, he organize for the next day stocks ;like what fruits will be available and at what price, all issues ends up 04pm where he can board a bus back to his home.  He is really working hard and make sure his boys improve items of education. He is able to make good monthly profit. 

This is his fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans all of which has paid in full to open his TV show room business. He earned a profit which he used to buy a sofa set, home TV, fridge and paid for school fees and home food expenses. In the coming years, Hussein would like to be a successfully man managing a company. He will use this new loan to buy a projector for his TV show room to attract more people. 

Hussein will share this loan with his loan group” Reebok” which totals ten nine members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a projector for his TV show room to attract more peoples.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to stock her fruit and vegetable sales business.

loans.name: Chiriku Group

texts.en:
SALUM  who is in his late 30s is married with three children who are still at school. She has been selling dry food since 2007.  She works from 06am to 10pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be SALUM's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to restock the missing items in her shop stock and has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy rice, sugar, beans, maize flour, backing flour, wheat flour and cooking oil to resell.  She dreams of owning a supermarket.

Salum will share this loan  with her loan group "CHIRIKU" which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, maize flour, backing flour, wheat flour and cooking oil to resell.

loans.name: Loyola Group

texts.en:
Yona, who is in his late 30s, is married and has three children, one boy and two girls who are in school. Since 2008, he has had a retail shop, selling different products like airtime, dried foods, rice, beans, sugar, soaps, soft drinks, juices, soda, etc. He is doing fine with his enterprise as well as with his family. He starts working at 8 a.m. and works until 10 p.m. daily and is able to make good returns. 

This will be his 11th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which he paid back successfully, he purchased shop items like soaps,airtime,soft drinks and sugar. Yona usually purchases more sacks of rice during the harvest period at low prices and stores them up to resell later. With the profit received, he bought a plot of land and made more bricks for house building. He will use this loan to restock shop items like rice, airtime, soft drinks, etc. He dreams to expand his business by restocking more items. 

He will share this loan with his loan group, "Loyola," which totals 10 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock shop items like rice, airtime, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food products, such as rice, sugar, beverages and candies.

loans.name: Saadani Group

texts.en:
Frida is aged in her late forties and has got five children, three boys and two girls, of whom four are in school. Frida, who is married, makes her living by running two businesses.
