Beauty salon is one of her business and Retail shop is a second business selling dry food like rice, maize and baking flour, soda and airtime and so on.  She manages well all of these businesses in assistance with few helpers.  Frida opens her business from 06am to 08pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her fifth loan request which she will use to buy dry fishes from upcountry to resell. This is a new project Frida is trying to do so as to increase her extra income which is small.  With her previous loans all of which paid back successfully, Frida used to rebuild her beauty salon place by making the room bigger so as to service more people. She also purchased new shop products which before she was not selling.  She received an extra income which she used to buy flat screen TV, radio and fridge. In the coming years, she would like to be a successfully business-woman. 

Frida will share this loan with her loan group” SAADANI “which consist of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy dry fishes from upcountry to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to restock grocery with crates of beers,sodas and boxes of water and juice.

loans.name: Faidika   Grp Group

texts.en:
Pilli, who is in her early thirties, is married and has got three children who are in school. For three years now, Pilli makes her living by managing a small retail shop selling different items like dry food, airtime, bread, donuts etc. She opens her shop from 07am to 03pm per working day and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This is her fifth loan from Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans all of which paid back successfully to grow her seed capital by restocking new items which previous not found in her shop. She is doing great and keeps on working towards her dream of opening a big shop. Pilli earned a profit which she used to buy a plot of land and build a house. She paid part of school fees and household expenses. With her new loan, she will buy new shop stocks to meet her customers demand.

Pilli will share this loan with her loan group" FAIDIKA GRP” which totals two members. The member of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new shop stocks to meet her customers demand.

loans.name: Kijiwe Samli Group

texts.en:
UPENDO who is in her late 20s is single.  She has been running two business, an internet cafe and electronic money transfer, for two and a half years now.  She works from 07am to 10pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be UPENDO's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to maintain the computers and to increase on the stock of the electric money  transfer. She dreams of building her own house.

Upendo will share this loan with her loan group "KIJIWE SAMLI" which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loans.

loans.use: to maintain the computers   and to increase on the stock of the electric money  transfer.

loans.name: Five Stars Group

texts.en:
Mwanaid is a mother of one son and daughter who are in school. She is married and aged in her early thirties. She has had a food stall business,mamalishe, for a period of seven years now. She opens her business from 05am to 02pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly return. 
This is her second loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With her previous loan which paid back in full, she used to put electricity to her house. Mwanaid purchased cooking stocks of cooking oil,rice,maize flour and paid business rent. She earned a profit which she used to cover school fees, household expenses and part of building cost. Mwanaid with her new request, she will use to buy the food cooking items: rice,maize and baking flour,cooking oil etc. She dreams that one day she will be able to expand her business portfolio by managing a tricycle. 
She will share this loan with her loan group" FIVE STARS" which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the food cooking items: rice,maize and baking flour,cooking oil etc

loans.name: Beijing Group

texts.en:
Ester is business woman who makes her living by running mamalishe for five years now. A business which provides breakfast: tea with bites/snacks like chapati and donuts and lunch: cooked rice, ugali with meat, beans and vegetables. She is really working hard and known for being accountable with her business. She is aged late twenties and has got two sons who are in school. She starts working from 06:00am to 06:00pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.
This is Ester's third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans all of which she paid back successfully to buy business working utensils and food cooking stocks.  Ester received an extra income which she used to cover school fees, household expenses and plow back to business. She will use this loan to buy food cooking ingredients like cooking oil, tomatoes, onions, maize and baking flour. In the coming years, Ester would like to take her own big loan and build house. 
She will share this loan with her loan group "BEIJING" which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy food cooking ingredients like cooking oil,tomatoes,onions, maize and baking flour.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel  es un señor, de 37 años de edad,  casado, padre de dos hijos de 6 y 4 años, respectivamente, ambos aún se encuentran estudiando y viven Chicacao, Suchitepéquez. El es un hombre trabajador que lucha junto a su esposa para sacar adelante a su familia. Actualmente tiene una tienda de abarrotes ubicada en la comunidad donde vive. El comenta que se asoció con sus hermanos y empezó esta actividad hace 3 años ya que en su comunidad no existen muchos negocios similares, es por ello que tomó  la decisión de emprender este negocio que le ha ayuda a contribuir a la economía de su familia a través de sus ingresos y ganancias que obtiene a través de ello. El solicita un préstamo de Q 11,000.00 para la compra de productos de consumo diario (café, maíz, azúcar, etc.), para poder incrementar sus ventas y también sus ganancias. El sueño de Miguel es apoyar a sus hijos para que puedan superarse.
texts.en: Miguel, 37, is married and has two children, 6- and 4-years old, respectively.  Both of the children are in school.  The family lives in Chicacao, Suchitepéquez.  Miguel and his wife work hard day in and day out to support their family.  Miguel owns a neighborhood store and tells us that he and his brothers started it 3 years ago because they saw that there weren't enough stores like it in the area.  The investment paid off and his income from the business now helps to support his family.  Miguel is applying for a Q 11,000.00 loan that he will use to stock his business with the merchandise (coffee maize, sugar, etc.) that his customers want.   The investment will increase his sales and, in turn, his earnings.  For the future, Miguel wants to be able to provide his children with whatever they need to prosper.

loans.use: to stock his corner store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rice and coal, to expand her sales.

loans.name: Adidas Group

texts.en:
Khadija is aged in her mid thirties and has got one school kid. Khadija who is married, makes her living by running a nursery school(kindergarten). Khadija has this school service for five years. She starts her business from 07:30am to 02:00pm per working day and is able to make a fair monthly return.

This is Khadija's eighth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans all of which paid back successfully to buy students chairs and repair on her school top roof. Khadija receive an extra income which she used to save bank,covered school fees and home food expenses. She dreams that one day she will be able to expand her school to primary level. She will use this loan to buy new school teaching materials like boards and swings for the kids to refresh mind. She appreciates Kiva support with the loan. 
Khadija will share this loan with her loan group" adidas" which totals nine members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new school teaching materials like markpens,boards

loans.name: Edgar Fabian

texts.es: Fabian, es un hombre de 19 años de edad, vive en Maldonado, parroquia de Tulcán, es Sencillo y muy responsable, vive con sus padres. El se dedica al cultivo de naranjilla. El necesita el préstamo para comprar fungicidas para cuidar de los cultivos de naranjilla y cultivar unos nuevos. Su sueño es tener una carpintería propia, ya que él sabe muy bien sobre este oficio, además en el futuro quiere tener su casa propia.
texts.en: Fabian, 19, lives in Maldonado, in the parish of Tulcan. He is unassuming and responsible and lives with his parents. He grows naranjilla, a type of citrus fruit. He needs the loan to buy fungicide to care for his crops and grow new ones. His dream is to have a carpentry store, because he knows a lot about this craft. In the future, he also wants to have a house of his own.

loans.use: to purchase fungicide to care for his crops of naranjilla and grow new ones.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic manure and tools.

loans.name: Tembo Mgwaza Group

texts.en:
Anifa is aged in her early fifties and has got five children who are grown and depend themselves. She makes her living by running a business selling chips with eggs,fried chicken and other meats fried in pieces(mishkaki). She is in this business for ten years now and is able to make a very good monthly profit. Anifa works for about twelve hours a day, starting from 10am to midnight. 

This is her fourth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans all of which repaid successfully to buy sacks of Irish potatoes and kilos of chicken and cow meat. She has bought liters of cooking oil. Anita managed well her business and earned an extra income. She used the income to pay school fees and part of food for family, build her house and repaired her business place which now attract new customers. She is looking for another loan which she will use to buy new working items; chairs,charcoal stoves and food cooking ingredients. Anifa dreams to start another business of motorcycles for transportation.

She will share this loan with her loan group" TEMBO MGWAZA" which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new working items; chairs,charcoal stoves and food cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Wazo Tegeta Group

texts.en:
Secilia is a mother of eight children, six girls and two boys, of whom all of them are grown. Secilia, who is married, is in her early 50s. Since 2010, Secilia has been managing a genge business selling fruits and vegetables items. She starts her genge business from 07am to 06:30pm per working day and is able to make a fair return. 

This is her fourth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans all of which paid back successfully to restock on her genge items to attract more customers. Secilia earned an extra income which she used to cover part of building expenses for her living house. Secilia paid home food expenses. Her business is doing great and thankful for your support. With her new request, she will use to buy sack of onions, carrot and tomatoes to resell. She dreams that one day she will be able to finish building her house and put tiles inn. 

She will share this loan with her loan group" Wazo Tegeta" which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan

loans.use: to buy sacks of onions,carrot and tomatoes to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies needed to keep her coffee plantations in good shape.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more caustic and palm oil for her soap.

loans.name: Manzese B Group

texts.en:
Ramadhani, who is in his early thirties, is married and has got a kid who is in school. He has been running a shop selling motorbike spare parts. He is in this enterprise for six years. Ramadhani opens his shop from 08:00am to 07:00pm per working day and is able to make small monthly profit. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is Ramadhani's fifth loan request which he will use to buy spare parts of motorcycle to resell. He used the previous loans all of which paid back successfully to replenish shop spare parts missed in his shop. Ramadhani received an extra income which he used to cover school fees and household expenses. He is really appreciates your loan support. Ramadhani dreams that one day he will be able to build a family house.

He will share this loan with his loan group" MANZESE B" which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy spare parts of motorcycles to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her corner store.

loans.name: Bacilisa

texts.es:
La socia Bacilisa se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comestibles,ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes donde vende arroz,azucar,leche y galletas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta lss 10:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar arroz,azucra,leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Bacilisa continues with her sales of food goods. She has a grocery store where she sells rice, sugar,milk and biscuits. She works from 8 am until 10 pm. She has been doing this business for a number of years and things are gong well for her. Her dream is to expand her grocery store business.

Bacilisa is requesting a loan to buy milk, rice, sugar and biscuits. She is grateful for the loan and promises to pay her installments on time.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and biscuits.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy crates of soda and boxes of juices to resell.

loans.name: Star Group

texts.en:
Sara is a woman who makes her living by running a genge business selling fruits, vegetables and charcoal. She is mid thirties years old and is single. She has been in this business for four years now and is able to make a very good monthly profit. She opens her genge from 09am to 08pm daily. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is Sara's fourth loan request which she will use to buy more sacks of charcoal to keep on store and proceeding on selling. Because it is rains season, Sara need to buy more sacks of charcoal to keep on store and avoid scarcity and purchasing price spiral. She used the previous loans all of which paid successfully to service her genge with new items. Sara received an extra income which she used to cover school fees and home food expenses. In the coming years, Sara would like to build a house. 

She will share this loan with her loan group" Star" which consist of four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to keep on store and proceeding on selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, onions, fish, dry meat, etc.

loans.name: Oscar Ricardo

texts.es:
Oscar es joven de 21 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres y hermanos, quienes viven en el Departamento de Sololá.
Oscar comenta que se dedica a la peluquería (cortes de cabello). Eligió esta actividad porque no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar y además de ello no hay fuentes de trabajo en su comunidad. A raíz de la actividad que realiza obtiene ingresos y ganancias aceptables que le ayudan a contribuir a la economía de su familia, ya que su familia es de escasos recursos. 
Ahora él ha observado que su negocio es bastante productivo, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo de Q 2,000.00 para la remodelación de su barbería y así podrá ofrecerles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Uno de los sueños de Oscar es abrir otra barbería con el propósito de incrementar sus ingresos para poder construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Oscar, 21, lives with his parents and siblings in the Department of Solola. He works as a hairdresser. He chose this activity because he didn't have the chance to study, and besides, there are no sources of jobs in his community. He makes good earnings and income from his work, which helps him to contribute to the family's economy, because his family has low income.
Oscar has noticed that his business is quite productive so he has decided to ask for a loan of 2,000 GTQ to remodel his barber shop and offer his customers a better service.
One of Oscar's dreams is to open another barber shop in order to increase his income and be able to build a house.

loans.use: to remodel his business.

loans.name: Adita

texts.es: Adita, de 29 años de edad, está separada del padre de sus 2 hijos de 10 y 5 años de edad respectivamente con quienes vive en la casa de su madre en compañía de su mamá y su papá. Adita se dedica a la elaboración y venta de esteras que sirven para las divisiones y paredes de las casas o para techos ligeros en edificaciones simples. Su trabajo está completamente hecho a mano a base de desperdicios de triplay. Cuenta con un local alquilado donde tiene todos los materiales necesarios para el proceso de elaboración, además cuenta con 3 ayudantes a quienes paga por día trabajado. Realiza sus ventas por pedidos al por mayor y menor, atendiendo amablemente a sus clientes. Se inició hace más de 5 años con un capital propio que fue reinvirtiendo y hasta el momento recibe el apoyo de su hermana en la administración y en la obtención de nuevos clientes. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 600, está agradecida de contar con una línea de crédito porque podrá sentirse más segura de avanzar con el desarrollo de su negocio. Con el monto solicitado comprará de materiales para la elaboración de sus esteras, como desperdicios de triplay que compra en las fábricas cercanas, clavos de diversos tamaños, pegamentos y sustancias químicas que evitan la proliferación de insectos que malogren la madera.
texts.en:
Adita, who is 29 years old, is separated from the father of her two children, who are 10 and 5 years old. They live in her mother's house with her mother and father. Adita makes a living by making and selling mats that function as dividers and walls in homes or as light roofs on simple buildings. 

Her work is done completely by hand using scraps of three-ply wood. She rents a place where she has all necessary materials for the production process. She also has three employees whom she pays by the day. She makes sales from large and small orders and helps her clients pleasantly. 

She started the business more than 5 years ago with her own capital that she has re-invested. Her sister has also helped with administrative duties and attracting new customers.

At this time, she requests 600 nuevos soles. She is grateful to be able to count on a line of credit so that she will be able to feel more secure in advancing her business. With the requested loan, she will purchase materials to make her mats, like scraps of three-ply wood which she purchases from local factories, different sizes of nails, glue, and chemical substances that eliminate insects that ruin the wood.

loans.use: to purchase materials like wood, nails, glue, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more peppers, rice, palm oil, vita, onions, okra, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Ana Maritza

texts.es:
Ana tiene 31 años de edad, estudió hasta séptimo grado, ella está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas, tiene 2 hijos de de 8 y 10 años de edad que  viven en casa y son las únicas personas que dependen de ella.

Ana se dedica a vender en una tienda que tiene en su casa, tiene aproximadamente 2 años de dedicarse a este trabajo, pues ella ha visto que le genera buenos ingresos para su familia y que es productiva para ella, al principio ella empezó con pocos productos para vender, pero con el transcurso de los años ella ha aumentado su productividad, su esposo también la apoya en la tienda en atender a los clientes ofreciéndoles un buen servicio.

El crédito lo necesita para invertirlo en el negocio pues ella ve que necesitan muchos productos que no tiene en la tienda, pero que con la ayuda del préstamo comprará mas y surtirán mas la tienda, esto le generará mayores ganancias e ingresos.

Sus propósitos a futuro, en primer lugar desea estar en paz con Dios, desea tener una mejor casa para vivir cómodamente con su esposo y su hijos, ampliar mas la tienda, sueña con que sus hijos sigan estudiando y que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Ana is 31 years old. She is in a common-law relationship and has two children aged 8 and 10. They live with her and are the only people dependent on her. Her husband grows vegetables. She studied up to Grade 7.

Ana has a store which is located in her house. She has been doing this for about 2 years and she has seen that it provides good income for her family and is productive for her. At the start she began with just a few items to sell, but over the years she has increased her selection. Her husband helps her in the store looking after customers to provide good service.

Ana needs the loan to invest in her business as she needs many products that she does not carry in the store. With the help of the loan she can buy more and stock her store. This will generate more revenues and profit.

In the future she wants first of all to be at peace with God. She wants a better house to live in comfortably with her husband and children. She would like to expand her store and see her children continue their studies and become good people.

loans.use: to buy more products to stock her store.

loans.name: Macaria

texts.es:
La socia Macaria se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de chicha de jora que es una bebida a base de maiz y tambien la socia sigue vendiendo carbon,la socia ya tiene varios años que se dedica a estos pequeños negocios,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender el carbont.La socia solicita el credito para comprar carbon.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Macaria is still devoted to the business of selling chicha, a drink made of corn. She also continues selling coal. Macaria has spent several years devoted to these small businesses. She requests a loan to buy coal to fulfill her dream of having a shop where she can sell coal.

Macaria is happy for the loan and she agrees to comply with the repayment of her share.

loans.use: to buy coal.

loans.name: Pablo Florencio

texts.es: Pablo es un hombre soltero de 47 años de edad,  él es un señor  responsable que se dedica a trabajar en el campo y a la ganadería,  él vive con su madre y una hermana, cuida vacas desde que tenía 15 años, Pablo comenta que aunque se le dificulta un poco hablar eso no le impide trabajar,  el crédito lo va a invertir comprando una vaca, la aspiración de Pablo es mejorar su negocio y aumentar sus ingreso para cubrir los gastos suyos y los de su madre
texts.en:
Pablo is 47 years old and single. He is a responsible man who works in the fields and raises livestock. Pablo lives with his mother and a sister. He has been taking care of cows for 15 years.

Pablo says that he has a bit of difficulty speaking, but it has not stopped him from working. His loan will be invested in the purchase of a cow. Pablo’s aspiration is to improve his business and increase his earnings so that he can pay for his expenses and those of his mother.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Maricela Paulina

texts.es:
Maricela es una señora de 27 años vive junto a su esposo Marco y su hijito Ronald de 6, radican en la parroquia de Valle Hermoso, un lugar muy turístico por los ríos, zona productiva con un clima agradable.
Maricela se dedica a la crianza de pollos y chanchos, tiene experiencia en este negocio, su esposo trabaja en una bodega varios años, juntos han ayudado con el aporte al hogar y han sacado adelante a su hijo.
Maricela dedica a su negocio todos los días, lava y limpia las chancheras, les da de comer y luego regresa a su casa, ahora desea mejorar el galpón de pollos ya que por el invierno se deterioró un poco, desea además comprar pollitos y el balanceado para su alimento.
Maricela es clienta de Fundación Alternativa, ha trabajado ya con créditos en la institución; ahora acudió para invertir en el galpón, se siente muy agradecida por la ayuda brindada y el apoyo del proyecto Kiva quien con cada crédito ha podido mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maricela is a 27-year-old woman who lives with her husband Marco and their six-year-old son Ronald. They reside in the parish of Valle Hermoso, a place that receives many tourists because of its rivers. It is also a productive area with a pleasant climate.

Maricela raises chickens and pigs. She has experience in this line of work. Her husband has been working at a general store for several years. Together, they are able to help each other at home and with raising their son.

Maricela works at her business every day. She washes and cleans up the pig pens, feeds the animals, and then returns home. At the moment, she wants to make improvements to her chicken coop since it experienced a bit of damage during the winter. She also wants to buy chicks and balanced feed for their diet.

Maricela is a client of Fundación Alternativa and has already worked with the loans offered by the institution. Now she is requesting to invest in her chicken coop. She is very grateful for the assistance that has been provided and the support from Kiva. Each loan has made an improvement in her quality of life.

loans.use: to renovate her chicken coop and to buy chicks and balanced poultry feed.

loans.name: Gloria Mary

texts.es:
Gloria de 53 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto  grado pues la situación económica que tenían sus padres eran difíciles para seguir estudiando, ella está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura en la siembra de granos básicos (maíz y frijol) ellos  tienen 10 hijos de los cuales 6 están ya casados y  4 todavía viven junto a ellos en casa.

Gloria se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a cuidar de sus hijos, desde que ella estaba pequeña se dedica a esta actividad pues es un trabajo hereditario por parte de su mamá que desde que estaba pequeña su madre le enseñó a aprender este oficio, ella expresa que es una actividad muy importante y que se siente orgullosa de desempeñarla, ella siempre recibe el apoyo de sus hijos en los trabajos que realiza.

El préstamo solicitado a CrediCampo, lo necesita para poner su propia granja de pollos de engorde, específicamente comprará 200   pollos de engorde y alimento para estos, ya bastante experiencia en el área de granja de pollos pues ella sabe que es una actividad que le genera buenos ingresos para ella y su familia, por el momento no tiene pollos a la venta pero con la ayuda del préstamo comprara más pollitos de engorde.

Ella desea para un futuro tener mucho bienestar para ella y su familia, poder tener una mejor vivienda y tener una mejor calidad de vida junto a su esposo, para sus hijos y nietos sueña con que sean personas de bien en la sociedad, que sigan estudiando y logren sacar una carrera universitaria, todo esto dice que lo logrará con la ayuda de Dios y gracias al crédito solicitado y futuros  créditos que solicitará para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gloria is 53 years old. She has a fifth grade education, because her parents' financial situation made it difficult to go to school. She is married, and her husband works in agriculture, growing staple grains (corn and beans). They have ten children, of whom six are already married and four still live with them at home.

Gloria is a housewife, taking care of the household duties and her children. Ever since she was little, she has done this work; it was passed down to her from her mother, who taught her how to fill this role from the time she was small. She expresses that it is very important work and that she feels proud to carry it out. She has always received the support of her children in the work that she does.

She needs the loan requested from CrediCampo to set up her own chicken farm. Specifically, she will purchase 200 young chickens and feed for them. She already has a fair amount of experience in the area of chicken farming, so she knowns that it is an activity that generates good income for her and her family. At the moment, she doesn't have any chickens for sale, but with the help of the loan, she will buy more young broiler chickens.

She hopes that in the future she will have plenty of wellbeing for herself and her family and to be able to have a better house and a better quality of life together with her husband. For her children and grandchildren, she dreams of them becoming respectable people in society and that they stay in school and attain a university degree. All this, she says, she will achieve with the help of God and thanks to the loan she has requested and future loans that she will request to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to set up her own chicken farm. Specifically, she will buy 200 young broiler chickens and feed for them.

loans.name: Rosalio

texts.es:
El socio Rosalio se sigue dedicando al negocio de distribucion de productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar y leche,el socio lleva a las diferentes tiendas de abarrotes,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es tener una tienda de abarrotes.El socio solicita el credito para comprar arroz,azucar,leche y aceite.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rosalio works in the distribution business, distributing food staples such as rice, sugar, and milk. He supplies different grocery stores and works from 8 AM until 5 PM. He has worked for several years in this business and it has gone well.

He dreams to have a grocery store himself.  He is seeking a loan so that he can buy rice, sugar, milk, and oil.

He is thankful for the loan and promises to comply with the re-payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, peppers, onions, and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goods and food items, including soap, soft drinks, rice, palm oil, peppers, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more towels to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, bitter ball, oil, okra, and other items

loans.name: Antonia De Jesus

texts.es:
Antonia tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos los cuales solo uno es mayor de edad y los otros actualmente se encuentran estudiado, su esposo trabaja en la agricultura, ella no estudió debido a que su padres no tenían los recursos económicos necesarios para brindarle una educación, por eso ella desde muy pequeña se dedicó a ayudarle a su mamá en los oficios domésticos. 

Antonia se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería desde hace 15 años, ella aprendió este trabajo para darles la educación a sus hijos y ayudarle a su esposo en los ingresos del hogar. Ella desde muy temprano se levanta para comenzar con la labor en la agricultura y para hacer sus oficios en la casa. 

Antonia utilizará el crédito para la siembra de maíz y compra de ganado, ella desea comprar 3 novillos pequeños para poder criarlos y  y con el resto del dinero va a comprar los insumos necesarios que necesita para cultivar el maíz ella tiene mucha fe que va a obtener una buena ganancia para poder cancelar el crédito y poder tener un ingresos mas en su casa.

El sueño de Antonia es poder seguir trabajando junto a su esposo para entre ambos poderle dar un futuro mejor a sus hijos tengan las oportunidades que ella no pudo tener de pequeña por eso trabaja  muy duro para brindarles una oportunidad de educación mejor.
texts.en:
Antonia is 54 years old, she is married, and she has 4 children, one of whom is an adult and the others are attending school. Her husband works in agriculture.  She didn't go to school because her parents didn't have the economic resources to provide her with an education.  Because of this, she had helped her mother with domestic duties since she was very young.

For the past 15 years, Antonia has worked in agriculture and in raising cattle. She learned this work in order to provide an education for her children and to help her husband pay the household expenses.  She gets up very early in the morning to begin working the fields and to take care of her household duties.

Antonia will use this loan for the corn crops and to buy cattle.  She wants to buy three new steers and raise them.  With the rest of the money she will buy the supplies she needs to cultivate the corn. She has faith that she will make a good income, be able to pay off the loan, and have money enough for the household.

Antonia's dream is to be able to continue working with her husband so that the two of them can provide a better future for their children.  She dreams that her children will have opportunities that she didn't have. This is why she works so hard, in order to provide a better education for her children.

loans.use: to buy two steers and also supplies such as fertilizers and seeds for growing corn.

loans.name: Tayta Cruz De Muruhuay Group

texts.es: Los socios del grupo “TAYTA CRUZ DE MURUHUAY” se siente muy complacidos por encontrarse pasando el 04 ciclo. Margot tiene 23 años es soltera. Ella es docente de educación de nivel inicial primario y secundario del curso de ingles. Al cual se dedica hace tres años. Años atrás era estudiante. El crédito lo invertirá en el pago de los trámites de su bachiller. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Margot es la segunda del lado derecho viste blusa blanca y chaleco negro.
texts.en:
The members of the group "Tayta Muruhuay de Cruz" are very pleased to be in their fourth loan cycle. 

Margot is 23 years old and she is single. For the past three years, she has been working as an English teacher at the pre-kindergarten, primary, secondary education levels. A few years ago, Margot was student. The loan will pay for the processing of her university degree. 

The group thanks the Kiva investors for providing this loan. Margot is the second on the right, wearing a white shirt and black vest.

loans.use: to pay for the processing of her degree.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
La socia Clara se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de verduras como cebollas,tomates y zanahorias,la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de verduras.La socia solicita le credito para comprar zanahorias,tomates y cebollas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Clara continues selling vegetables such as onions, tomatoes, and carrots. She works from 7 AM until 4 PM. She has done this work for several years and it has gone well.

Her dream is to expand her vegetable business.  She is seeking a loan in order to buy carrots, tomatoes, and onions.

She is thankful for the loan and promises to comply with the re-payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy carrots, tomatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cassava and plantains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase inventory for her business

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, tiene 41 años, es acompañado, tiene un hijo de 5 años, vive junto a su familia en casa propia, su actividad económica con la que tiene ingresos para salir adelante con su familia es el cultivo de maíz y pipián, oficio que aprendió de su padre, ya tiene 10 años de trabajar independiente.
El crédito lo utilizara para comprar abono, semilla, herbicidas, para preparar el terreno en el que sembrara, espera que su cosecha sea más abundante y cumpla con las demandas tanto familiares como de sus clientes.
Su visión es aumentar el área de cultivo para tener mayor rentabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Victor is 41 years old. He has a partner and a 5-year-old son. He lives with his family in their own home. He makes an income through his work growing corn and pipián (a type of squash) by which he and his family get ahead. He learned this occupation from his father and has now worked independently for 10 years.
 
The loan will be used to buy fertilizer, seed and herbicides, to prepare the ground before sowing. He then expects his harvest to be more abundant and to meet the demands of both his family and his customers. His vision is to increase the area he cultivates in order to increase profitability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed and herbicides

loans.name: María Nelis

texts.es:
María de 41 años de edad,  es profesora,esta casada su esposo trabaja en la policia nacional civil,tienen dos hijas que se encuentran estudiando.


Ella  se dedica a trabajar de profesora en dos turnos, trabaja con primer ciclo y por la tarde con segundo ciclo,el trabajo no le queda muy lejos a unos veinte minutos de su casa..


El crédito lo necesita para construir un corredor a su casa, el cual se moja hasta adentro cuando llueve fuerte y también poner unas  ventanas, de esa forma podrá estar mas protegida su familia y la necesidad quedara satisfecha.

El objetivo de ella es seguir remodelando su casa, para que a sus hijas les quede de herencia y eso lo lograra con el apoyo de CREDICAMPO.
texts.en:
María is 41 years old and works as a teacher. She is married and her husband works for the national civil police. They have two daughters who are in school.

María works two shifts in her job as a teacher. She works with one set of students and then in the afternoons she works with a second set of students. María does not have to travel very far for work since it takes her about 20 minutes to get to her job from her house.

The loan she is requesting will be used to build a corridor in her house. The existing area has gotten damp due to the strong rains. María will also have a few windows installed so that her family can be better protected, as well as to satisfy this particular need.

María’s goal is to continue with the renovations to her house since her daughters continue to live there. For this reason, she wants to accomplish this goal with the support of CrediCampo.

loans.use: to build a corridor in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase  palm oil to enlarge her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials for building his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more inventory (cups, plates, bowls, etc.) for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more nails, door locks and hinges for the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and oil to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more locks, nails, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and plantains.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more dried fish for her business.

loans.name: Jose Rudys

texts.es:
José, solicita un nuevo préstamo que utilizara para comprar abono, plaguicidas, herbicidas, semilla e insecticiditas, para iniciar los preparativos del terreno en el que realizara la siembra y evitar que el cultivo sea afectado por plagas.
Con el crédito anterior su cosecha fue más abundante, los granos son de mayor calidad, sus ventas mejoraron, ha aumentado el área de siembra, su condición económica es más estable, su grupo familiar se mantiene muy saludable.
texts.en:
Jose is requesting a new loan, which he will use to buy fertilizer, pesticide, herbicide, seed, and insecticide, in order to start preparing the land where he will plant and to avoid the affects of crop infestations. 

With the previous loan his harvest was more abundant, the grain was of higher quality, sales have improved, and he has increased the planting area. His financial condition is more stable and his household remains very healthy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide, herbicide, seed, and insecticide

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan tiene 26 años de edad, está acompañado, él solo logró estudiar bachillerato, él hubiera deseado continuar sus estudios académicos pero por falta de recursos económicos de sus padres no pudo continuar estudiando,la compañera de vida de Juan se dedica a los oficios del hogar.

Juan se inició en la agricultura desde muy pequeño junto a su padre la distancia que recorre a su lugar de trabajo es de 2 kilómetros de su casa el trabajo lo hace en conjunto con su compañera de vida. 

El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar dos novillos pequeños de repasto y cuando se le cumpla el plazo de su crédito venderá los novillos y con la ganancia él espera tener mas ingresos para su familia y darle una mejor vida a su compañera de vida.

El sueño de Juan es poder darle un mejor futuro a su pareja y a sus padres, de igual forma el espera mejorar su vivienda para tener un hogar digno para vivir.
texts.en: Juan is 26 years old and lives with a domestic partner. He was only able to study high school. He would have liked to study a career, but because of his parents' lack of financial resources he was not able to continue studying. His domestic partner works in household chores. Juan started farming with his father since he was very young. The distance that he travels from his home to his place of work is 2 kilometers, and he goes there with his life companion. He will use the loan to buy two small steers for breeding and fattening. When he needs to make a loan payment he will sell the steers and with the earnings he expects to have more income for his family and offer his partner a better life. Juan's dream is to be able to give his partner and his parents a better future, and make improvements in his house in order to have a decent place to live.

loans.use: To buy two steers for breeding and fattening.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to tend to and maintain her coffee crops.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.ru: Зубайде 43 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Зубайды - среднее образование. По характеру Зубайда имеет лидерские качества, в семье все проблемы решает сама, очень ответственная, общительная, жизнерадостная. Вместе с мужем Зубайда занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Зубайды, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 31 овца. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS) от реализации молока, также обрабатывает 0,54 ГА земли, где в основном выращивает -кукурузу. Полученный урожай реализуют оптовым поставщикам. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Зубайда обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум"  за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. После закупки коров, они будут находиться в собственном хозяйстве. Летом скот будет под присмотром пастуха. Доходы от кредита Зубайда планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство теплицы на территории дома.
texts.en: Zubaida is 43 years old, married and raising 5 children together with her husband. Zubaida has a secondary education. Character-wise, she has leadership qualities, always solving all of the family problem by herself, responsible, communicable, and happy.  Zubaida and her husband are involved in animal husbandry and farming, having started 20 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Zubaida's hard work, today her business contains 2 dairy cows and 31 sheep. The monthly income amounts to 12,000 som (KGS) from sales of milk.  She also works on a .54 hectares of land, where she primarily grows corn. She sells the resulting harvest to wholesale distributors.  In order to further develop her business, Zubaida requested a loan from the bank "Bai-Tushum" to buy cows to increase livestock headcount. The purchased cows will stay on their farm.  In the summer, the livestock will be under a shepherd's care.  Zubaida plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money to build a greenhouse on their land.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, fish, meat, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Liderazgo De Mujeres Group

texts.es: El grupo “LIDERAZGO DE MUJERES” es uno de los nuevos grupos conformada por 06 mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras que luchan por mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Reyda tiene 28 años de edad es conviviente con 02 hijos educando. Ella hace 03 años  compro su quiosco en el cual ofrece azúcar arroz bebidas cervezas golosinas. Ella inicio con la venta de anticuchos  tripitas. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de arroz azúcar fideos bebidas cervezas y golosinas. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Reyda es la segunda persona parada del lado derecho viste polo negro.
texts.en:
The "Liderazgo de Mujeres" [Leadership of Women] group is one of the new groups comprised of 6 hard-working women and entrepreneurs that fight for a better quality of life for their families. 

Reyda is 28 years old, in a civil union, and has two school aged children. Two years ago she bought a kiosk where she sells sugar, rice, beverages, beer and candy. She started out selling skewered tripe. The loan will be used to buy rice, sugar, noodles, beverages, beer and candy. 

The group thanks the Kiva investors for providing the loan. Reyda is the second person standing on the right, dressed in a black shirt.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, noodles, beverages, beer and candy.

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es: José tiene 47 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa, hijo y suegra. José posee una pequeña tienda en su hogar de habitación en la cual comercializa variedad de productos de primera necesidad como: arroz, frijoles, aceite, sal, pan dulce, golosinas, etc. Es un hombre trabajador quien hace todo lo que este en sus manos para dar a su familia lo necesario. Con el fin de contar con condiciones habitacionales más cómodas ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de una pared para dividir para un cuarto y poder así contar con mayor comodidad. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, ladrillo y hierro.
texts.en:
José is 47 years old and he lives in his own house along with his wife, child and mother-in-law. José owns a small shop in his home where he sells a variety of staple items such as: rice, beans, oil, salt, sweet bread, candy, etc. He is a hard-working man who does everything in his power to give his family the necessities. 

In order to have more comfortable living conditions he has made the decision to seek this loan from FUSAI to pay for the construction of a dividing wall for a room and this way be able to live more comfortably. The amount requested will buy cement, sand, bricks and iron.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks and iron to build a dividing wall.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SABOUGNOUMA est composé de femmes mariées, qui ont en moyenne 39 ans, et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Zanfina, commune de Guégnéka, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de charbon de bois, d’encens et de lait. Les femmes du groupe SABOUGNOUMA sont à leur onzième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente PENE, première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assis est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse d’encens. Elle compte acheter du geuni, du magnonkisseni, de l’eau de Cologne, des bouteilles vides, et d’autres parfums chez les grossistes au marché hebdomadaire. Après quinze jours de traitement, le produit final sera embouteillé et mis au marché. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et parfois ambulante, à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 21.000FCA, qui sera réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en: The Sabougnouma Group is made up of four married women. The group has an average age of 39 and an average of two children each. They all live within traditional families in the village of Zanfina, in Guégnéka commune, Dioïla prefecture, in the region of Koulikoro (the second largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali). They know each other through the ties of family, neighbourhood and friendship. They sell condiments, wood charcoal, incense and milk. This will be the Sabougnouma Group's eleventh loan. In order to satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they have sought help from Soro Yiriwaso. The group contact, Pene, the woman sitting on the left of the front row, is illiterate. She currently works as an incense vendor. She is planning on purchasing "guéni", magnonkisseni grains, l'eau de Cologne, empty bottles and other perfumes from the wholesalers at the weekly market. After 15 days of treatment, the final product will be bottled and sold. She sells individual bottles for cash to a mixed customer base out of her own home, though she sometimes goes out into the streets to sell. She is planning on making a monthly profit of 21 000 FCA, which will be reinvested into the business.

loans.use: to buy base materials for making incense

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es joven de 25 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres y hermanos, quienes viven en el Departamento de Sololá.
Juan comenta que se dedica a la peluquería (cortes de cabello). Eligió esta actividad porque no hay fuentes de trabajo en su comunidad. A través  de la actividad que realiza obtiene ingresos y ganancias aceptables que le ayudan a contribuir a la economía de su familia.
Ahora él ha observado que su negocio es bastante productivo, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo de Q 3,500.00 para la remodelación de su barbería y así podrá ofrecerles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Juan sueña con abrir otro local en otro lugar de su comunidad, con el propósito de mejorar la economía de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is a 25-year-old young man who lives with his parents and siblings in the Department of Solola.

Juan comments that he is dedicated to giving hair cuts in his barber shop.  He chose this activity because there are no other sources of work in his community. By means of this activity, Juan earns his income -- acceptable earnings that help him to contribute to the family economy.

Now, observing that his business is sufficiently productive, Juan has decided to request a loan of 3,500 quetzals to remodel his barber shop, enabling him to offer his customers better service.

Juan dreams of opening another shop in a different location in his community, for the purpose of improving his family's economy.

loans.use: to remodel his barber shop.

loans.name: Marta Iris

texts.es: Doña Martha es originaria de la ciudad de León, casada. Es de oficio comerciante se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Martha tiene 34 años de edad y ya es dueña de un pequeño negocio desde hace unos más de 9 años. Inicio su negocio con capital propio y poco a poco ha aumentado sus ventas logrando salir adelante. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Papel higiénico, Huevos, Tomates, Chiltomas, Cebollas y otros. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá ofrecer una amplia variedad de productos a sus clientes. Su plan futuro es tener mejores condiciones para atender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Marta is from the city of León and is married. She works as a vendor, working in a fruit juice bar. Martha is 34 years old and is the owner of a small business which she has owned for more than nine years. She set up the business with her own capital, and little by little she has grown the sales and managed to get ahead. 

Marta is seeking the loan to buy toilet paper, eggs, tomatoes, bell peppers, onions and more. She believes that the loan will very much help her as she will be able to provide her customers with a wider variety of products. Her plan for the future is to have better conditions to attend to her customers.

loans.use: to buy toilet paper, eggs, tomatoes, bell peppers, onions and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more plantains, corn, and other items.

loans.name: Neysi Slendy

texts.es:
Ella es Neysi Slendy madre de una pequeña menor de edad, con muchas ganas de salir adelante y crecer tanto como persona y a nivel profesional, gracias a que siempre ha estado al nivel o en el  entorno de la belleza y todo lo relacionado con ello. Estudió Peluquería hace algunos años, lo ha ejercido desde entonces, pero a veces el trabajo y las necesidades la absorben de tal manera que ha tenido que aplazar dos veces los estudios de estética por dificultades de dinero y tiempo. 

Ella es luchadora, perseverante, tiene un espíritu joven y no se rinde cuando de alcanzar las metas se trata, por eso una vez más se lanza a dar el todo por el todo para finalizar la carrera que en este momento es muy necesario capacitarse,  actualizarse y aprender lo que más se pueda para lograrlo. 

Tantas metas que tiene por ella y por la hija, a la que quiere, necesita y merece un presente y un mejor futuro. No queda duda que en el momento que una vieja amiga la lleva a las instalaciones de campo alto que hoy día asiste con un horario un poco flexible y aparte que puede financiar y tener el subsidio de kiva, es evidente las ganas de salir adelante, con lo propuesto están más notables y la alientan para que siga en marcha con el propósito. 

Ella  se entero del convenio con kiva que da una ayuda económica a los estudiantes que no tiene como pagar el valor normal de la cuotas mensuales y a ella le pareció que es una buena ayuda para ella, ya que le quedaría un poco mas cómodo el valor a pagar de las cuotas para que ella pueda economizar dinero y lo pueda invertir en el pago de otras cosas que necesite, o en otros gastos que necesite en el estudio.
texts.en:
This is Neysi Siendy. She is the mother of a minor child and has a great will to advance and grow both as a person and at a professional level, and thanks to that she has always kept up with or been in the field of beauty and everything related to it. She studied hairdressing some years ago, and she has practiced it since then, but sometimes the work and the necessities absorb her in such a way that she twice had to put off her studies of aesthetics due to difficulties of money and time. 

She is hard-working and persevering and has a young spirit, and she does not give up when it's a question of reaching her goals. For this reason, she is once more setting out to give her all to finish the course that is now very necessary for her training, continuing education, and learning the most that she can in order to succeed.

She has so many goals for herself and for her daughter, whom she loves, and who needs and deserves a better present and future. There was no doubt  at the moment when an old friend brought her to the facilities of Campo Alto that she would now attend with a schedule that is a bit flexible, and apart from being able to finance and have the subsidy from Kiva, it is evident that the drive to advance, with this proposal, is more impressive and encourages her so that she can continue with her plan.

She learned of the agreement with Kiva, which gives economic help to students who are not able to pay the normal monthly costs, and it appeared to her that it would be a good help for her, since it would leave her a little more comfortable in paying the costs so that she can save money and invest it in the payment for other things that she needs, or in other expenses for her studies.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of school fees

loans.name: Erenia Isabel

texts.es: Erenia Isabel es una mujer muy trabajadora que habita en la ciudad de Acoyapa Chontales, desde hace varios años labora como secretaria en el instituto San Sebastián, donde ha podido desarrollarse en su profesión y apoyar a su familia, especialmente a su mamá que tiene problemas de salud dado su edad. Ella tiene el objetivo de construir su casa, cubriendo las necesidades básicas, que poco a poco a través de varios créditos otorgados lo ha logrado. Erenia necesita terminar la construcción de un sumidero y proporcionar a su mamá mejoras condiciones sanitarias, por tal razón solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales piedras canteras, cemento, hierro y pagar mano de obra, lo que permitirá terminar de levantar las paredes del mismo y darle un repello y sellado.
texts.en:
Erenia Isabel is a very hard-working woman who lives in the city of Acoyapa Chontales, for the last few years she has been working as a secretary in the San Sebastián institute, where she was able to develop in her role and support her family, and in particular her mother who is of poor health. 

She has set herself the aim of building her home, covering the basic needs that she has achieved little by little through various loans. Erenia needs to finish building a bath and give her mother better sanitary conditions; this is why she is seeking the loan to buy materials such as quarry stores, cement, and steel and to pay for labor. This will enable her to finish building the walls of the sink and white-wash and seal it.

loans.use: to buy materials: quarry stones, cement, steel and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Corazón Salvaje Group

texts.es: Es un grupo formado por tres socios laboriosos y coordinado por la señora María de 41 años de edad, casada y madre de un hijo de 8 años, tiene una pulpería en su domicilio que ofrece variedad de productos para la población cercana a su comunidad como son los granos básicos arroz, frijoles, azúcar, galletas, caramelos, carne de pollo, carne de res, carne de cerdo, pan, tortas, gaseosas, caramelos, entre otros. Otra socia es la señora Ana de 27 años ofrece el servicio de comida todos los fines de semanas y el señor Luis de 26 años que brida el servicio de técnico en refrigeración a la población.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three hard-working members and is coordinated by María. She is 41 years old, married and the mother of an 8-year-old child. She has a grocery store in her home that offers a variety of products to the residents near her community, such as basic grains, rice, beans, sugar, cookies, candies, chicken, beef, pork, bread, cakes, sodas, etc. 

Another member, Ana, who is 27 years old, offers food service every weekend. Luis is 26 years old and he provides services as a refrigeration technician to the community.

loans.use: to invest in products like rice, beans, chicken, beef, bread, and much more

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es: Pascual tiene 43 años de edad, vive  con su familia en el municipio de Nahualá, departamento de Sololá, tiene tres hijos: el primer hijo tiene 18 años de edad, en este año se gradúa de maestro, el segundo tiene 15 años de edad estudia tercero básico, y el tercero tiene 6 años de edad estudia primero primaria, Pascual  obtiene sus ingresos impartiendo clases a niños de primaria, él solicita un crédito por un monto de Q. 5,000.00 para comprar un terreno, el sueño de Pascual es que sus hijos sea profesionales.
texts.en:
Pascual is 43 years old and lives with his family in the Municipality of Nahuala, Department of Solola. He has 3 children: the 1st child is 18 years old and  he will graduate this year as a teacher. The 2nd son is 15 years old and is studying in 'third basic', while a 3rd child is 6 years old and in his 1st year of primary school. 

Pascual obtains his income offering classes to primary school children. He is rquesting a loan for a total of 5,000 quetzals to purchase a plot of land. 

His dream is for his children to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Gerry Florentino

texts.en: Gerry Florentino is a merchant from Dimiao, Bohol. He is engaged in a retail business selling various goods and items to the people in his community. Gerry Florentino is asking for a loan to buy more inventory of items to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda, and beverages. With this, he will be able to sell more, augmenting his sales and income. Gerry Florentino hopes to make his business a success in the future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, soda, and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more sugar, milk, oats, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cassava for her business.

loans.name: Rufa

texts.en: Rufa is a married woman and a mother of 7 children from the town of San Miguel, Bohol.  She has been engaged in rice farming business for more than 10 years now.  This is the source of her income.  Rufa is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and to pay a laborer's fee to yield a bigger harvest.  With this loan, she will be able to improve her farm thus augmenting her harvest and yield.  In the future, Rufa has hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and to pay a laborer's fee to yield a bigger harvest

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio de 53 años de edad, un hombre luchador desde ya hace mucho tiempo, se dedica a la pesca; todos los dias emprende su labor.  Gregorio no pudo realizar estudios academicos por falta de recursos economicos, es ahora quien lucha por su familia trabajando arduamente dia a dia. Él necesita el efectivo del préstamo para mejorar su vivienda. Casa que le ha costado mucho obtener, pero que con el esfuerzo y la dedicacion lo ha logrado.

A futuro desea tener una casa que le brinde la seguridad, para su esposa y él y que en los momentos de lluvia no tenga que mojarse.
texts.en:
Gregorio is 53 years old. He has been fighting to get ahead for many years and he works as a fisherman. He sets out to work everyday. Gregorio was unable to study due to a lack of financial resources. Now he is the one who strives for his family, working arduously day to day. He needs the cash from the loan to improve his housing. It cost him a lot to get the house, but with effort and dedication, he achieved it. 

In the future, he hopes to have a house that provides security for his wife and himself, and that when it rains, he won't have to get wet.

loans.use: to improve his housing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a cooking gas system

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria es una persona de 36 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Nahualá, departamento de Sololá, tiene 5 hijos de las edades: el primero de 15 años de edad estudia segundo grado básico, el segundo tiene 12 años de edad está en quinto grado primaria, el tercero tiene 9 años de edad estudia tercer grado primaria, el cuarto tiene 6 años de edad estudia primer grado primaria y el más pequeño tiene 3 años de edad todavía no asiste a la escuela, tiene una tienda en su casa que es allí donde obtiene sus ingresos para sostener a su familia, Maria solicita un préstamo por un monto de Q. 3,000.00 para comprar más productos y tener mejor surtido la tienda y de esa manera atender mejor sus clientes, más adelante ella tiene pensado poner otra tienda en la comunidad.
texts.en: Maria is a 38-year-old woman.  She lives in the town of Nahualá in the department of Sololá.  She has five children. The first one is 15 and is in middle school; the second is 12 and is in the fifth grade; the third is 9 and is in 3rd grade; the fourth is 6 and in first grade; and the littlest is 3 and doesn't go to school yet.  Maria has a store in her house where one can get products for the family.  She's seeking a loan of 3000GTQ to buy more products so the store is better stocked and can serve more customers.  Later on Maria plans to open another store in the community.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Abulfaz

texts.en: Abulfaz is single.  He is 23 years old and is living in the Abseron region with his parents and sister.  He graduated from the University and now works as a designer.  A while ago his computer broke and he wasn't able to work.  Then Abulfaz applied to Komak company for a loan.  With this loan he wants to repair his computer and to it will start working.  Abulfaz needs 700 Azerbaijan New Manat.  Abulfaz says great thanks for the aid to the Kiva organization and all lenders.

loans.use: to repair his computer

loans.name: Juan Elvis Fernando

texts.es: Juan tiene 25 años de edad, vive con su pequeño hijo en el municipio de Nahualá, departamento de Sololá, su hijo tiene 4 años de edad todavía no asiste a la escuela, él obtiene sus ingresos en la compra y venta de hojas de maxán, en el mes de diciembre obtiene más ganancia en comparación con otros meses, lleva 3 años de estar trabajando en  el negocio de la compra y venta de hojas de maxán, Juan solicita un préstamo por un monto de Q.3,000.00 para invertir en el negocio de la compra y venta de hojas de maxán, el sueño de Juan es construir una casa de block para mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Juan is 25 and lives with his small son in the town of Nahualá in the department of Sololá. His son is 4 and doesn't go to school yet.  Juan earns his income buying and selling maxan leaves.  He makes his biggest profits in December compared to other months.  He's been buying and selling maxan leaves for 3 years.  He's seeking a loan of 3000GTQ to invest in the business.  His dream is to build a cement-block house to improve living conditions for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy and sell maxan leaves.

loans.name: Sabougnouman Group

texts.fr:
Les six  femmes du groupe Sabougnouman vivent toutes dans des familles monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 41 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Darsalam de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la Républiques du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier de Darsalam. Elles font le petit commerce de condiments, d’habillements, de grains de céréales et de la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  12éme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Bah (2éme  femme debout de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiments de tout genre dans le quartier  de Darsalam et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grande quantité de condiment de tout genre  pour la satisfaction de la demande  clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Bah espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de  60 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé  pour la prise en charge d’une partie des dépenses familiale et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The six members of the Sabougnouman group all live in monogamous families. On the average, they are 41 years old, with four children.  They all live in the Darsalam neighborhood of Segou (the fourth administrative district of Mali).
They know each other as neighbors, relatives by blood or marriage or through their work in Darsalam. They work as vendors selling condiments, clothing, cereals and cooked dishes. With the goal of bolstering their working capital, the group members have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their 12th solidarity loan cycle.

Mrs. Bah (the second one standing from right to left in the photo) is a well-known vendor of all sorts of condiments in the Darsalam neighborhood and nearby. She plans to use her loan to buy large quantities of various condiments in order to meet customer demand. She sells for cash and often on credit to a mixed clientele. With this loan, Mrs. Bah hopes to earn an average monthly revenue of 60,000 West African francs, which will be used to partially take care of family expenses as well as to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Bendicion De Dios Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal  Bendición de Dios está conformada por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un hombre, padres y madres responsables con quince hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios del  Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de norte de la región. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron cursar sus estudios y se vieron en la necesidad de trabajar a temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Martha Lorena y  tiene por actividad económica, la elaboración y venta de tortillas, producto comestibles elaborado a base de maíz. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de las tortillas como es el quintal de maíz. Bendición de Dios agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos  y países pobre como Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The "Bendición de Dios" [God's Blessing] communal bank is composed of eight members, six women and one man. They are responsible fathers and mothers with fifteen children in their care. They are natives of Sauce, a place located in the northern part of the region. 

The members are known for being hard-working and responsible and for having a desire for self-improvement. Unfortunately, because of the lack of financial resources, they were not able to complete their educations and found themselves needing to work at an early age in order to help with household expenses.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead, Martha Lorena is the coordinator. Her business is making and selling tortillas, a corn-based food product. Her business is located in her place of residence. She works in her business about ten hours a day, selling her product. The objective of this loan is to invest in working capital and to stock the business by purchasing raw material for making the tortillas, like a quintal [46 kilos] of corn.

Bendición de Dios thanks the Kiva lenders for the help they provide to people with scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua in order for them to have a decent means of working.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to stock her business by purchasing a quintal of corn for making tortillas.

loans.name: Tracee Carolina

texts.es: Tracee es una joven mujer de 29 años de edad que habita en el barrio Nuevo Amanecer de Juigalpa Chontales, junto a su esposo han procreado dos lindas niñas que están en edad escolar. Desde hace seis años apoya a su esposo para cubrir todas las necesidades básicas de su hogar y en especial la educación de sus hijas. Tracee tiene el objetivo de hacer crecer su pequeño negocio familiar a través de la variada oferta, ya que sus clientes demandan más y mejores productos. Ella solicitud este crédito para la compra de anillos, calzado, cosméticos, granos básicos, chiverías, ropa intima, prendas de plata, acero, entre otros productos del negocio.
texts.en:
Tracee is a young 29 year old woman who lives in the Nuevo Amanecer neighborhood of Juigalpa Chontales. She and her husband have two beautiful school-aged daughters. For six years she has been supporting her husband in covering the household expenses, particularly her daughters' education. 

Tracee has the goal to grow her small family business through a range of products because her customers are demanding more and better products. She requested this loan to buy rings, footwear, cosmetics, basic grains, snacks, underwear, gold-plated jewelry, wax and other items for her business.

loans.use: to buy rings, footwear, cosmetics, basic grains, snacks, underwear, gold-plated jewelry, wax, and other products.

loans.name: Yarince Misael

texts.es:
Una mezcla de olor de aceite mecánico y productos nuevos son los que te reciben al entrar al taller de repuestos para carros de Yarince Hernández. Él tiene la edad de 30 años y es un comerciante originario del departamento de Estelí. Semana tras semana verifica que no falte ninguna herramienta, sin estas su negocio iría cuesta abajo. Comenzó en el oficio de venta de repuestos cuando sus estudios universitarios no le fueron lo suficiente para llevar el pan a la casa. 
Su objetivo es incrementar el inventario de su taller, por lo tanto solicita un segundo préstamo para obtener más herramientas, motores y aceites. Su meta es obtener más clientes y lograr una estabilidad económica que le brinde seguridad a su familia. Él está agradecido por la ayuda financiera que Kiva le ha ofrecido. Su plan futuro es lograr independencia económica como empresario.
texts.en:
A mixture of motor oil and new product smell is what you'll get when you enter Yarince Hernández's car parts shop.  Yarince is a 30-year-old businessman, originally from the department of Estelí.  Week after week he makes sure he's not lacking any tools; his business would go downhill without them.  He started selling parts when his university studies didn't go well enough for him to bring in the daily bread.

Yarince's objective is to increase the inventory in his shop so he's seeking a second loan to buy more tools, motors, and oils.  His goal is to gain more clients and achieve financial stability to bring security to his family.  He is grateful for the financial help Kiva has offered him.  His future plan is to become an economically independent business owner.

loans.use: to buy more tools, motors, and oils.

loans.name: Maciely

texts.es: Maciely, de 25 años está casada con René y junto a él tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 1 año de edad respectivamente, vive junto a ellos en su casa propia. Maciely trabajó desde muy pequeña y se esforzó mucho, actualmente tiene como actividad principal la venta de productos comestibles en general, pone a la venta arroz, azúcar, pan, leche , huevos, accesorios del hogar, bebidas, embutidos entre otros. Su bodega está instalada en la parte delantera de su casa ubicada en una zona estratégica de su localidad. Lleva ya 2 años con su tienda, cuenta con la ayuda incondicional de su esposo y se siente feliz de poder compartir un negocio que los beneficia a todos. Le gusta su trabajo pues le permite disponer de su tiempo para realizar otras actividades del hogar, este negocio le genera buenas ganancias ya que siempre hay clientes interesados en su productos y vende al por mayor a los minoristas que también tiene como clientes. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1800 por tanto agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos, ella por su parte se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de productos comestibles y artículos de primera necesidad como arroz, pan, huevos, leche, azúcar, aceite y otros productos que le permitan seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Maciely, age 25, is married to René.  They have two children, ages six and one.  They live with their children in their own house.  Maciely has worked ever since she was very little, and she puts forth great effort.  Currently her main business activity is selling general food products.  She sells rice, sugar, bread, milk, eggs, household accessories, drinks, sausages, and others.  Her store is set up in the front part of her house, which is in a strategic area where she lives.  She has had her store for two years.  She counts on her husband’s unconditional help.  She is happy to be able to share a business that benefits everyone.

She likes her work.  It allows her to use her time to do other household activities.  This business generates good earnings for her.  This is because there are always customers interested in her products.  She sells wholesale to the retailers who are also her customers.

At this time she is requesting 1,800 soles.  She is grateful to all of the people who make her loan possible in order to continue with her objectives.  She pledges to make her payments punctually.  She will use the requested loan to buy a greater quantity of food products and basic needs items like rice, bread, eggs, milk, sugar, cooking oil, and other products that will allow her to continue working.

loans.use: to buy food products like rice, bread, eggs, milk, sugar, cooking oil, and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase mobile phones, mobile accessories, and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es: Manuela es una persona de 44 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Nahualá, departamento de Sololá, tiene cuatros hijos, el primer hijo tiene 22 años de edad trabaja en actividades agrícola en una finca y  ayuda en los gastos de la casa, el segundo tiene 15 años de edad, también trabaja en la finca, el tercero tiene 8 años de edad estudia segundo grado primaria y el último tiene 3 años de edad todavía no asiste a la escuela, se dedica a comprar y a vender banano, lleva 15 años de estar trabajando en el negocio de allí obtiene sus ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia, Manuela solicita un préstamo por un monto de Q. 6,000.00 para comprar más banano, con las ganancias que le deje el negocio piensa construir una casa de block e ir buscando otro mercado para la venta de banano.
texts.en:
Manuela is 44 years old, and lives in the city of Nahualá, Sololá.  She has four children.  The eldest, who is 22 years old, works in agriculture on a farm and helps with the household expenses.  The second oldest is 15 years old and also works on the farm.  The third child is eight years old and is in second grade.  The youngest is three years old and does not attend school yet.  Manuela works buying and selling bananas.  She has worked in this business for 15 years and it is how she earns an income to provide for her family.

Manuela is seeking a loan for Q. 6,000 to purchase more bananas.  With the earnings from her business, she plans to build a brick house and start searching for a new market to sell her bananas.

loans.use: purchase bananas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cold cuts and wheat flour products.

loans.name: Xazar

texts.en:
Xazar is a master carpenter and 39 years old.  He is married with three children.  One of them is a 13 year old boy who is in the seventh grade in school.  Another is an eleven year old girl who is going to fifth grade and the little child who goes to third grade. 

The family is living in the Abseron region but are refugees from the occupied territory of Fuzuli city.  It’s noted that Xazar is a master carpenter.  He makes wooden doors and windows.
