She begins her workday very early opening the doors of her house for her customers and closing very late to provide good care of her customers.

She started her business with her own funds and has already 15 years of doing this type of work which she does with much enthusiasm. Her sales are made in cash in surrounding counties to hers or Chinandega where she has permanent and occasional customers.

She also sells food on weekends offering: enchiladas, roast meat, roast chicken, soups, tripe, chicken and others dishes. The purpose of this loan is to invest in working capital and fill her grocery store, to provide varieties of products to her customers and thus get higher income.

loans.use: to purchase products such as meat, poultry, fruits and vegetables, grains, frozen food, candies and other items.

loans.name: Cipriano

texts.es: Cipriano es viudo tiene dos hijos y vive en la comunidad de Caluyo en una casa de adobe que es de su propiedad pero no tiene alcantarillado Cipriano es lechero y necesita credito para comprar una vaca lechera Cipriano es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Cipriano is a widower, has two children, and lives in the community of Caluyo in a house made of adobe, which is he owns, but which has no indoor plumbing.

Cipriano is the sole source of income for his household and that is why he needs your help.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: Jose es soltero, no tiene hijos, vive en El Alto, en una casa de ladrillo y cemento Jose es inquilino. Jose es chofer y esta expuesto a choques Necesita credito para comprar un motor, Jose es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar.
texts.en: Jose is single and has no children.  He rents a brick and cement house in El Alto.  Jose is a driver and is exposed to accidents. He needs a loan to buy and engine.  Jose provides the only source of income for his home.

loans.use: To buy an engine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a university degree course.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria es separada pero tiene 4 hijos, vive en la ciudad de La Paz. Maria vive en una casa de adobe que es de su propiedad y cuenta con todos los servicios basicos Maria se dedica a la venta de ropa y es ayudante de cocina. Necesita credito para abastecerse de ropa para hombres y mujeres Maria es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Maria is separated, but she has four children. She lives in the city of La Paz. Maria lives in an adobe house which she owns and she has all the basic utilities. Maria makes a living by selling clothing, and she is also a kitchen assistant. She needs the loan to restock her store with clothing for men and women. Maria’s work is the only source of income for her household, which is why she needs your help.

loans.use: to restock her store with clothing for men and women

loans.name: Manuel Mesias

texts.es: Son 8 años de los que Manuel se dedica a la ganadería, él es un joven soltero que vive con sus padres y sus 4 hermanos, sus padres se dedican a la ganadería y a trabajo de campo y es de ahí que Manuel aprendió  a dar un correcto cuidado al ganado, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca ya que comenta que le va bien en la ganadería, la meta de Manuel es incrementar su negocio  para mejorar sus ingreso y comprar una mini hacienda donde pueda trabajar él y darle trabajo a toda su familia.
texts.en: Manuel has been raising cattle for 8 years. He is a young, single man who lives with his parents and 4 siblings. His parents raise cattle and farm, which is how Manuel learned to correctly care for cattle. He is going to use the loan to buy a cow as his business is going well. Manuel's goal is to increase his business and buy a small farm where he can work and provide work for his family.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Oscar Omar

texts.es:
Oscar de 31 años de edad, estudió hasta cuarto grado en la escuela porque era de escasos recursos económicos, ahora él está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y también trabaja en un molino  para maíz en su casa, tiene 2 hijos y por lo tanto ellos y su esposa dependen de Oscar.

Oscar es carpintero, ya tiene 10 años de realizar este trabajo que aprendió gracias a un amigo, además trabaja también en la agricultura, en la siembra de granos básicos. La carpintería la tiene en su vivienda y su esposa le ayuda en lo que esté a su alcance.
   
El préstamo lo utilizará para la remodelación de su vivienda, específicamente para reparar el techo y piso pues ya se acerca la época de lluvia y él teme que el agua entre a su casa, el financiamiento le permitirá mejorar sus condiciones de vida para  sus pequeños hijos y esposa.
   
Sus sueños a futuro son tener una mejor calidad de vida para su familia, seguir mejorando la vivienda, desea también ampliar la carpintería para ofrecer mejores muebles, y que sus hijos logren estudiar mucho para que sean personas de bien en la vida.
texts.en:
Oscar is 31 years of age.  He studied until fourth grade in school because of scarce economic resources.  He is married and his wife takes care of the house chores in addition to working in a corn mill in his house.  They have 2 children which depend on him, in addition to his wife.  
Oscar has been a carpenter for 10 years, craft that he learned from a friend. He also works in agriculture, cultivating basic grains.  He works as a carpenter from his house and his wife helps him with whatever she can.  
The loan will be used for remodeling his house, specifically to repair the roof and flooring of his house because the rainy season is approaching and he is afraid that the water will get into his house.  The loan will help him improve the quality of life for his wife and small children.  
His future dreams are to improve the quality of life for his family and keep improving his home.  He also wishes to expand his carpentry services to offer better furniture and that his children can study a lot so they can be good people.

loans.use: To repair the roof and floor of his house.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: Cristina es viuda, tiene un hijo Cristina vive en El ALTo en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad Cristina es empleada publica y es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar. Necesita credito para la construccion de un cuarto
texts.en: Cristina is a widow. She has a son and lives in El Alto in a house of brick and cement that is her own property. Cristina is a public employee, which is her household's only source of income. She needs this loan for the construction of a room.

loans.use: to construct a room.

loans.name: Maria Griselda

texts.es: María tiene 28 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 6 hijos ( 12 años, 10 años, 8 años, 6 años, 5 años y 1 año de edad. María se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar. Ella desea elaborar un cuarto a base de madera y lámina para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para hacer la inversión dado que no cuenta con el capital disponible para hacerlo por su cuenta pero si tiene la capacidad de pago que el crédito implica.
texts.en: María is 28 years old and lives at home with her life partner and their 6 children aged 12 years, 10 years, 8 years, 6 years, 5 years, and 1-year-old. María has sold tortillas for quite some time, helping her bring sustenance to her home. She wants to construct a room with wood and sheet metal. She has applied for a loan from FUSAI to make this investment because she does not have the capital available to complete it on her own account. She does have the ability to complete the repayments that the loan requires.

loans.use: to construct a room with wood and metal sheeting.

loans.name: Francisca Jaqueline

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Santa Rosa Del Blanco se reúne cada quince días en la ciudad de Charapoto. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.
En este lugar vive la señora Francisca, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 10 y 5 años que  estudian en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.
Doña Francisca es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para ayudarle a su marido a salir adelante, ella realiza el crédito para ella y su marido, mientras ella se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo su marido se dedica a cultivar maíz y arroz, el siembra en toda época del año pues los terrenos se prestan para poder regar los cultivos en toda época del año ya que son tierras bajas y están cerca del rio que atraviesa la ciudad, de esta forma siempre tienen buena cosecha que les sirve para salir adelante y ayudar a las personas que trabajan con ellos.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, insecticidas y fertilizantes que necesita su marido para los cultivos. Lleva 2 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe de la institución. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Santa Rosa Del Blanco" meets every 15 days in the city of Charapoto.  This is a place known for its traditional culture and also for being minutes away from two of the best beaches in the province: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

This is where Francisca, 40, lives.  She is married and has 2 children aged 10 and 5 years who attend school.  Her husband is a farmer.

Francisca is a woman who enjoys working so that she can help her husband and get ahead.  She is taking this loan for herself and for her husband.  While Francisca sells clothing through a catalog, her husband works cultivating corn and rice.  He farms all seasons of the year, as his land lends itself to being able to irrigate crops during all seasons.  This is because these are lowlands that are close to the river that crosses the city.  This is why he always has a good harvest that enables him to get ahead and also help the people who work with him.

This loan will be used to buy clothing, as well as the insecticides and fertilizers that her husband needs for his crops.  Francisca has been with her communal bank for 2 years, and she likes it because of the benefits she receives from the institution.  Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy clothing, insecticides and fertilizers

loans.name: Nely De Jesus

texts.es: Nely, tiene 43 años de edad, esta casada, tiene un hijo y reside en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, vende mercadería como ropa de segunda mano clasificada y variedades como adornos, cuadernos, cosméticos etc. El negocio lo tiene en un local comercial. Ha mantenido el negocio mediante la inversión de varios prestamos, actualmente solicita el séptimo préstamo que es por 21,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar ropa usada clasificada para damas, caballeros y niños para la venta. Su plan es construir el propio local para el negocio.
texts.en: Nely is 43 years old, married, and has one child.  She lives in the town of Choloma, in Cortes.  She has always worked in trade; she sells merchandise such as good quality used clothing and an assortment of other items such as decorations, notebooks, cosmetics, etc.  Her business is located in a shop.  She has kept the business running by investing in it through various loans.  At this time she is requesting her 7th loan, for 21,000 Honduran lempiras, to buy used clothing for men, women and children to sell.  Her plan is to build her own store for the business.

loans.use: to buy used clothing to sell

loans.name: Sokkea

texts.en:
Sokkea (in the photo) lives about 20 km from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. She stays at home and does housework. The main source of income is from her husband’s business. He is a construction worker. Sokkea has two sons and two daughters. Three of her children are married and live in separate homes. The other one is s garment factory worker.  

Sokkea is asking for a loan to buy a motorbike for her daughter who is a garment factory worker to drive to work. She rents a house to stay at in Phnom Penh. With a motorbike, which she will buy with the money from the loan, she will be able to visit home sometimes.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es: Jose Francisco mayor de edad casado con dos hermosos hijos menores de edad y aun bajo su responsabilidad, originario del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser un hombre responsable, trabajador y con muchos deseos de superación personal, Jose es un microempresario y propietario de dos negocios en cuales son Disco Móvil donde ofrece sus servicios en todo tipo de ocasión como: Cumpleaños, Bodas, fiestas municipales, Quinceaños y fiestas particulares dentro y fuera de este municipio, también tiene un taller de carpintería en su domicilio en el cual elabora todo tipo de muebles como: camas, roperos, cómodas, mesas, comedor, puertas entre otros, principalmente pantris y puertas, sus compras son al contado, tiene clientes  fijos y eventuales, uno de sus sueños es poder crecer, aprovechar las oportunidades que se le presenta con sus dos negocios, ver a sus hijos transformados en todos unos profesionales, algo que el no logro. El objetivo de este financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de madera y darle mantenimiento a su disco móvil. Jose Francisco agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.-
texts.en: Jose Francisco is an older gentleman who is married with two beautiful children. His children are minors and are still under his care. He is originally from the municipality of Chinandega located in the west of the country. He is known for being a responsible, hardworking man who is eager to seek self-improvement. Jose is a micro-entrepreneur and the owner of two businesses. One is a portable soundstage that he offers DJ services for all types of occasions including birthdays, weddings, municipal parties, Sweet Sixteens, and other parties for individuals within and outside of his town. His second business is a carpentry shop in his home. He produces all types of furniture such as beds, wardrobes, dressers, tables, dining, doors, and others. He mostly makes pantries and doors. He makes his purchases with cash. He has permanent and temporary customers. One of his dreams is to grow the opportunities he is presented with from the two businesses. He'd like to see his two children become professionals, something that he could not accomplish. The purpose of this loan is the invest in working capital, purchasing wood and to maintain his DJ equipment. Jose Francisco greatly appreciates the support offered by Kiva lenders to low-income people.

loans.use: to maintain his DJ equipment and purchase wood for his woodworking shop.

loans.name: Panha

texts.en: Panha (in the photo) is 21 years old and lives in a village outside of Phnom Penh City. He has two young sons. Panha and his wife are garment factory workers. They commute to work by taking their own motorbike, but the motorbike is old and breaking down. Hence, he applied for a loan to replace the old motorcycle with a new one and use the rest of the loan to build a kitchen.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle and build a kitchen.

loans.name: Seupepe

texts.en: Seupepe is a married woman of 26 years with three children. She runs three small businesses: selling crops from her plantation, peanuts from her peanut farm, and a bakery selling a variety of food and savories in and around her community. She has been doing this for three years. Seupepe has requested a loan to buy ingredients for her business and things needed for her plantation such as chemicals, rakes, tarpaulin, iron roofing, a sack of flour, cooking oil, large pots and pans, a baking oven, and empty water gallon containers. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Seupepe hopes to expand her businesses and provide essential everyday needs for her family

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her bakery and things needed for her plantation

loans.name: Serieux Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Sérieux vivent toutes dans des familles monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 47 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Darsalam de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la Républiques du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenus dans le quartier de Darsalam. Elles font le petit commerce d’habillements, d’élevage et de la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  5éme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Yaya  Mariam  (1ére  femme assise de la  gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse des habits et de l’encens dans le quartier  de Darsalam et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 Pièces de bazin  pour satisfaire la demande de  sa  clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Yaya    Mariam   espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de  45.000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé  pour la prise en charge d’une partie des dépenses familiale et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The four women of group Sérieux all live in monogamous families. They are on average 47 years old with four children. They all live in the Darsalam neighborhood in Segou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They met through neighbors, family, marriage bonds and profit-generating activities in their neighborhood of Darsalam. They retail clothing, raise cattle, and sell prepared foods. To increase their working capital, the group’s members have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso; this is their fifth cycle of solidarity loans.

Mrs. Yaya Mariam (first woman sitting from the left to the right in the picture) is a major retailer of clothing and incense for Darsalam and neighboring areas. She plans on using her loan to purchase two pieces of brocade to satisfy demand from her clientele. She retails for cash or, often, extends credit to her mixed-gender clientele.

With this loan, Mrs. Yaya  Mariam hopes to make an average monthly profit of 45,000 XOF. It will be reallocated to pay for part of the family’s expenses and to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy brocade.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en: Filomena is a 49-year-old woman with four children. She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Filomena has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a mist blower, fertilizers, taro roots, a tarpaulin, iron roofing, and nails for her farm. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Filomena hopes to support her family and expand her plantation.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a mist blower, fertilizers, taro roots, a tarpaulin, iron roofing, and nails

loans.name: Kaloline

texts.en: Kaloline is 43 years old and married with four children. She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Kaloline has requested a loan to buy chemicals and a tarpaulin for her business, louvers and louver frames for her home renovation, and to pay up her kids school fees. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013. With her profits, Kaloline hopes to support her family and improve more on her plantation business.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a tarpaulin, louvers, and window frames and to pay school fees

loans.name: Diouma

texts.fr:
Cette femme fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 12 décembre 2009 et qui regroupe des membres très solidaires. La plupart pratiquent comme activité le commerce.
Diouma est âgée de 52 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants dont 4 garçons. Elle fait comme activité génératrice de revenus le commerce et l'embouche ovine. D'ailleurs avec le prêt elle compte acheter 4 moutons à 50000f l'un. Avec les 150000f qui reste, elle va acheter 5 sacs de mil de 100kg à 20000f pour le revendre à 30000f le sac. Elle achète aussi du bissap pour le revendre.
Les bénéfices lui permettent de renforcer son épargne dans le banc villageois. et d'entretenir ses enfants.
texts.en:
This woman belongs to a finance group created on December 12, 2009, which includes very solidary members. Most are active in retail.

Diouma is 52 years old, married, and a mother of ten, including four boys. Her business is retail and sheep raising. With this loan, she plans to purchase four sheep costing 50,000 XOF each. With the remaining 150,000 XOF, she will purchase five hundred-kilo bags of millet at 20,000 XOF each, which she retails for 30,000 XOF apiece. She also purchases and resells hibiscus.

Profits allow her to increase her savings in the finance group and to provide for her children.

loans.use: to buy sheep and millet.

loans.name: Jennifer María

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Santa Rosa Del Blanco se reúne cada quince días en la ciudad de Charapoto. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.
En este lugar vive la señora Jennifer, tiene 22 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 1 año, actualmente está en su quinto mes de embarazo de su segundo hijo. El marido es agricultor y tiene un  camión en el cual realiza fletes. 
Doña Jennifer es una joven ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de zapatillas por catalogo y productos de Belcorp (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día a ofrecer sus productos los mismos que  deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, con sus ganancias ella compra cosas para su pequeño y ahora para el que está por venir.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y zapatillas. Esta hace dos años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan a salir adelante. Sus sueños son tener a su bebé.
texts.en:
The credit group Santa Rosa Del Blanco meets every fifteen days in the city of Charapoto. This town is known for its traditional culture and also for being a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province, including San Jacinto and San Clemente.
In this town lives Jennifer. She is 22 years old and has a common-law relationship and a one-year-old son. She is currently in the fifth month of pregnancy with her second child. Her partner is a farmer who has a truck with which he carries freight. Jennifer is a young housewife who helps her husband generate household resources by selling shoes and Belcorp products by catalog including beauty products, cosmetics, fragrances, and women's accessories. She sells door-to-door for three days a week for two to three hours each day. She sells her products on credit and collects the money each week. She has done this work for three years and is doing very well. With her profits she buys things for her little one and the baby she is expecting.
This loan will be used to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and choose. She joined her credit group two years ago. She likes it because the loans help her get ahead. Her dreams are to take care of her baby.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and shoes.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es: Ramiro, mayor de edad casado  con  cuatro hijos todos independientes, originario del municipio de Chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del país, zona donde predomina el comercio, turismo, Ramiro se caracteriza por ser una hombre trabajador, responsable con muchos deseos de superación personal, es un microempresario propietario y administrador de una ruta de transporte colectivo urbano, donde ofrece sus servicios al publico, ademas de esta actividad el ofrece el servicio de electricidad mecánico automotriz teniendo su taller en su casa de habitación, inicia este negocio con fondos propios y con financiamientos negocio que tiene ya 14 años de dedicarse a este servicio, Ramiro poco a poco ha logrado ir saliendo adelante brindadoles un mejor futuro a sus hijos, uno de sus sueños hoy en día es mejorar su unidad de trabajo y teniéndola en optimas condiciones para brindarles un mejor servicio a sus usuarios, El objetivo de este crédito es para la compra de llantas para su unidad y algunos otros repuestos para darle mantenimiento a su unidad.
texts.en: Ramiro is an older gentleman who is married with four children who are all independent. His is from the municipality of Chinandega located in the west of the country. It is an area of trade and tourism. Ramiro is a hardworker and a responsible micro-entrepreneur who is eager for self-improvement. He manages a urban public transit tout which offers its services to the public. In addition, he provides a service as an auto mechanic and electrician. He has a workshop in his home. He started this business with funding 14 years ago. Ramiro has slowly managed to get ahead to bring a better future to his children. One of his dreams is to improve his workshop to have it in optimal condition to provide better service to his customers. The purpose of this loan is to purchase tires for his vehicle and other parts of maintain it.

loans.use: to purchase tires and parts for his transport vehicle.

loans.name: Sombel

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Sombel, âgé de la cinquantaine, évolue dans le secteur de la couture depuis des années. C’est en 1989, qu’il a démarré l’apprentissage du métier de tailleur chez un de ses oncles qui possédait un grand atelier de confection. Neuf ans plus tard, Sombel ouvre son propre atelier en 1998 et fait de la couture tout genre : hommes, femmes, enfants, adultes.
Sombel sollicite un renouvellement de 700 000fcfa pour acheter de la garniture et des variétés de  tissus qu’il va confectionner en ensembles pour hommes et femmes, qu’il va exposer et mettre en vente. Il peut être actif toute la journée, voire une partie de la nuit compte tenu de la clientèle et de la période.
Sombel est marié et père de 5 enfants dont le plus âgé a 16 ans et le cadet, 3 ans. Il s’occupe de leur alimentation et de leur scolarité et cela est possible grâce aux revenus de l’activité de couture, mais aussi grâce aux recettes de son véhicule.
Sombel, rêve d’ouvrir un grand complexe de coupe-couture s’il a les moyens et l’appui d’une Institution financière comme l’IMCEC.
texts.en:
Mr. Sombel, who is in his fifties, has been in the tailoring business for many years. He started apprenticing as a tailor in 1989, with one of his uncle who had a great tailoring shop. Nine years later, in 1988, Sombel opened his own shop, doing all types of tailoring: for men and women, children and adults.

Sombel is requesting a 700,000-XOF loan renewal, to purchase trimmings as well as a variety of fabric to make into ensembles for men and women. These will be exhibited and sold. He can work all day, and even part of the night, given the needs of his clientele at times.

Sombel is married and a father of five children. The older is sixteen years old and the youngest three. He provides for their alimentation and schooling, which is possible thanks to his tailoring revenues, but also from profits he makes with his vehicle.

Sombel’s dream is to open a major tailoring shop if he can find the financial resources and have the support of a financial institution like IMCEC.

loans.use: to buy decorative elements and fabrics to sew suits for retails.

loans.name: Mataniu

texts.en: Mataniu is 45 years old and married with five children. She runs a small BBQ business selling to the public and people around her community. She has been doing this for four years. Mataniu has requested a loan to buy iron roofing, timber, cement, paint, and nails for her BBQ stall renovation. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Mataniu will look at improving her business and helping with her family and kids' daily needs.

loans.use: to buy iron roofing, timber, cement, paint, and nails

loans.name: Marina Del Carmen

texts.es: Marina tiene 26 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hija de 4 años de edad. Marina se dedica a la comercialización de productos de tienda desde hace más de dos años. Ella es una mujer emprendedora quien desea dar lo mejor a su pequeña hija. Marina desea construir un baño para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compara de arena, ladrillo y cemento para dar inicio a la construcción lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Marina is 26 years old and lives in her own house with her 4-year-old daughter. Marina has earned her living selling products from a shop for more than two years. She is an enterprising woman who wants to give the best to her little daughter. 

Marina wants to build a bathroom, so she has requested this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of sand, brick, and cement in order to get started on the construction as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy sand, bricks, and cement to build a bathroom in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy posts, staples, barbed wire, and cement to repair fences

loans.name: Olga Maria

texts.es: Olga es madre soltera tiene 26 años de edad y 2 hijos de 7 y 8 años los que se encuentran asistiendo a la escuela, Olga se dedica a criar terneros y también trabaja al jornal, con el crédito va a comprar terneros a los que les  criar en un terreno donde arrienda la hierba, la aspiración de Olga es crecer mediante la ganadería ya que es otra fuente de ingresos que ella tiene y con esto puede darles la educación y alimentación a sus hijos ya que el padre de los niños le ayuda muy poco con los gastos de ellos.
texts.en:
Olga is a single mother. She is 26 years old and has two children who are 7 and 8 years old; they are currently attending school. 

Olga earns her living raising calves and also does day labor. With this loan, she is going to buy calves that she will raise on a lot where she leases pastureland. Olga's aspiration is to grow through livestock, since that is another source of income that she has. With that income, she can feed and educate her children, as their father helps very little with their expenses.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Josselyn Cecibel

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Santa Rosa Del Blanco se reúne cada quince días en la ciudad de Charapoto. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.
En este lugar vive la señora Josselyn, tiene 19 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de  4 años. Su esposo trabaja en una moto taxi.
Doña Josselyn con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos de Avon y Belcorp (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Ella también en su casa vende víveres como arroz, aceite, azúcar y varios productos más de primera necesidad, su ilusión es de a poco ir surtiendo una tienda de víveres en su casa lo cual espera muy pronto y con la ayuda de los créditos lograr, por lo pronto ella vende estos productos a clientes que llegan hasta su casa a los cuales les deja a crédito para así ganar más clientela, este negocio lo empezó hace 6 meses con el primer crédito que recibió. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y  productos de primera necesidad. Lleva dos ciclos  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos empezó su negocio el cual le permite ganarse algo por el bien de su familia. Sus sueños son tener una tienda de víveres.
texts.en:
The Santa Rosa Del Blanco communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Charapoto.  This area is known for its traditional culture and also for being a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.  
Josselyn lives here.  She is 19 and is married, and she and her husband have a four-year-old son.  Her husband drives a motorcycle taxi.  
In order to have some income of her own, Josselyn sells Avon and Belcorp products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and accessories for women) from catalogs.  She also sells food products such as rice, oil, sugar, and other basic necessities at her house.  Her hope is to gradually build up a grocery shop in her house, and she hopes to be able to do this very soon with the help of the loans.  For now she sells these products to customers who come to her house and she offers credit to gain more customers.  She started this business six months ago with the first loan she received.  
She will use this loan to buy perfume, costume jewelry, cosmetics, lotions, and basic necessities.  She has been with the communal bank for two cycles and she likes it because she used the loans to start her business, which allows her to make some money for the good of her family.  Her dream is to have a grocery shop.

loans.use: to buy perfume, costume jewelry, cosmetics, lotions, and basic necessities to sell

loans.name: Bertha Claudia

texts.es: Berta Claudia mayor de edad madre soltera de un hijo aun bajo su responsabilidad, originaria del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy emprendedora que sabido salir adelante junto con su familia, hoy en día se dedica a la venta de comida la cual entrega a ciertos negocios, colegios, vende fritanga como: tajadas, enchiladas, tacos, y asados, al igual ofrece comidas rápidas como: gaseosas, refrescos, hamburguesas, Hot-dog, sopas instantáneas, entre otros y ademas ofrece servicios de estilismo a domicilio cuenta con clientes fijos y eventuales, sus compras las realiza en mercados de mayoreos y distribuidoras de esta localidad, el objetivo de este nuevo financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo y complementar ciertos pedidos que tiene que entregar, al igual que surtir su inventario de productos de consumo para realizar sus deliciosas comidas como: aceite, pan, embutidos, frutas y verduras, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, entre otros mas. Berta agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en: Berta Claudia is an older single mother of a son for whom she is still responsible. She is originally from the community of Chinandega, which is located in the western part of the country. She is known for being a very entrepreneurial woman who has known how to get ahead, along with her family. Now she sells food that she delivers to various businesses and schools. She sells fried food such as fried plantains, enchiladas, tacos, and roasted meats. She also offers fast foods such as soft drinks, beverages, hamburgers, hot dogs, and instant soups, among other items. In addition, she offers styling services at home. She has regular and occasional customers. She makes her purchases in the wholesale markets and from the distributors in this area. The purpose of this new financing is to invest in working capital and complete certain orders that she has to deliver, and at the same time to stock her inventory of consumer products to make her delicious foods, such as oil, bread, cold meats, fruits and vegetables, rice, beans, and sugar, among other items. Berta is very grateful for the support the Kiva investors offer to people of limited economic resources.

loans.use: to buy consumer products: rice, sugar, beans, oil, frozen foods, cold meats, bread, fruits and vegetables, firewood, charcoal, soft drinks, juices, and instant soups, among other items

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Santa Rosa Del Blanco se reúne cada quince días en la ciudad de Charapoto. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 20, 18, 16 y 13 años, todos estudian en colegio y  escuela. Uno de sus hijos está comprometido pero aun vive en su casa. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.
Doña María para ayudarle a sus esposo con los gastos del hogar hace varios años empezó un negocio, ella tiene un pequeño comedor en su casa en el cual prepara deliciosos platos, trabaja todos los días  desde las seis de la mañana hasta las  a las tres de la tarde, trabaja con la ayuda de su nuera.  Tiene un año con  su comedor y  le va muy bien ya que sus clientes siempre llegan y cada día en mayor cantidad.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace dos ciclos y espera seguir recibiendo la ayuda de los créditos.  Sus sueños es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
The Santa Rosa del Blanco communal bank meets every fifteen days in the city of Charapoto. This place is known for its traditional culture as well as for being located just a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province: San Jacinto and San Clemente. 

In this place lives Señora María. She is 38 years old and married. From that relationship, she has four children who are 20, 18, 16, and 13 years old. All of them are in school. One of her children is engaged, but still lives at home. Her husband earns his living in agriculture. 

Doña María started a business several years ago to help her husband with the household expenses. She has a small restaurant in her house, where she prepares delicious dishes. She works every day from six in the morning until three in the afternoon with the help of her daughter-in-law. She has had the restaurant for a year and it is going very well for her; her customers always arrive, and in greater numbers every day.

She will use this loan to buy rice, meat, fish, and other groceries for the preparation of her foods. She has been in the communal bank for two lending cycles, and she hopes to continue receiving the help of the loans. Her dream is that her children complete their educations.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish, and other groceries.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus siete hijos, es responsable y trabajador, se dedica a la mecánica de obra de banco ( elaboración de estructuras metálicas: puertas, balcones, portones, techos) desde hace varios años con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Manuel solicita un crédito para comprar más materiales como: hierro, metal, electrodos, herramienta, etc. ya que tiene mucha demanda porque hace un buen trabajo y así poder obtener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel is 56 years old and lives in his own home along with his wife and their seven children. He is responsible and hardworking. Manuel is what is called a “bench mechanic” (someone who produces metal structures such as doors, railings, gates, and ceiling tiles). He has been in this profession for several years and his work has enabled him to pay for a few of his household expenses.

Manuel is requesting a loan in order to buy more materials such as iron, metal, electrodes, tools, and other supplies. He is already experiencing great demand because he does good work. As a result, he will be able to earn more income and provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy iron, metal, electrodes, tools, and other supplies for his work.

loans.name: José Bolivar

texts.es: José es un hombre de 25 años de edad, vive con su esposa y su hijo de 2 años, él es un señor responsable y hace muy bien su trabajo que lo realiza en una hacienda donde se dedica a la ganadería juntamente con su esposa  y ahí les prestan una casa para que vivan junto a su hijo, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca ya que se dedica a cuidar ganado porque dice que  tiene aspiración de crecer en su negocio y en algún momento le gustaría tener una pequeña hacienda para tener los recursos necesarios para comprar una casa y darle la educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
José is a 25-year-old man who lives with his wife and his two-year-old son. He is a responsible individual who is doing very well at his job at a ranch where he devotes his time working with the livestock. José and his wife work together. They were provided a house where they live with their son.

His loan will be invested in the purchase of a cow that he can look after. José has aspirations of growing his business. Someday he would like to have a small ranch of his own so that he can earn the necessary income to buy a house and provide an education for his son.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora María es una socia alegre y forma parte del grupo de crédito Arco Iris desde hace dos años, le gusta su grupo de crédito por la amistada y la solidaridad que existe entre todas las compañeras, estos créditos le permiten mejorar su estabilidad económica, vive por la comunidad Tres Marías de la parroquia de Turi en Cuenca, esta parroquia es el mirador de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica a la agricultura, cría de animales y comercio.
La Señora María tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 9, 7, 2 años y su último hijo que tiene dos meses de edad, sus dos primeros hijos están estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad, su esposo no vive en la ciudad pero está trabajando para sacar en adelante a la familia,  la casa en la que vive es propia.
Doña María se dedica a la atención de su tienda desde hace dos años, la cual inicio con su primer crédito, también se dedica a la cría de cuyes y a la agricultura que es solo para el consumo de su hogar, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo. El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en víveres para su tienda. Su meta es tener un mini mercado.
texts.en:
Señora Maria is a happy member of her communal bank. She has been part of the Arco Iris (Rainbow) credit group for two years. She likes her group because of the friendship and camaraderie that exists among all the members. These loans allow her to improve her economic stability. She lives in the community Tres Marias in the Turi parish in Cuenca. This parish is the viewpoint of the city of Cuenca. Its people work in agriculture, raising animals, and business. 

Señora Maria is 32 years old. She is married and has four children, ages 9, 7, and 2, and her last child is two months old. Her first two children attend a little school in the city. Her husband does not live in the city, but he is working to raise his family. The house in which she lives is her own.

Doña Maria has been tending to her store for two years. She began it with her first loan. She also raises guinea pigs and works in agriculture, which is only for the consumption of her household. She works every day of the week without a fixed schedule. She is going to invest the money from her loan in groceries for her store. Her goal is to have a mini-market.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to invest in her transportation company

loans.name: Carlos Alfredo

texts.es: Carlos 47 años de edad, reside en casa propia con su esposa y sus hijos, muy amable y trabajador,el trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maíz y frijol; sus productos son de muy buena calidad comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia. Carlos solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plaga, fertilizantes, abonos, semillas entre otras cosas que necesita para su siembra y también mejorar el terreno donde desea hacer su siembra que es el que muestra la fotografía, el ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Carlos is 47 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and children.  He is very friendly and hardworking.  He works hard on his own farm where he grows corn and beans and his products are of very good quality.  He sells his products in the different markets that are close to his home.  Carlos is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL in order to obtain the funds necessary to invest in agricultural inputs such as pest controls, fertilizers, seeds, and other materials he needs for his planting, and to improve the soil where he wants to do his planting, which is what is shown in the photograph. He is eager to increase his sales in order to be able to earn better profits and give his family better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy pest controls, fertilizers, and seeds among other things; and also to improve the soil.

loans.name: Nancy Cristina

texts.es:
La Señora. Nancy es socia del grupo de crédito Arco Iris desde hace 8 años, vive por la comunidad Tres Marías que pertenece a la parroquia de Turi en Cuenca, esta parroquia es el mirador de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica a la agricultura, cría de animales y comercio.
La Señora. Nancy tiene 52 años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 17 y 9 años, su primera hija estudia en el colegio y su segundo hijo en una escuela de la ciudad, su esposo presta sus servicios como chofer y realiza fletes, la casa en la que habitan es propia.
Doña Nancy se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, al cuidado de sus hijos y también se dedica a la venta de comida rápida, este trabajo lo realiza en las tardes y noches, trabaja de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para su negocio. Su meta es terminar su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en: Nancy has been a member of the Arco Iris financing group for 8 years, and lives in the community of Tres Marías in the Turi district in Cuenca. This district is the lookout point of the city of Cuenca, and its inhabitants work in agriculture, animal raising, and commerce. Nancy is 52 years old, and married with two children ages 9 and 17. Her firstborn daughter is a high school student and her second child is a student at a school in the city. Nancy's husband works as a driver and makes deliveries, and they live in their own home. She's a housewife who takes care of her children and also sells fast food, a job that she does afternoons and evenings Monday through Saturday without a fixed schedule. The loan will be invested in the purchase of supplies for her business. Her goal is to finish her house and for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: Comprar víveres.

loans.name: Reina Carolina

texts.es:
Reina, está solicitando un nuevo capital para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas así como también calzado, pago de mozos, alquiler de terreno, para su próximo cultivo. De esta manera fortalecerá el negoció y continuara cumpliendo con las demandas de sus clientes.
Con el crédito anterior Reina pudo sacar a tiempo la cosecha de pipián y maíz, cumpliendo con los pedidos en menor tiempo por lo que sus ganancias fueron mejores y cancelo con puntualidad sus cuotas, Su familia mantiene el mismo número de  miembros, todos están saludables.
texts.en:
Reina is requesting additional capital so that she can invest in the purchase of farming supplies. She will also buy shoes to sell, pay her workers, and rent a plot of land for her next crop. This will strengthen her business and she can continue meeting the demands of her customers.

With her previous loan, Reina was able to achieve a timely harvest of squash and corn. She was able to fulfill her orders in less time, which resulted in stronger earnings and gave her the ability to submit her payment installments on time. Her family remains the same size in number and all of them are healthy.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, pay her workers, rent a plot of land, and also acquire shoes that she can sell.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge es casado, tiene 3 hijos vive en EL ALTO  en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad Jorge es un carpintero que se dedica a elaborar casas para perro Necesita credito para comprar material (madera)Jorge es la unica fuente de ingreso en su hogar por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Jorge is married and has three children. He lives in El Alto, where he owns a house made of bricks and cement.

Jorge is a carpenter who builds houses. However, he needs a loan so that he can buy material (wood). This is Jorge’s only source of household income, which is why he needs assistance.

loans.use: to buy wood for his house construction business.

loans.name: Doris Ximena

texts.es: Doris es una chica soltera de 23 años de edad, ella vive con sus padres y sus 4 hermanos de los cuales uno está asistiendo al colegio , Doris se dedica a criar chanchos y también trabaja al jornal, comenta que sus padres se dedican a la agricultura y son ellos quien le enseñan como se  cuida adecuadamente a los chanchos, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos,  la aspiración de Doris es mejorar su negocio e incrementar sus ingresos para comprar un terreno donde pueda construir una chanchera para criar a sus animales.
texts.en:
Doris is a single woman who is 23 years old. She lives with her parents and her four siblings, one of whom is attending school.

Doris raises pigs and also works as a day laborer. She says that her parents work in agriculture and were the ones who taught her how to provide adequate care for the pigs. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of pigs.

Doris aspires to improve her business and increase her earnings so that she can buy a plot of land where she can build a pig sty for raising her animals.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia lives in Capatan, in the Philippines.  She is 47 years old and has five children.  Her spouse is a construction worker and she raises hogs for income.  She also cooks food for snacks such as hot dogs, kikiam, and boiled eggs, as well as sells refreshments such as juice drinks.  She has been in the food selling business for over a year and wanted to keep increasing her income but had insufficient funds.   She is asking for 10,000 PHP to buy fish ball, hotdogs, bananas, and eggs to cook and sell.  She will also buy a piglet to raise. 

Someday, with good funding, Herminia will continue to diversify her businesses and achieve better sales and profits.

loans.use: to buy fish ball, hotdogs, bananas, and eggs to cook and sell

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: Javier es soltero, no tiene hijos, vive con sus familiares en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que esta en EL ALTO Javier es chofer y necesita el credito para comprar una impresora para uso personal pues cerca de su casa no hay impresiones y eso tal vez pueda ayudar a darle ingresos extras que necesita puesto que Javier es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar
texts.en:
Javier is single and has no children. He lives with his relatives in a brick and cement house located in El Alto.

Javier is a driver, but he needs a loan in order to buy a printer for personal use. Since there are no other places near his house that provide printing services, he may also have the chance to earn some extra income. This would be helpful to Javier since his job is his only source of household income.

loans.use: to buy a printer for personal use.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia tiene 26 años de edad, ella y su familia viven en el municipio de Santa Catarina Ixtahuacán, departamento de Sololá, tiene dos hijos, el mayor tiene 8 años de edad esta en segundo grado primaria, y el segundo tiene 6 años de edad y está en primero primaria, ella se dedica a vender ropa típica de forma ambulante, tiene 5 años de experiencia en esta actividad, Antonia necesita un crédito por Q. 6,000.00, para ampliar su negocio y tenerla más surtido y comprar materia prima para tejer, con las ganancia Antonia ayuda a su esposa a cubrir los gastos de la familia, ya que se ha dado cuenta que entre más productos tiene mayor es la venta que hace.
texts.en:
Antonia is 26 years old. She and her family live in the town of Santa Catarina Ixtahuacán, which is in the Department of Sololá. Antonia has two children. The older child is eight years old and in the second grade. Her younger child is six years old and in the first grade.

Antonia sells traditional clothing as a street vendor. She has five years of experience in this business. Antonia needs a loan of 6,000 GTQ in order to expand her business and have more inventory. She will also buy materials for weaving. With the profit she earns, Antonia can help her husband with the family expenses. She realizes that having more products means that she can make more sales.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing to sell and to acquire materials for weaving.

loans.name: Jose Magno

texts.es: Jose de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, el se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras plátanos, naranjas, tomates, cebollas, papas, chiles entre otros tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el lugar donde comercia es muy estratégico para la actividad y además muy concurrido de personas, ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefieren porque su producto es fresco, a buen precio, de calidad y con un excelente servicio, Jose desea realizar una nueva inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar frutas y verduras por mayor. El tiene buenas referencias de pago, esta agradecido con el apoyo y asegura que podrá saldar la deuda, a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Jose is 40 years old and lives in his own home along with his family. He sells fruits and vegetables such as bananas, oranges, tomatoes, onions, potatoes, chili peppers, and other products. Jose has been in this business for several years and has a great deal of sales experience, which has allowed him to generate better earnings. The place where he conducts business is very strategic for this type of work since it is full of people. Jose already has many customers who prefer to do business with him because his products are fresh, priced well, and are of quality. He also provides excellent service.

Jose wants to make a new investment, but he does not have sufficient capital to do this. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that he can buy fruits and vegetables in bulk. Jose has good payment references. He is grateful for the support and is confident that he can repay this debt. At the same, he believes that he can provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan es un señor de 32 años de edad, el es casado,  vive con su esposa,  sus hijos de 9 y 14 años que se encuentran asistiendo a la escuela , se dedica hace 3 años a criar chanchos y comenta que es un buen negocio , que le permite tener otro ingreso para cubrir los gastos de su familia, él también se dedica a trabajar en el campo y su esposa realiza los quehaceres de la casa, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos, lo que Juan aspira es que su negocio crezca y mejorar sus ingresos para ponerse otro negocio propio y solventar los gastos de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juan is a 32-year-old man who is married and lives with his wife. His children, ages 9 and 14, attend school.

For the past three years, Juan has been raising pigs and says that it is a good business. It has allowed him to have additional income for covering his family’s expenses. He also works in the fields while his wife takes care of the household duties.

His loan will be invested in the purchase of pigs. Juan aspires to grow his business and improve his earnings so that he can establish another business in order to have income for his children’s expenses.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Pablo Ramon

texts.es: Ramón tiene 26 años de edad, él es soltero, vive con sus padres y con sus 4 hermanos, son ya 6 años de lo que se dedica a la ganadería, sus padres fueron quienes le apoyaron para que empiece con este negocio ya que sus ellos también se dedican a la ganadería y comenta que le va muy bien en esta actividad, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca para incluirla en su negocio, la aspiración de este joven es comprar un terreno para poder tenerles en este lugar a su ganado.
texts.en:
Ramón is 26 years old, single, and lives with his parents and his four siblings. He has already been in the livestock business for six years. His parents were the ones who helped him start this business since they also spend their time raising livestock. Ramón says that he is doing very well in his business.

His loan will be invested in the purchase of a cow that he will add to his herd. This young man’s aspiration is to buy a plot of land so that his cattle can have a place to graze.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es: Tomas tiene 58 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su madre y hermana. El se gana la vida mediante la realización de viajes a diferentes partes del municipio. Tiene 10 años de dedicarse a este negocio por lo que ya cuenta con muchos clientes y experiencia en el área. Tomas desea construir una cerca en el frente de su vivienda para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de tela metálica y postes de cemento para proceder lo antes posible a la construcción de la cerca y así poder dar mayor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Tomas is 58 years old and resides in his own home along with his mother and his sister. He earns his living by making delivery trips to different parts of the city. Tomas has been in this line of work for 10 years and he has many customers as a result of his experience in this field.

Tomas wants to build a fence in front of his house, so he is requesting a loan from FUSAI. He will invest in the purchase of chain link mesh and cement posts so that he can quickly proceed with the construction of the fence, which will provide greater security for his family.

loans.use: to buy chain link mesh and cement posts for building a fence in front of his house.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Doña Angélica tiene 35 años de edad está acompañada y tiene un hijo. Cuenta con 10 años de dedicarse a la agricultura siendo su especialidad el cultivo de café. Ella aprendió dichas actividades en compañía de su pareja y de sus padres ya que ellos han sido desde toda una vida agricultores. Tiene un grado de educación primaria incompleto el cual pudo cursar hasta el quinto año y agradece el apoyo brindado por sus padres. En la agricultura especialmente con el café es un producto delicado y de no tratarse a tiempo con los insumos necesario puede perderse la cosecha completa. 
Es por ello que ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL con el cual planea comprar 15 sacos de abono, pago de mano de obra para la aplicación y mantenimiento de sus cultivos, así como también la compra de 200 latas de café lo cual utilizara para mejorar y tener una excelente cosecha en esta nueva temporada con el café. Sus metas a largo plazo son las de ampliar sus cultivos de café con la compra de más tierra, sembrar una variedad de café más competitiva y tecnificar sus cultivos. Sus sueños es mediante a los ingresos darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, mejores oportunidades de estudio de las que ella tuvo en su juventud dando la oportunidad a su hijo de enviarlo a la universidad para que sea una persona de provecho.
texts.en:
Sra. Angélica is 35 years old. She has a partner and a son. For ten years she has earned her living in agriculture, growing mainly coffee. She learned about farming from her partner and his parents who have been farmers all their lives. Angélica completed primary school as far as grade five. She is grateful to her parents for their support.

Coffee is a delicate product and if you don't treat it correctly at the right time, you risk losing your whole crop. For this reason Angélica has asked for a loan from the COMIXMUL Cooperative to buy 15 bags of fertilizer and to pay laborers to apply it and look after the land. She also plans to buy 200 cans of coffee which she will use to improve and obtain an excellent harvest in this new coffee-growing season.

Angélica's longterm goals are to expand her coffee fields by buying more land, sow a more competitive type of coffee, and use technology to assess her product. Her dreams are to provide her family with a better quality of life, better educational opportunities than she had as a child, and send her son to university so he can becomes a man of means.

loans.use: But agricultural supplies and pay laborers to apply them on her coffee fields

loans.name: Oscar Manolo

texts.es: Manolo tiene 32 años de edad, él vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos  de 9 y 10 años que se encuentran asistiendo a la escuela, él se dedica a la ganadería desde hace 4 años  y también trabaja en la  agricultura, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca ya que le va bien en este negocio, Manolo es un señor amoroso con sus hijas y lo que más quiere es poderle dar a sus hijas todo lo que necesiten para que lleguen a ser unas buenas profesionales.
texts.en:
Manolo is 32 years old. He lives with his wife and their two children, ages 9 and 10, who are attending school.

Manolo has worked with livestock for the past four years. He is also a farmer. His loan will be invested in the purchase of a cow since he is doing very well in his business. Manolo is a loving father to his daughters. What he wants most is to provide his daughters everything they need so that they can become successful professionals.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Reyna es madre de tres hijos en edad escolar, junto a su esposo se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, ella tiene la necesidad de mejorar las condiciones de su hogar, es por eso que solicita este primer crédito para poder comprar los materiales para reparar una parte del techo de su casa, el cual esta deteriorado, con el financiamiento podrá comprar laminas de zinc, perlines, pintura, plycen y pagar la mano de obra.
texts.en:
Reyna is the mother of three school-age children. She and her husband sell used clothes.

Reyna needs to improve the condition of her home. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan so that she can buy materials for repairing part of the roof of her house, which has deteriorated. This loan will be used to buy sheets of zinc, crossbeams, paint, and particle board, as well as pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy materials and pay for labor in order to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Morning Star Group

texts.en:
An early bird catches a worm and these eight tribal women rise at the break of the dawn and engage themselves in household chores and their income activity. They also called themselves Morning Star Group. The village where they live is 35 km from the main capital town of Manipur. Jenlu, who is raising her hand, is the featured borrower profile member. Her husband's main occupation is cultivation and he cultivates in accordance with seasonal changes.

Jenlu's house is located in one of the main lanes in the village. The grocery shop is located facing the lane and farmers in the morning usually drops in at the shop to purchase local cigarettes (biri), betel nut and betel leaves to take with them to the field. She also sells essential and everyday household goods like cereals, rice, edible oils, detergent soap, detergent powder, dish wash, shampoo etc. While her husband is engaged in the field, she stays at home and manages the shop at the same time does her household chores. She cleans the house, cooks meals for the family and sends the kids to school. The village has very few shops and jenlu is determined to run the business successfully.

With the help of the Kiva loan, she will purchase more supplies for the grocery shop like three bags of rice, one tin can of edible oil, and other essential goods. She has plans to expand the shop and make a living. Cultivation will be difficult for both the husband and wife as they age and therefore, she is keen to make the shop as successful as it can be. She is happy and motivated to work with Kiva and wishes to continue working with the organization. She says, “thank-you so much Kiva”.

The rest of the group members are also engaged in piggery, weaving, farming and grocery shop businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies for her grocery shop like rice, edible oil, and other essential goods

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to invest in new equipment and supplies for her bakeshop, as well as new catalogue merchandise.

loans.name: Emma Lorena

texts.en:
Emma has a degree in Business Administration.  She and her mother have owned the family bakery business for 19 years.  Her bakery, which is located in the county of Barranca with in the Province of Puntarenas, offers freshly made bread and confections and is well known as one of the best bakeries in the area.  Having established this successful business, Emma has been able to improve the lives of her brothers by helping them get a formal education and improve the overall income of her family.

This business has been built from the ground up with Emma’s and her family’s own money, but due to the rising costs in both materials and processing, they have found that it has become necessary to diversify their business.  Emma and her family wish to accomplish this diversification by offering their baked goods in other areas of Puntarenas, and to this end, they have rented a space in a nearby locaity for just this purpose.  They have already begun to move some the of necessary equipment to the new location, but need extra capital in order to purchase ingredients for the bakery as well as new and different merchandise, which will then allow them to open this new branch of their already popular business.

Emma and her mother currently have a daily income of roughly 50,000 CRC.  By adding the sale of new non-bakery related items to their inventory they will be able increase their current income as well as improve their quality of life.  In terms of organization, part of the staff will move to the new location while the others remain at the original.  With the current bakery, Emma and her family have demonstrated their ability to make the monthly loan payments, and have repaid the full amount of their previous loan.  Having visited the area where they intend to open the new baker, I can assure you that it has an excellent chance for success due to it’s prime location on the main street, which is a better location than their already successful current business.  There are no other bakeries in the area.

With their 19 years of experience, Emma and her family intend to make this new venture even more successful than their current one, which should be a rather easy task given the level of competency that they’ve developed over the years.  They will also continue to strive to go above and beyond the needs of the clients who patronize their current shop.

loans.use: to open a new branch of their bakery business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to consolidate their business.

loans.name: Emmanuel Shg Group

texts.en: Nungsaikim and nine other women formed a group called “Emmanuel” to help each other and to uplift themselves economically and financially. Nungsaikim, the woman with her hand raised, is the featured profile member of Emmanuel group. She lives in Bishnupur, 25 km away from the city of Imphal, Manipur, which is in the northeastern region of India. She lives with her husband and son. Her husband works as a carpenter. From time to time, he goes to the neighborhood to construct houses for wages and goes to the jungle to cut wood for his carpentry work. Her only son, Galeo, is still studying at the primary level. Since her husband’s income is unreliable and insufficient, Nungsaikim opened a small petty shop near her house. The main item that generates income in her shop is paan. Apart from paan, she keeps chips, cigarettes, roasted peas and some other edibles. With the Kiva loan, she wishes to expand and fill the shop with more items. Since there is no other alternative means to generate income, she wanted to give maximum effort to raise more income from this shop. Like other mothers, she has a dream of providing a decent career for her son. The rest of the group members are engaged in chive, banana, cabbage and ginger cultivation.

loans.use: To purchase more commodities for the shop like betel leaf, nuts, and chips

loans.name: Solidaria Mujer Con Visión De Exito Group

texts.en:
The group Visión de Éxito received the information lecture and during the month of March they cancelled their first loan.  This demonstrated that they are a group that is committed to proper payment procedures, that they are organized, have a strong desire to work, and support one another in growing not only financially but personally as well. They formed their board of directors in a democratic manner and filled out their second loan application in keeping with the rules of Solidaria Mujer.

All of these women are the heads of their households, taking care of the children and other necessities, and they wish to combine their abilities in order to succeed and purchase various type of merchandise.  They all have a good clientele and ample business experience, some with more than 20 years.  They sell clothing, sandals, and perfume among other things, and they are all very familiar with their market, their suppliers, and their clients, which allows them to make the most of their investments.  With the loan that they are currently asking for they would like to increase their sales catalogue for the summer season in the Pacific Coast of Costa Rica.

This group became interested in working with Fundación Mujer through the recommendation of the groups formed by Fray Casiano, and they received the information lecture.  During the month of May, the were given the training lecture, which demonstrated that they are a dependable and organized group who have a strong desire to work and to support one another in growing not only financially, but personally as well.  Forming their board of directors in a democratic manner, they then filled out their credit application to begin their work in keeping with the requirements of Banco Mujer.

The president of this group is a young woman of 20 named Argerie.  She is married, her husband helps support her business, and has a 3-year-old child. She works with the hope of providing her son with a better future.  

They all live in Barranca, Puntarenas, an area that has few options for employment.  Argerie will be able to invest in her home-based business selling clothing, sandals, and costume jewelry that she purchases from larger business in the Central Valley and look for new ways to generate income.

loans.use: to purchase various types of merchandise.

loans.name: Maa Maheswari Shg Group

texts.en:
The Maa Maheswari Self Help Group consists of 11 members from a small village in the Sonepur district, Odisha, India. All the members of this group are female. They are engaged in different business activities for the elimination of poverty. Three of the women have very low incomes, but this helps them to want to struggle harder to get ahead. 

One person who deserves to be highlighted is Kanak (in the picture the lady standing with her hand raised) who works selling vegetables. Through her job, she works to support her family, improve her business and continue growing. She is a very determined person who wants to continue growing. She is seeking part of this loan in order to be able to invest it in the purchase of vegetables like tomatoes, onions, green peppers, potatoes and other vegetables so that she can continue with her sales. The group is very grateful for this opportunity for growth that it is receiving.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes, onions, green peppers, potatoes and other vegetables to sell

loans.name: Maa Mahalaxmi Shg Group

texts.en:
Susam is 30 years old and has a child. She lives in a small village in Sonepur district in Odisha, India with her husband and her child. A few years ago, she started a grocery shop where she sells rice, lentils, potatoes, wheat flour, onions, spices, soap etc. She purchases these items in the town with the help of her husband. She sells a variety of products, depending on the demand in the village.

She is requesting a loan to buy more supplies such as detergents, biscuits, candles, electric bulbs, wafer, toilet cleaner etc. With this investment, she will expand her business so that she can generate more income and improve the quality of life for herself and her family. She is requesting the loan with a group of 10 members who all are women who live in the same community. They named their group Maa Mahalaxmi Shg.

loans.use: To purchase detergents, biscuits, candles, electric bulbs, wafer, toilet cleaner etc. for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Maa Rudrakali Shg Group

texts.en:
Himadri is 29 years old and living with her husband and two children who are studying in school. The lady standing with her hand raised hand in the photo is Himadri. She is engaged in selling dried and fresh fish in the market, which is two kilometers away from her village. Her husband catches fish from the lake that is near their village. The demand for fish in the region is very high, as it is consumed by most of the people. Himadri makes dried fish by keeping the fish in sunlight until all the water evaporates, which preserves them for future use (like when fish are not available in the market, in the rainy season). Dried fish is also used as a supplement to fresh fish. 

Himadri is requesting a loan to buy a cool storage box for keeping fish, a fishing net and insecticides to prevent fish from decaying for her fishery business. She says that this will help her to strengthen the business and respond to client demand. This group is made up of neighbors and friends who formed the group Maa Rudrakali Self Help Group (SHG). The members of the group have selected Himadri as their president. The common goal of the group is to expand their business activity.

loans.use: To pay for a storage box to keep fish and a fishing net.

loans.name: Hatlenrose

texts.en:
Intelligent and confident Hatlenrose loves to travel and meet new people. She is pictured with her mother standing on the right side. Hatlenrose grew up in a mediocre family. She hails from Imphal, Manipur in the northeast region of India. She is the youngest in the family. She has two older sisters and a brother. Her father passed away when she was just two and a half years old. Since then, her mother takes care of all the children, their education and all the family affairs single handedly. At present, her mother is working as a Junior Account Assistant in the government sector. Her mother is her role model from whom she gets inspiration to be strong and courageous.
  
Hatlenrose has done her postgraduate work at Manipur University. After her post graduation, she planned to do her PhD. But as she got a job offer in the aviation sector, she dropped her plan to study further and continue pursuing her dream job that makes money while giving her a chance to travel the world. Hatlenrose specifically wanted the loan because she desperately needs a job to help her mother and her siblings by giving them financial support. Since such decent jobs with decent pay hardly come around, she doesn't want to lose the opportunity. Therefore, she's requesting a loan from Kiva to pay for the security deposit to enroll in cabin crew training, which is required to be paid by the successful candidate. She believes that with the help of the loan, she can achieve her goals and meet all her financial needs independently without troubling her family. In the future, she would like to see herself being awarded as the best cabin crew member and support those who need financial help.

loans.use: To pay the security deposit for cabin crew training

loans.name: Maa Kandhen Budhi Shg Group

texts.en:
Maa Kandhen Budhi Shg consists of ten women from a small village in Odisha. They formed a group to help themselves share their problems and to solve their problems themselves. One of them is Lakshmi, who was selected as the President of Maa Kandhen Budhi Shg. The lady standing in a green saree with her hand raised in the photo is Lakshmi.

Lakshmi is 27 years old and is staying with her husband and her two children. She is involved in growing and selling vegetables in her village. Her husband is supporting her in this activity. 

She has requested a loan of 150,000 INR, which will help her to purchase the required resources for vegetable cultivation. She says her portion of the loan amount will help her to purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizers and insecticides, and to cover operational expenses like labor charges.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Lalawmpuii

texts.en:
Lalawmpuii achieved fame and a name at a young age and is blessed with beauty and talent. She is featured with her mother. At the age of 14, she started performing as the blooming artist in social events and she is well known in the community.  Her father generates income doing carpentry work and her mother stays at home and takes care of the seven kids. She lives in Churachandpur district, which is the second largest town in Manipur and about 60 km from the capital town. 

Mothers love and fathers support is her mighty strength, says Lalawmpuii. When she was just 14 years old, she traveled by plane and was filled with awe for the flight attendant. That day she made her decision and aspired to become an air-hostess. Five years have passed since then and recently she had her first interview and was selected as a cabin crew member for the airlines industry. Her dreams have been fulfilled but she couldn’t tell her parents that she needed to make a refundable deposit in order to join the airlines industry. Her parent’s financial insecurity has been known and shared by her since she was a kid. Her friend (http://www.kiva.org/lend/683130) who is also a Kiva member, informed her about the education loan and she approached WSDS for financial assistance. 

With the Kiva loan, she will pay for the refundable deposit and start her cabin crew training. This is a wonderful thing that happened to her says Lalawmpuii and she wishes to continue building a relationship with WSDS and Kiva. She says she will be able to support her father in financial matters and will lessen their burden. For this, she is grateful towards WSDS and Kiva. She says, “thank-you so much Kiva”. She wholeheartedly thanks and appreciates Kiva for being such a great help and a savior who provided her a platform to pursue her dream career.

loans.use: To pay for a refundable deposit for cabin crew training

loans.name: Maa Gojabayani Shg Group

texts.en:
