Raibari is 44 years old, married and has two children who are studying in school. She lives in a village in the Boudh district of Odisha, India. Raibari is a housewife who is very happy and responsible. She alternates her household activities with her work in her business. She has a business farming her paddy and selling her crops in the market in the Boudh district in Odisha, India. She already has had this business for eight years and it is going very well. At this time, Raibari is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and new and advanced tools for farming. She says that this will help her in strengthening the business and responding to client demands.

This group is composed of neighbors and friends who formed the Maa Gojabayani Self Help Group. The members of the group have selected Raibari as their president. The lady standing with her hand raised in the photo is Raibari. The common goal of the group is to increase their business activity. Raibari is thankful to Kiva and its lenders for this support.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers, seeds and tools for cultivating paddy.

loans.name: Maa Pathar Khanden Shg Group

texts.en:
In 2012, 10 women from a small village in the Sonepur district in Odisha stepped out and formed a group named Maa Pathar Khanden SHG Self Help Group. They help each other, share their problems and solve them among themselves. They celebrate their festivals together in their village. 

One of the women from this group is Kaushalya (the lady standing with her hand raised). She is the leader of the group and she has 10 goats. She purchases the goat kids from the market and takes care of them. She provides vaccine and fodder to them when required. She sells them for meat to the local butcher shops when they grow. It takes eight to nine months for her to raise and sell them. She goes out in the morning to leave the goats grazie in the fields and returns by noon. Then she cooks for her family. She resumes taking care of her goats by feeding them at home. Her husband assists her in selling and maintaining these goats. In this way, she is earning to improve her cash flow, which is not sufficient to manage her daily activities. She wants to enlarge her business, so she wants to purchase 10 more goats. In this way, she can earn a good amount after all expenditures in her business. She and her group members have requested a loan of 150,000 INR for her group so that they can all earn more and improve their families' cash flow.

loans.use: To purchase goats, fodder and vaccine

loans.name: Sri Sai Shg Group

texts.en:
Laxmipriya is a 42-year-old lady who lives with her husband, parents-in-law and two children ages 15 and 10 years old in a small village in Khurda district in Odisha state, India. In the picture, the lady seated with her hand raised is Laxmipriya. She is engaged in paddy cultivation. Her husband is doing the same business. 

Some years ago, Laxmipriya formed a group with seven other women from her village and named the group "Sri Sai SHG" self help group. All the group members are engaged in different business activities like selling milk, vegetable cultivation, etc to alleviate their poverty. Laxmipriya is the president of this group. She motivated all the group members to form this group so they could help and support each other in their business and personal lives. Laxmipriya, along with her group, requested a loan of 120,000 INR. She will use her portion to purchase standard quality seeds and fertilizers for her paddy cultivation. She hopes to build a house for her family and she is very grateful to Kiva for this opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase standard quality seeds and fertilizers for her paddy (rice) cultivation.

loans.name: Maa Santoshi Group

texts.en:
Rasmita is the leader of a group that hails from  Bolangir Town in the Bolangir district of Odisha, India. She is a 31-year-old married woman. The member seated first from the left in the first row raising her hand is Rasmita.  She is running a tailoring unit in her locality. Her husband is doing auto repair work and sometimes is driving an auto from the railway station to town. Rasmita has a family of five members consisting of her husband and two sons (10 and 3 years old)  and a daughter who is  6 years old. 

Rasmita, along with 12 other members from her locality formed a group and applied for a loan to Mahashakti Foundation to expand their existing businesses. It is the first time the group will take a loan from MSF.

Out of their small income, Rasmita is maintaining her family in a low profile. At present, her monthly income is about Rs 8,000 but still it is not sufficient to meet the needs of her family. After learning the business procedures and knowledge, she wants to increase the volume of her business. Now she wants a loan to purchase a Pico machine for stitching.

In the future, she wants to have a stall of her own in her locality. 
 
The other 13 members of her group (Pramila, Rajani, Jani, Minati, Minu, Pinki, Mamata, Sunita, Kasturi, Kalpana, Sanjukta, Subasini & Kishori) also want a loan for different purposes like doing a milk business, auto rickshaw transportation, a tailoring business, a Xerox business and a tiffin business.

loans.use: to purchase a Pico machine for stitching.

loans.name: Narendra

texts.en:
Narendra is 31 years old and a differently able man who lives with his parents, wife and three children in a small village in the Bolangir district of Odisha State, India. He has owned a grocery shop in his house for the last four years. He earns 4,000 INR per month from his grocery shop. He sells rice, flour, edible oil, biscuits, sugar, spices etc. His father is a farmer. His father helps him in his grocery shop. Narendra has a plan to expand her business by adding some more basic household products and purchasing running stock in bulk so he can manage his stock for 15 days.

Narendra has applied for a loan to purchase rice, flour, edible oil, biscuits, sugar, spices in bulk and milk-made products. He hopes that now he can fulfill the demands of his customers and make a handsome amount of money. He wants to give his children a quality education.

loans.use: To purchase rice, flour, edible oil, biscuits, sugar, spices in bulk, and milk-made products.

loans.name: Bimalei Shg Group

texts.en:
Lajarani is a 44-year-old housewife from the Puri district of Odisha, India. In the picture, the lady seated with her hand raised is Lajarani. She is the president of the Bimalei SHG. Her husband is a vegetable vendor and earns 4,000 INR per month, which is insufficient to cover the family's household expenses. Lajarani wanted to share the burden of her husband. So she formed a self help group of 12 members and convinced them to work on a piece of land  to cultivate and sell their harvest in the village. She was successful in this small step taken by her to grow more vegetables on a larger scale and sell fresh vegetables, not just in her village but also in the nearby village. She hopes to be a vegetable dealer and supplier of the village who can supply all the demand of the vegetable market. Therefore, she requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and vegetable baskets.

She is very happy and grateful to Kiva and its lenders for this kind opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and vegetable baskets.

loans.name: Uttarayani Shg Group

texts.en:
Uttarayani SHG Self Help Group is composed of 10 women from a small village in Odisha, India. All the members of this group are involved in activities such as vegetable cultivation, milk selling, paddy and maize cultivation, etc. They are very hardworking women with a willingness to learn new business trends.They all help and support each other. Whatever they are earning from their businesses is used for their monthly household expenses. 

One of the group members, Bimala, is the president of this group. The lady seated with her hand raised is Bimala. Bimala is 34 years old and lives with her husband, parents-in-law and two children who are 10 and 6 years old. She does vegetable cultivation. She produces vegetables like tomatoes, potatoes, cauliflowers, brinjals, lady fingers, onions, etc. and sells them at the market. Her husband is a farmer. Her husband helps Bimala in vegetable selling at the market. Bimala is planning to buy standard quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides so she can produce more vegetables and can increase her income. Bimala, along with her group members, is asking for a loan amount of 150,000 INR to invest in their business activities. Bimala will use her portion to purchase standard quality seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides for her vegetable cultivation. She wants to give a better education to her children. She says, on behalf of the group members, "Thank you, Kiva, for providing this opportunity for us!"

loans.use: To purchase standard quality seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides

loans.name: Anand Chandra

texts.en:
Anand Chandra is a 32-year-old differently able person. He lives with his parents and his wife. He is a responsible son and is determined to do well in his business to support his parents. He has a small grocery store in his village for which he pays a monthly rent of 500 INR. He is selling food items like rice, lentils, biscuits, toothpaste, bathing soap and spices. He has to travel every three days to the nearest market to get more stock. 

He wants to reinvest in his grocery store so that he can stock more inventory at his shop to meet the demands of the local people and reduce his transportation and buying costs. He says that buying in bulk will allow him to avoid his frequent travel to buy stock and will help him get the stock at a cheaper price from the wholesaler. This will increase his earning capacity. Anand Chandra has requested a loan of 30,000 INR to purchase more of what he is selling right now in order to increase his inventory level. He also wants to add more variety to his existing product line by buying more brands of spices and cooking oil. He says that the presence of more than one brand of an item at his shop will help him reach out to an increased customer base. With the increased cash flow, he is sure he can take good care of his parents and give them a good life in their old age.

loans.use: To buy more stock of items like lentils, rice, and spices.

loans.name: Ishrat

texts.en:
Ishrat is a 56-year-old woman, living with her four children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
Her son has been driving an auto rickshaw, which does not belong to him. With the help of savings he tried to purchase a used auto rickshaw, the engine quality was good, but the body was totally damaged. This is the reason he decided to buy a new rickshaw, instead of used rickshaw. He does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy new rickshaw. He wants to start driving, but finding the lump sum amount is difficult.
Therefore. Ishrat has requested a loan for her son so he can buy new rickshaw and drive it with joy.  She hopes that now her son will be able to generate constant income. She is very happy after receiving this loan; she thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees is 42 years old, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a the responsible mother of a daughter. Her husband has been running his own business of furniture making and polishing for past twenty years. Balqees is also running her own tailoring business, both husband and wife contribute their income to manage the house hold.
Balqees's husband needs to buy different types of accessories for his business, e.g. polish, oil, wood, etc to fulfill his business needs. Due to insufficient financial capital he is unable to buy these items for his business.
Therefore, Balqees has requested for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount she will provide financial assistance to her husband so that he can easily purchase these items.
For this financial aid Balqees is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy accessories for her husband's furniture polish Business.

loans.name: Faridah

texts.en: Faridah is a 51-year-old woman; she has been doing business selling crockery for many years. She offers various types of crockery such as glasses, dinner sets, bowls etc. Over the time she has attained good number of customers and makes sufficient amount of income to contribute in the family income. For the improvement of her business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 45,000. In this way she would be able to purchase more variety of crockery such as tea sets, bowls and glasses in various sizes and designs. She is expecting boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of crockery such as tea sets, bowls and glasses in various sizes and designs.

loans.name: Alia's Group

texts.en:
Alia is a 46-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly, because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to a lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. 

Therefore, Alia has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Alia is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Bushra has successfully built her business of beauty parlor with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials.  Over the time she has attained regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute in the family income. She needs to deal more customers time after time. For this reason she applied a loan of PKR 45,000 through Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more beauty products including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams. The loan would enable her to cater to a large number of customers efficiently. She is in her 4th loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams.

loans.name: Aliya

texts.en:
Aliya is a 36-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of two daughters. Her husband is an IT Technician by profession; he has been doing a job in a private sector IT Company for many years. He is a guardian of the family and responsible for managing the household.

Aliya wants to start her own business, a coaching center. For this purpose, she needs to buy some furniture and renovate her place of business. But due to financial constraints, she is unable to incur these expenses to fulfil the needs of her coaching center business. Therefore, Aliya has applied for a Kiva loan from the field partner BRAC Pakistan. 

With the help of this loan amount, she'll be able herself to incur the expenses related to her business operations so that she can start her business as soon as possible. Aliya is very happy and thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy furniture and renovate her coaching center business.

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed is a 55-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two children. Her son is a rickshaw driver by profession and provides transportation services to the passengers.
For a long time he has wanted to replace his old rickshaw's body. Because of this he is unable to attract passengers due to the ugly looking vehicle and to generate any amount of income. He wants to replace the old body with a new one as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of funds, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of the new rickshaw body. 
Therefore, Khursheed has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her son to cover the cost of the rickshaw body. This will help him to continue his business. She is so very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: To buy rickshaw body for her son.

loans.name: Sobia's Group

texts.en:
Sobia is a 36-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last year. 

For many days Sobia's husband's rickshaw has not been working properly, and because of this he has been unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing rickshaw. Therefore Sobia has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help her husband continue his business. Sobia is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair the rickshaw her husband drives for a living

loans.name: Amtul Hafeez

texts.en:
Amtul Hafeez is 34 years old and is the mother of 3 children.  She lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

She sews the bags along with her husband and daughter at home and the business is operated out of her home. She has 2 sewing machines for sewing handbags, which she operates with her daughter. Her husband deals with customers, taking orders from them and sewing the bags on order.

She wants to buy an additional sewing machine for sewing bags but does not have enough cash on hand. Therefore, Amtul Hafeez has requested a Kiva loan through field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can buy a new sewing machine and additional raw material, such as rexine, zipper, buckles, etc., for sewing bags. Her desire is to sell her bags directly on the market, so that she can get maximum reward for her efforts. 

She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and raw material for sewing handbags.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Nusrat is 44 years old and the mother of three children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a housewife who looks after her family at home. Her husband sells dairy products like milk, curd, and butter. He owns a small dairy farm that consists of buffaloes and cows. He sells milk daily to different tea stalls. He is an honest man. He manages his household expenses from his earnings from milk sales. He speaks with an even tone that is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of his clients. He was in need of one buffalo to increase his income. So, Nusrat requested a loan. In this way she can support her husband's business. Nusrat thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for milk sale business.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 40-year-old woman residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of five children. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband provides services in making shutters for buildings. Her husband needs raw materials such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets for manufacturing iron accessories and to improve his shuttering work. 

So that he can generate more income for the financial support of his family, Asia is applying for loan from Kiva's field partner for her husband's work. She is thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy raw material such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets for shuttering work.
